loans.name: Santos Agapito

texts.es:
Santos de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, elabora zapatos y los vende a los almacenes o tiendas de la "bahía” (lugar utilizado por los comerciantes para vender su mercadería a un muy bajo costo). 


Cuando Santos tenia 15 años el tío lo llevo a trabajar a un taller de zapatería, hay el pegaba los broches en los zapatos, después de un tiempo le gusto esa actividad, hasta cuando creció que ubico un pequeño taller de fabricación de zapatos en su casa. Trabaja de lunes a domingo haciendo zapatos de mujer y hombre. 

Para seguir con la producción de zapatos el quiere comprar con el préstamo pegamento y cuero. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas el taller y tener empleados.
texts.en:
Santos, 34, lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil. He is a shoe maker. He sells his items to stores or warehouses in “La Bahía” (a place that merchants use to sell merchandise at very low cost). When Santos was 15 years old his uncle took him to work in a shoe shop. His task was to attach the buckles onto the shoes. After a time he began to enjoy his work and when he grew up he established a small shoe making shop in his home. He works from Monday through Sunday making women’s and men’s shoes. To continue with shoe production he wants to use the loan to buy glue and leather. In the future he’d like to expand his workshop and hire employees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For leather and glue.

loans.name: Pocitos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Pocitos”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 11, consta de ocho integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora Teodora como presidenta, la señora Valentina como tesorera y la señora Clara como Secretaria de Actas.

La  señora presidenta, tuvo como negocio el tejido de mantas a pedido. La venta se realizaba en su domicilio, lo mismo que la producción.  Más o menos comenzó su negocio cuando ingresó a Pro Mujer por primera vez, es decir que ya tiene cuatro años en el rubro. Su primer crédito fue de Bs.500.- con el que compro lana para elaborar las mantas. Su solicitud actual es de Bs. 2000.- para iniciar otro negocio, que es la venta de “Salchipapas” (comida rápida, compuesta de papas fritas, trozos de salchichas fritas y aderezos como mayonesa, mostaza, llajua.

Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella ya está más de cuatro años en su asociación.

Las integrantes de la A.C. “Pocitos” tienen diferentes negocios, entre ellos: venta de comida, venta de salchipapas, venta de cosméticos, venta de calzados, tejido y venta de mantas
texts.en:
The “Pocitos” (Little Wells) communal bank is starting its 11th cycle. It has 8 members led by Teodora, President, Valentina, Treasurer and Clara, Recording Secretary. Madame President had a business weaving blankets on order. Sales as well as production took place at her home. She more or less started the business when she joined Pro Mujer for the first time, that is to say, she’s been in this line of work for 4 years. Her first loan was for Bs.500 that she used to buy wool to make the blankets. The current loan request is for Bs.2000 to start another business: Salchipapas sales (fast food consisting of fried potatoes with pieces of fried sausage and dressings like mayonnaise, mustard and llajua, a spicy tomato and chili sauce). With respect to her history with Pro Mujer, she’s been in her association for over four years. The members of the “Pocitos” communal bank have a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, salchipapas sales, cosmetics sales, shoe sales, blanket weaving and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cooking oil, potatoes and sausages.

loans.name: Benjamin Oswaldo

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, tiene una relación libre, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos de las edades de 12,8 y 5 años todos dependen económicamente de él, tiene un Grupo Musical.
El negocio lo inicio con ayuda de familiares, quienes inculcaron el trabajo, el grupo musical está integrado por cuatro hermanos, ellos los contratan para eventos como son cumpleaños y fiestas especiales, una de las dificultades es que no cuentan con dinero para compra de instrumentos musicales, por cual están solicitando un préstamo, el cual ayudara en el negocio ya que podrá contar con el instrumento en nuevos y en buenas condiciones para continuar trabajando.
Las aspiraciones de Benjamín son que el grupo musical crezca y tengan éxito, lo cual les permitirá atreves de este trabajo generar mejores condiciones de vida a la familia.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 31 years old and he lives in the Concepcion Batres municipality of the Usulután region. He lives with his girlfriend and life long companion and their three children, aged 12, 8 and 5 years old. They all depend on him financially. He is part of a musical band. He started up his business with the help of his family; they instilled the love of music in him. The musical group is made up of four brothers. They play at special events such as birthdays and parties. One of the challenges they face is not having funds to purchase musical instruments, for which reason he requests a loan. This loan will help his business because he will be able to purchase new instruments, in good condition, so that they may keep playing. Benjamin's aspirations are to make his band larger and to find success. He will be able to provide for his family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new musical instruments.

loans.name: Jehova Jihere Group

texts.es:
EL BMC JEHOVA JHIRE  SE CREO CON  AYUDA DE UNA SEÑORA QUE YA HABIA  ESTADO EN OTRO BANCO DE CONFIANZA DE  FAPE, SE FORMO HACE DOS MESES CON DIEZ INTEGRANTES.
LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL DE LAS SOCIAS ES EL COMERCIO ENTRE ELLOS ESTAN, VENTA DE ZAPATOS, HUEVOS, ROPA, TAMALES, TORTILLAS,LEÑA,PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, VIDRERIA, FRUTAS Y VERDURAS.
 
BLANCA Z. ES PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO TIENE 40 AÑOS ES CASADA TIENE 6 HIJOS Y CINCO DE ELLOS ESTUDIAN EN UNA ESCUELA DE LA LOCALIDAD.  ELLA VIVIE EN UNA COMUNIDAD URBANO-MARGINAL GRANDE  Y SE HA CATALOGADO COMO AREA ROJA  PERO QUE GRACIAS A DIOS  NUNCA LA HAN EXTORCIONADO  Y HA PODIDO SALIR ADELANTE CON SU NEGOCIO.         EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE QUE TIENE ELLA ES QUE SUS HIJOS SE GRADUEN DE  LA UNIVERSIDAD Y SEAN PERSONAS DE BIEN.
 
EL NEGOCIO DE ELLA ES  VENTA DE LEÑA EL CUAL LO INICIO HACE 19 AÑOS. ELLA SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS  PRODUCTO.  YA QUE LA MAYORIA DE LAS PERSONAS DE LA COMUNIDAD ELABORAN SUS PROPIAS TORTILLAS Y LAS COCINAN CON LEÑA.
EL SUEÑO DE ELLA ES QUE SU NEGOCIO CRESCA Y PUEDA EXPANDIRSE EN TODA LA COMUNIDAD DONDE VIVE.
texts.en:
The Jehova Jhire communal bank was created with help from a woman who had already been a member of a FAPE communal bank. It was formed two months ago with ten members. Commerce is the main activity of the members among which are: shoe sales, egg sales, clothing sales, tamales sales, tortilla sales, firewood sales, beauty product sales, glazier services, fruit and vegetables sales. Blanca Z. is group president. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children five of whom go a local school. She lives in a large marginal urban area which has been classified as a red zone. Fortunately, though, thanks to God, she’s never been harassed and has managed to have a successful business. Her greatest wish is that her children graduate from university and become upstanding citizens. For 19 years she has been in the firewood sales business. She is asking for funds to buy more firewood because most of the people in her community make their own tortillas and they cook them with firewood. Her dream is that her business grows and she can expand it throughout the community where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María trabaja como empleada domestica, hace tiempo se separo de su esposo, sus hijos ya son grandes y están casados, y ella vive sola en una casa que ah ido construyendo poco a poco con ahorros, ella requiere de este préstamo para colocar una losa en uno de los cuartos de la casa de la señora María. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida y sentirse mas segura en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María works as a domestic employee. She separated from her husband a long time ago. Her children are all adult and married. She lives alone in a house she’s been building little by little with her savings. She needs this loan to install stone flooring in one of the house’s rooms. María is a very hard working woman who wants to have a better quality of life and feel more secure in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For concrete paving stones.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia tiene una tienda de abarrotes llamada “Abarrotes Laura” y ella lo atiende todo el día, su esposo  el señor Ernesto es pensionado y entre los dos le han hecho algunas mejoras a su vivienda, ellos tienen una familia muy unida y sus hijos y nietos pasan el fin de semana ahí en la casa, la señora Lucia necesita este crédito para reparar el techo de la casa ya que con las lluvias tan intensas que cayeron en días pasados el techo de daño y es urgente repararlo ya que la humedad esta deteriorando sus muebles que con mucho esfuerzo han comprado.
texts.en:
Lucia has a grocery store called: “Abarrotes Laura” that she tends to all day. Her husband, Ernesto, is retired and the two of them have done some home improvements. They have a very close-knit family and their children and grandchildren spend weekends there in the house. Lucia needs this loan to repair the roof on the house because the intense rainfall of the last few days damaged the roof and repairing it is urgent because the humidity is deteriorating the furniture which cost them so much effort to buy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: A. Christine est née en 1981 à Savè dans le département des Colines au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKANRIN François, Christine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine vit avec sa famille au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple s'est installé dans ce quartier il y a juste un an. Christine apporte une aide financière à son mari en l'aidant dans les charges du ménage, grâce au revenu de son activité. Il y a près de sept ans que Christine s'est mise à vendre des produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. Christine fait ses provisions à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. C'est la deuxième fois que Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux servir sa clientèle. Le premier prêt obtenu par Christine a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Christine A. was born in 1981 in Savè, in Benin’s department of Colines. She is married to François HOUNKANRIN and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Agbodjèdo in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. The couple moved there just a year ago. Christine’s business income allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling cosmetic products as an itinerant vendor almost seven years ago. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and also in Lomé, located in Togo. This is Christine‘s second time seeking a loan with ALIDé to strengthen her business and better serve her customers. The first loan she was granted was repaid without incident.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo R. González es un hombre mus trabajador pues el tiene como oficio ser peluquero actividad que realiza desde 12 años, también es padre de dos pequeñas a las que desea dejar un buen patrimonio. Gustavo en este momento desea poner piso cerámico en la recamara  para darle una mejor vista, pero para esto el necesita comprar el material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Gustavo R. González is a very hard working man. He has been a barber for 12 years. He’s also the father of two little girls to whom he wants to leave a good estate. Gustavo wants to install tile flooring in the bedroom to improve its appearance. He needs the loan to buy materials and to pay labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in the house.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura S. es madre de dos pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Para darles mejor protección desea un préstamo para realizar su proyecto; como lo es levantar la barda alrededor de su casa pues la que tiene es de madera, pero con las lluvias ha ido deteriorando. Laura y su esposo trabajan lo suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Laura S. is the mother of two little ones for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. To give them better protection she needs a loan for a project consisting in erecting a wall around her house because the one she currently has is wood but it has been deteriorating due to the rains. Laura’s and her husband’s work is sufficient to be able to cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To erect a wall.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la fotografía el esposo.

Carolina G. González inicio una construcción hace tiempo que realizo con ahorros propios pero no le alcanzo para terminarla. La señora desea terminar para poder extender su casa y asó tener mas espacio en su vivienda para realizar su proyecto ella necesita comprar material  pagar mano de obra. Su esposo es el que mantiene los gastos el trabaja como chofer de taxi.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is the husband. Carolina G. González started building onto her house a short time ago using her own savings but ran out of money before she could finish. She’d like to finish the project thus being able to enlarge her home and have more space. To complete the project she needs to buy materials and pay labor costs. Her husband, who works as a taxi driver, is covers household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
La persona que aparece es la esposa del solicitante

Oscar Omar Díaz F. se dedica a cortar cabello para hombre en una peluquería muy conocida en la ciudad casi todos los 7 días de la semana.  El señor es un hombre muy responsable que quiere ofrecer a su esposa e hijos una mejora calidad de vida. El baño que tiene esta en muy buenas condiciones solo que quiere darle mejor vista es por eso que quiere colocar piso cerámico.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is the borrower’s wife. Oscar Omar Díaz F. works as a barber in one of the city’s best known barber shops almost all 7 days of the week. He is a very responsible man who wants to provide his wife with a better quality of life. Although their bathroom is in very good condition he wants to give it a better appearance so he wants to install a tile floor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.
El señor  Omar G. se dedica  a la  albañilería desde hace 30 años y solicita préstamo para construir un techo al frente de su casa; el comenta que en temporadas de intensas lluvias el agua entra a su vivienda, lo cual ocasiona que algunas de sus cosas materiales se mojen. Para que su casa quede cubierta el necesita comprar el material ya que por su larga experiencia en la albañilería el solo lo podría hacer.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is the borrower’s wife. Mr. Omar G. has been a bricklayer for 30 years. He is asking for a loan to build a roof on the front of his house. He comments that during seasons of heavy rainfall water comes into his house which causes some of his belongings to get wet. So that his house will be completely roofed he just needs to buy the materials since his long experience as a bricklayer will allow him to do the labor himself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on the front part of his house.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas runs a business named Legacy Cyber Café. His wife does tailoring for a living. The couple is blessed with a one-year-old son named Victor W.. 

Thomas is a member of Faulu Kenya in a group called Super Wandi. He has taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy computers. He hopes to own a business building and upgrade his business for more income so as to improve his living standards.  Thomas decribes himself as a very determined and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 22 years old. He runs Ngarua Boutique where he sells clothes, shoes, bags and belts. He got the skills for operating his business because he was previously employed in a boutique. He has been in business for four years. 

Michael joined Faulu Kenya under Mbagathi Corner Group. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management. He has also managed to purchase new goods. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more clothes and shoes for resale. He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale. In five years, he sees himself opening other outlets for his business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El señor Cristobal es un hombre muy trabajador, el se fue como muchos Mexicanos a Estados Unidos a trabajar y mandarle dinero a su esposa para el sustento de su familia, el señor Cristobal solicita este credito para reparar el techo de su casa,para que su familia este mas segura, ya que en la temporada de lluvias se daño mucho.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is a very hard working man. Like many Mexicans he went to the United States to work and send money to support his wife and children. Cristóbal is asking for this loan to repair his roof so that his family will be safer since it is damaged very much during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 48-year-old businessman who sells building materials, household items and foodstuffs in Nairobi. He has been running these businesses for the last ten years, having operated a butchery initially. He also does farming as well as rentals to earn extra income.

John has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to buy building materials for sale. He is married and a father to three, two of whom are in school. He is working very hard to become financially free and hopes to own real estate in ten years. He describes himself as enterprising.

loans.use: To add to his stock of building materials

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two grown sons. She makes a living selling household items in a market in the town of Kherson. She started this business eight years ago and now has 4,000 Grivnyas invested in her small company, from which she earns profits of 1,250 Grivnyas a month. 

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 6,200 Grivnyas to rebuilt her store and re-stock it with merchandise. She likes to keep her business organized and neat because this helps attract customers. She loves her work and is fully committed to her entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: to rebuild and restock her store

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sonia Patricia es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y su expareja trabaja en Estados Unidos y le envia dinero para la manutencion D. sus hijos, la señora sonia vive sola con sus pequeños pero el cuarto donD. viven es muy chico y ella tiene planes D. construid uno mas, para mejor comodidas D. su familia, la señora sonia quiere ir contruyendo el patrimonio D. sus hijos poco a poco y espera que podamos apoyarla.
texts.en:
Sonia Patricia is a single mother. She has two children; her ex-partner works in the United States and sends child support money for the children. She lives alone with her little ones but the room they live in is very small. She plans to build an additional room for more comfort for her family. Sonia wants to gradually build assets for her children and hopes we can help her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married, has two children and makes a living repairing shoes. He has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns about 7,000 Grivnas a month.

Alexander's business is located in his house, where he uses one room to do shoe repairs. Things are going well because he has no competition, loves his job and does it well. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to improve his workspace by fixing his roof and raising it so that he has more workspace.

loans.use: to repair and expand his workspace

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Rosario solicita este credito para la compra de utiles escolares y uniformes de sus dos hijos, ella trabaja como obrera en una maquiladora de la localidad y su esposo el Señor Roberto trabaja en una empresa como contratista, son una familia muy unida y ellos quieren la mejor educacion para sus hijos. es por eso que solicitan el apoyo y agradecen este credito.
texts.en:
Rosario is asking for funding to buy school supplies and uniforms for her two children. She’s employed by a local assembly plant and her husband, Roberto, works in a firm as a contractor. They are a very close-knit family and want their children to have the best possible education. This is why they are asking for support and are grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a Nairobi-based businessman who makes a living buying and selling scrap metal to companies who recycle it to make various products. He has been in this business for more than one year and believes his prospects are good. He is 42 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He hopes to earn enough money to provide his children with the best education possible and also own a scrap metal yard within the next ten years. He has requested for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy more scrap metal to sell. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metal to resell

loans.name: Edith Stefanie

texts.es:
Edith de 23 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, ella vende ropa y perfumes por catalogo. 

Una amiga la inscribió en una compañía de venta de ropa por catalogo, tuvo que seguir esta actividad por su hijo ya que no esta casada,  trabaja desde muy temprano de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana se va a pueblos a vender productos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y perfumes para surtir mas la mercadería. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para la mejor venta y asi asegurar el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Edith, 23, lives the urban El Paraiso neighborhood of Guayaquil. She sells clothing and perfumes through a catalog. A friend got her to sign up with a company that sells clothing by catalog. She had to continue this activity for her son, since she is not married. She works every day from the early morning hours from Monday until Friday, and on the weekends she goes to the towns to sell her products. With the loan she wants to buy clothing and perfumes to increase her inventory of merchandise. In the future she wants to have her own store so that she can have better sales and in this way secure the future of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is a businesswoman who makes a living selling cereals in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last three years and employs one person. She also earns additional income from various part-time jobs. Dorcus is 38 years old, married and has three children. She hopes to expand her business so that she can earn enough money to meet all of her family's needs and open up a wholesale business where she sells cereal to other companies. She is applying for a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more cereal to sell to her customess. She describes herself as reliable, hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is based in Nairobi, Kenya, where he operates a general store from which he sells flour, soap, vegetables, eggs, sugar, rice and cereals. He has been in this business for seven years and says things are very busy. He is applying for a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more cereal to sell to his customers. Robert is 30 years old, married and the father of one young child. He believes that one reason for his success is that he is very friendly to his customers. His long-term goals are to open a wholesale shop, build a home for his family and then build other houses that he can rent out.

loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell to his customers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier S. I. tiene un negocio de abarrotes desde hace dos años, donde ofrece refrescos, botanas, dulces y también ofrece entretenimiento para los niños como son los juegos de video.
El señor es una persona de edad adulta muy responsable junto con su esposa que le apoya con los gasto vende pulga en su casa. El crepito que solicitan es para comprar mas mercancía y así generar utilidad.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco Javier S. I. has had a grocery business for the past two years, where he sells soft drinks, snacks and sweets, and also children's entertainment such as video games. He is a mature and very responsible person, as is his wife, who supports him with expenses by selling second-hand goods from their home. The loan will be used to buy additional merchandise and thus generate income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica V. G. cuenta con un negocio de papelería y mercería llamado “Mónica” con este negocio tiene un año para incrementar sus ingresos también  cuenta con una peluquería llamada “Ramírez”. La señora es una mujer muy trabajadora a pesar de ser madre soltera ha podido sacar a sus hijos adelante,  pensando en ofréceles una mejor calidad de vida.
Mónica solicita que se le apoye para surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima compra de listas escolares.
texts.en:
Mónica V. G. has a stationery and haberdashery shop called "Mónica”. She has given herself a year to increase her income from this business. She also has a hairdressing salon called “Ramírez”. She is a very hard-working woman. Although she is a single mother she has been able to bring up her children, and is always thinking of how she can offer them a better life. Mónica is seeking the loan to stock up her business with school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es: La señora Laura Elena M. Hernández esta preocupada por el bienestar de su madre pues esta pasando por una enfermedad, lo cual los doctores le están  requiriendo que sea operada. Laura esta muy agradecida con la persona que la crío desde pequeña y que ahora se ve en circunstancias muy ajenas a ella. Laura recurre a esta institución para que se le apoye en el problema que ella tiene, aunque su esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi no cuentan con todo el dinero que le están pidiendo para hacer la operación.
texts.en:
Señora Laura Elizabeth M. Hernández is worried about her mother's health, as she is ill and the doctors say she must have an operation. Elizabeth is very grateful to her mother, the woman who raised her since she was tiny and whom she now sees in a state so unlike herself. Laura has come to the field partner Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP) for help. Although her husband works as a taxi driver, they would not be able to find enough money for the operation on thier own.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An operation for her mother

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Elena Departamento de Usulután, tiene una relación libre, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de la edad de 28 años, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
El negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, ella también elabora tamales con ayuda de la madre y se dedica a cuidar y venta de cerdos, ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra de concentrado para cerdos y contribuir a mejorar la condiciones de vida de estas personas, para generales trabajo e ingreso.
Los sueños son hacer crecer el negocio y apoyar a la familia para generar las mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old and she lives in the Santa Elena municipality of the Usulután region. She lives with her boyfriend and life partner and their 28-year old son. She raises pigs. She started the business under her own initiative. She also makes tamales with her mother's help. But she cares for and raises pigs, for which reason she is requesting a loan. She will purchase feed for the pigs and she would like to improve the family's living conditions. Her dreams are to make her business grow and to support her family to improve their way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Grace Jennifer

texts.es:
Grace de 20 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de Guayaquil (caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas), no ha tenido un ingreso propio por esos ha comenzado a vender ropa por catalogo. 

Debido a la falta de oportunidades ella vende todo tipo de ropa para solventar sus gastos personales, trabaja en grupos de vendedoras de lunes a viernes, ellas recorren las calles de Paraiso promocionando la ropa por catalogo. Como a veces se va a otos lugares a vender la ropa tiene miedo de los accidente de transito ya que no tiene un vehiculo.  

Par seguir con sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y perfumes. En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa y hay ubicar su negocio.
texts.en:
Grace is 20 years old, and lives in an area called Paraíso de Guayaquil on the outskirts of that city. The area is characterised by its mountains and dirt roads. Not having her own income before, Grace has started selling clothes through a catalogue. Owing to the lack of other opportunities, she sells all kinds of clothes to meet her personal expenses. She works in a team of sales women from monday to Friday, going round the streets in Paraíso promoting the catalogue's clothing. She occasionally goes to other locations to sell the clothes, although she worries about bus crashes because she doesn't have her own transport. To continue her sales, Grace wants to buy clothes and perfumes with the loan. In the future she would like to buy her own home and locate her business there.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purses, clothes, perfumes

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, les resultó muy fructíferas  e interesantes por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre La Amistad debido a que todas son amigas, vecinas y por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 17  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
 Todas las integrantes son luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de ellas es la señora Viviana quien se dedica a la cofeccion de ropas para damas y cabelleros, ella es una mujer trabajadora y dedica gran parte de su tiempo al dia a la cofeccion de ropas que ella recibe con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Agradece por la ayuda que encuenta en la Fundacion, y solicita el prestamo para la compra de telas para los pedidos con que cuenta actualmente.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari, a group of women got together, some with the goal to capitalize on their activity and the other to undertake productive activities, a meeting was organized to get a good understanding of the program and it resulted productive and interesting because of the benefits the program provides. The committee's name is “La Amistad” (the friendship), the name came about because they are all friends and neighbors and through entrepreneurship they will strengthen the bond between them. La Amistad is composed by 17 lady entrepreneurs who do their best to increase their income and provide the best they can to their families. All the members are hardworking and have invested the loans in their respective businesses. One of the members is Mrs. Viviana who does dressmaking and tailoring, she is a hardworking woman and uses large part of her time making clothing to fulfill client orders. She is thankful for the help she finds in Fundacion Paraguaya and requests a loan to buy fabric to finish the current orders.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other materials for dressmaking and tailoring

loans.name: Oswaldo Arturo

texts.es:
Oswaldo de 40 años, es vendedor informal de ropa en los pueblos, vive en un sector llamado “Esmeraldas Chiquita” ubicado alrededor del estero salado del Sur Guayaquil.

Para poder mantener a su familia el comenzó como vendedor de ropa en el sector donde vive pero como quería mas ingresos comenzó a viajar a los pueblos y promocionar la ropa. Las blusas las vende a $ 5.00, camisetas a $ 7.00, conjuntos de vestidos $ 10.00. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar mas mercadería como blusas, camisetas y vestidos. En el futuro el quiere construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Oswaldo, 40, is an informal clothing merchant in the towns. He lives in a neighborhood called “Esmeraldas Chiquita” (Little Emeralds) located around South Guayaquil’s estuary. He started selling clothes in his own neighborhood to support his family but because he wanted to increase his income he started to travel to the towns to offer his clothes there. He sells blouses for $5.00, undershirts for $7.00 and dress sets for $10.00. To continue in his work he wants to buy more merchandise like: blouses, undershirts and dresses. In the future he’d like to improve the construction of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es: El Sr. Dámaso , se dedica a la actividad de trasporte publico, viene trabajando hace 6 años en el rubro  de transportista y a la vez trabaja en un  radio móvil de la ciudad  de Santa Cruz, que queda ubicado por la radial 13 ,nació en la ciudad de la Paz, el trabajo que desempeña de transportista  lo aprendio desde muy joven ,sus primeros pasos lo realizo  en la ciudad de La paz ,trabajando como chofer de micros .Hoy en día tiene su propio  automóvil,  Con el crédito que se le esta otorgando   lo establecerá en la compra de material de construcción para su vivienda.  En un futuro quiere que su trabajo  crezca mucho mas,  ya que tiene pensado comprarse otra línea en el mismo radio móvil.
texts.en:
Dámaso has been providing public transportation services in a radio dispatched taxi in the city of Santa Cruz for 6 years. He’s located around Radial 13. He was born in the city of La Paz and learned how to be a taxi driver at a very young age. His first steps providing transportation services took place in La Paz working as a microbus driver. Today he owns his own car. The loan that will be granted is to buy building materials and supplies for his home. In the future he wants his business to grow more because he plans to buy another taxi for the same radio dispatch service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 22 años, reside en el Municipio de El Transito, Departamento de San Miguel, Es soltero, vive la madre y el se dedica a la venta de pollos listos para cocinar.
El negocio lo inicio gracias a la ayuda de la mama ya que ella siempre se ha dedicado  a la venta de pollos, no tiene horario de trabajo, de las dificultades que  tiene actualmente es el no contar con dinero para compra de materiales para construir una galera para los pollo. Por lo cual el está adquiriendo un préstamo para compra de madera, clavos, laminas, comedor para pollos y una parte en compra de pollos de engorde. Esto contribuirá a mejorar y ampliar la granja, así poder incrementar las ventas, los riesgos es que bajen las ventas o los pollos se enfermen y mueran.
las aspiraciones son tener una granja grande y ser un distribuidor mayorista de pollos listos para cocinar, trabajar y apoyar a la madre para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 22 year old and he lives in the El Transito municipality of the San Miguel region. He is single and he lives with is mother. He sells chickens. He started out his business with his mother's help. She has always sold chickens as a business. He has no fixed work schedule. The challenge he faces is the deficiency of funds to purchase building materials to build another chicken coop, for which reason he requests a loan. He will purchase wood, nails, aluminum sheeting, chicken feeders, and to purchase more chickens. This initiative will help him expand his farm and it will translate into greater sales. He always faces the risk of having his chickens fall ill. His aspirations are to have a large chicken farmer and to be a wholesale distributor. He wishes to keep working and to support his mother and improve the family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood, nails, aluminum sheeting, chicken feeders, and chicken livestock.

loans.name: Dionicio Rostico

texts.es: El Sr. David, se dedica a la actividad de trasporte publico, viene trabajando hace 8 años en el rubro  de transportista y a la vez trabaja en un  radio móvil de la ciudad  de Santa Cruz, que queda ubicado por la radial 11 ,nació en la ciudad de Sucre, el trabajo que desempeña de transportista  lo aprendio desde muy joven ,sus primeros pasos lo realizo  en la ciudad de La paz ,trabajando como chofer de micros .Hoy en día tiene su propio  automóvil,  Con el crédito que se le esta otorgando   lo establecerá en la compra de material de construcción para su vivienda desea ampliar su casa y dar mas comodidad a sus hijos.  En un futuro quiere que su trabajo  crezca mucho más,  ya que tiene pensado comprarse otra línea en el mismo radio móvil.
texts.en:
David works providing public transportation. He has worked as a transport driver for 8 years, and he is affiliated with a mobile radio dispatcher in the city of Santa Cruz, located in radial district 11. He was born in the city of Sucre, and he started learning the profession of transport driver when he was a very young man. He took his first professional steps in the city of La Paz, working as a microbus driver. Today, he has his own automobile. With the loan that is being offered to him, he will invest in buying construction materials for his house. He wants to expand his house and provide a more comfortable environment for his children. In the future, he wants his work to expand much more, since he is thinking of buying another line in the same mobile radio system.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Maji Manuel

texts.es:
Maji de 38 años, tiene un local de comida típicas, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijas y a su esposa que le ayuda en el local. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el comenzó a trabajar vendiendo legumbres en el mercado llamado “Montebello”, poco a poco con los ingresos generados y ayuda de su esposa pudo alquilar un local para tener su negocio de comidas típicas.  Ahora el trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere pagar la pensión escolar de sus dos hijos y algunos libros. En el futuro quiere terminar de construí su casa y tener su negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Maji, 38, has a typical fast food stand. He lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso, Guayaquil. He has two daughters and his wife helps out in the eatery. Due to the lack of employment opportunities he started out selling vegetables in the Montebello Market. Gradually, with profits generated here and help from his wife he was able to rent a locale to set up his typical fast food business. Now he’s open for business from 6:30am until 10pm. He wants to use the loan to pay for his children’s school fees and some textbooks. In the future, he’d like to finish building his house and have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition and textbooks.

loans.name: Arasa Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Salmi Nicanora M. V. –Hugua Rey  GEA.
 Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina ARASA POTY están en el cuarto Ciclo con 14 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento D. responsabilidad con la institución.
 Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso D. sus emprendimientos.

La Sra. Salmi Nicanora posee una pequeña granja en la que cría animales como gallinas, patos, vacas, para venta y producción D. leche. Así también posee cultivos para autoconsumo y consumo D. animales.
Está interesada en incrementar sus ingresos mediante la adquisición D. más animales menores como gallinas para engorD. y posterior venta. 
Igualmente desea adquirir más alimentos balanceados para una mejor producción tanto D. carne como D. leche, la cual es muy bien comercializada y genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The present committee was started by Mrs. Salmi Nicanora M. V. –Hugua Rey GEA. She contacted her neighbors and friends to set up a committee in the area. The committee is called ARASA POTY and they are in their 4th cycle with 14 members. It’s a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified and responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit since they are up-to-date with their repayments and intend to finish this stage with a good show of responsibility towards the Institution. Being able to access credit opens many doors for the progress of their enterprises. Mrs. Salmi Nicanora has a small farm where she raises chickens, ducks and cows for milk production and sale. She also grows crops both for her own consumption and for animal feed. She is interested in increasing her income buying more small animals like chickens to raise for subsequent sale. Similarly, she wants to acquire more nutritionally balanced feed for better meat and milk production which are good sellers and produce good income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad reside en el municipio de El Transito, departamento de Usulután, es casado, vive con la esposa tiene dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 13 años, la esposa dedica a la elaboración de tortillas y el tiene un vehículo para transportar gente.
El inicio el negocio con ayuda de un amigo quien le enseño el trabajo su horario de 6:00am-6:00pm una dificultad que enfrenta es el no contar con el dinero para darle mantenimiento al vehículo, cambiar la pintura y compra de repuestos, por cual está solicitando un préstamo que le permita tener en buenas condiciones el vehículo, satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y dar un buen servicio de transporte.
Las aspiraciones son que el negocio crezca para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de la famililla.
texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old and he lives in the El Transito municipality in the region of Usulután. He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children, aged 4 and 13 years of age. His wife makes tortillas and he has a car that he uses as a taxi. He started out his business with the help of a friend who taught him the line of work. He works from 6am to 6pm. The challenge he faces is not having enough funds to maintain his car in good condition, neither to repair the body nor to purchase spare parts, for which reason he requests a loan. This will permit him to have his vehicle in good condition and be able to meet his clients' demands and provide them with good service. His aspirations are to have a larger business and improve his way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and provide maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Aldo Gustavo

texts.es:
Aldo Duré de 23 años de edad, trabaja y estudia, el mismo vive en casa de su madre en  Capiata -ruta II km 18 del barrio Santo Rey.
Este joven se vio obligado a abandonar sus estudios regulares hace aproximadamente 3 años ya que no podía su madre sustentar sus estudiosy debía por tanto el generar ingresos adicionales para continuar sus estudios.
Aldo comenzó a trabajar dejando el colegio, actualmente se halla cursando clases aceleradas en el Colegio San Nicolás, como además de pagarse sus estudios debe ayudar en la casa se halla atrasado en el pago a sus cuotas motivo por el cual no está pudiendo dar exámenes y solicita asistencia crediticia para regularizar su situación y poder rendir.
texts.en:
Aldo Duré is 23 and he works and is in school. He lives in his mother’s home in Capiata-route II, kilometer 18, in the Santo Rey neighborhood. 3 years ago this young man had to abandon his regular schooling since his mother could no longer support him and he needed to generate additional income to continue his studies. Aldo began to work and he left his studies but currently he is taking accelerated classes in the San Nicolás school. Besides paying for his classes he must help with expenses at home and he is now behind with his payments and he can’t take the exams. He is requesting a loan to straighten out the situation and to be able to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make monthly payments

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David, se dedica a la actividad de mecánico , viene trabajando hace 20 años en el rubro de forma autónoma desde hace 1 año por la zona de bajo olivo , el señor David  nació en la cuidad de santa cruz de la sierra, el trabajo que desempeña de mecánica lo aprendio desde muy joven. Hoy en día tiene su propio taller de mecánica   y su demanda que tiene son los radio móviles de la zona (Avenida Santos Dumont y otros lugares). Con el crédito que se le esta otorgando comprara una escáner ,que le servirá para arreglar y detectar  de manera mas rápida las falencias que tiene el motor ,con respecto a fallas eléctricas En un futuro quiere que su negocio crezca mucho mas, para lo cual necesitara  ampliar sus instalaciones a futuro. Actualmente tiene una vagoneta que le ayuda a transportar sus herramientas y a la vez para auxiliar a algunos de sus clientes que tienen fallas en sus motores.
texts.en:
David has been a mechanic for 20 years and has worked independently for the past year in the Bajo Olivo zone. He was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra and learned how to be a mechanic while still very young. Today he owns his own machine shop and his services are highly sought after by taxis in the area (Santos Dumont Avenue and other places). The loan that will be granted will be used to buy a scanner that will help him detect and repair electrical engine problems more quickly. In the future he wants his business to grow much more and he needs to enlarge his facility for this to happen. He currently has a van that helps him transport his tools and provide emergency assistance to some of his customers when they have engine failures.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a scanner for his machine shop.

loans.name: Nelcy Yanett

texts.es: La señora Nelcy P. de 29 años vive en el municipio de Malambo donde vende ropa cosmético y calzado, ella habita en este municipio con su cónyuge y con su hijo de 7 años. Desde muy joven sabe mucho de  negocio porque en la ciudad de Montería, departamento de Córdoba,  ayudaba a su hermana hace 8 años y de allí se trasladó  Barranquilla para estudiar ingles y mercadeo. Ahora desde hace 4 años  vende  cosméticos mediante guías especializadas de estos productos, y también maneja  revistas porque adquirió la experiencia como comerciante desde muy joven.  Nelcy espera con el tiempo tener su propio local, aprovechando la ubicación estratégica que tiene en el municipio de Malambo  y poder superar su desafío mas grande, que es  la falta de capital para responder a las necesidades y deseos  de muchos clientes pues por eso   ha perdido  un número importante, debido a que no cuenta con el stock de mercancías suficiente para satisfacerlos inmediatamente. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en la compra de  una docena de calzado, suéteres y jeanes y el dinero restante en productos cosméticos que encargaron pues maneja 5 revistas y su énfasis es la ropa femenina, deportiva y masculina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelcy P., 29, lives in the town of Malambo where she sells clothing and cosmetics. She lives here with her spouse and 7-year-old son. From a very early age she learned much about business because 8 years ago she would help her sister in the city of Montería, Córdoba department. From there she moved to Barranquilla to study English and Marketing. Now, for the past four years she has sold cosmetics using specialized catalogues for these products and she also sells magazines that she learned how to sell while very young too. Nelcy hopes in time to have her own store taking advantage of the strategic location she enjoys in the city of Malambo and to overcome her greatest obstacle which is the lack of sufficient capital to meet her customers’ needs and wishes. She has lost a significant number of customers because she didn’t have enough stock on hand to meet their needs immediately. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy a dozen shoes, sweaters and jeans. With the remaining funds she will buy cosmetics that she has pending orders for since she deals with five catalogues with emphasis on women’s, men’s and athletic clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dozen shoes, sweaters and jeans.  With the remaining money to buy cosmetics that customers have ordered.

loans.name: Maria Liliana

texts.es:
Maria López de la ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo, tiene 24 años de edad, está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad del Norte sede Cnel. Oviedo.
Ella tiene 3 hermanos  de 32, 30 y 26 años respectivamente, todos están estudiando también en la UNINORTE.
Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es guardia de seguridad.
Liliana actualmente trabaja como cajera en un copetín en el centro mismo de la ciudad para poder solventar sus gastos de estudio.
Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y llegar a ser una excelente profesional de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia a mejorar su nivel de vida, especialmente a sus padres.
Solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad que asciende a 462.000 G. mensual y también para el pago de derecho de exámenes del semestre, Liliana agradece por el apoyo a la Fundacion Paraguaya y a Kiva por tan importante apoyo ya que de esa forma ella puede seguir estudiando y de esa forma lograr concretar sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria López is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is 24 years old and is in her fourth year of studying Law in the Universidad del Norte's Coronel Oviedo campus. She has 3 brothers who are 32, 30 and 26 years old. They are also all students at UNINORTE. Her mother is a housewife and her father is a security guard. Maria Liliana is working right now as a cashier in a snack shop in the town center in order to pay for her education expenses. She really wants to finish her major and be an excellent professional and thus increase her income and help her family to improve their quality of life, especially her parents. She is asking for the loan in order to pay her department's monthly tuition which is upward of 462.000 G. a month. It is also for the semester's exam fees. Liliana is thankful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and to Kiva for their important support so that she can keep studying and in this way achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay monthly tuition and exam fees

loans.name: Luis Albert

texts.es: El Sr. Luis y su esposa Ana Celia  se   dedican  a la atención de una Licorería,   viven en la  casa  de un  familiar,  tienen una hija de ocho añitos. Además el señor Luis  percibe otro ingreso por que da a trabajar su vehículo o a veces el  lo trabaja, y el crédito actual es para la compra de un motor y reparación de su vehículo. El Sr. Luis C., es una persona  que trabaja mucho junto con su esposa, se esfuerzan para salir adelante por el bienestar y futuro de su hija, esta muy agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Luis and his wife, Ana Celia, run a liquor store. They live in a family member’s house, and they have an eight year old daughter. Luis also gets another income from letting others work in his vehicle, and sometimes he works with it. The current loan is to buy a motor and to repair his vehicle. Luis C. is a person who works a lot together with his wife. They try very hard to get ahead for their daughter’s well-being and her future. He is very grateful for the trust shown in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor and to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La señora Dulce Maria C. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que desea estar preparada para la venta, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para sacar a delante a sus tres hijos y darles el estudio necesario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dulce Maria has been selling new and used clothes for the past six years. She is asking for a loan in order to buy winter clothing, as she wants to be prepared to sell these items. At this time she doesn’t have the money to buy these clothes. She is planning on paying back the loan with her business earnings. These earnings are the source of support for her three children and the means of providing them with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. San Rafael D. Oriente, departamento San Miguel, Es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y tiene dos hijos D. las edades D. 10 y 7 años, ellos dependen económicamente del negocio D. María, ellas dedica a crianza y venta D. cerdos.
El negocio lo inicio gracias a la ayuda D. su papa, quien siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería, no tiene horario definido, ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo compra D. cerdos, concentrada y fertilizante para cultivar maíz. Esto le permitirá fortalecer mas el negocio, realizar sus cultivos D. maíz.
Las aspiraciones son crecer el negocio y obtener buena cosecha en su cultivo apoyar a sus hijos y generarles mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and she lives in the Ran Rafael municipality in the San Miguel region. She is a single mother and she lives with her parents. She has two children aged 10 and 7 years old. They are financially dependent on her alone. Maria's business is raising pigs. She started the business thanks to her father's support. He has always been a pig farmer. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule. She requests a loan to purchase a few more pigs, their feed, and fertilizer to cultivate her corn fields. This will permit her to strengthen her business and to cultivate her corn fields. Her aspirations are to make her business grow and to have a good harvest, to support her children and improve their way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs, pig feed, and fertilizer for the corn plantations

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El Sr.Alexander, Mecánico de Oficio, biene desarrollando esta actividad desde hace 10 años atrás y de forma independiente desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, claro que esto no hubiera sido posible sin la ayuda de su familia los cuales son su impulso diario en esta muy dificil labor. En los ultimos meses y gracias a su desempeño y entrega constante a su trabajo Don Alexander empezó a incrementar su clientela, desde clientes comunes hasta transportista del sector urbano (Micros y Taxis), motivo por el cual se acercó a nuestras oficinas ya que el todavia no contaba con algunas herramientas necesarias e impresindibles en su taller tales como una tecla y un caimán lo suficientemente grandes como para poder trabajar con micros y camiones pequeños. Don Alexander no cuenta con Créditos en otras Instituciones y biene trabajando fielmente con nosotros desde hace ya un tiempo atráz, además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido por la Parada final de las lineas 48  Valparaiso, motivo por el cual no se le negó dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Alexander, a mechanic by trade, has been doing this type of work for the past ten years. He has had his own business for the past two years. Of course, this wouldn’t be possible without the help of his family, who motivate him each day in this difficult job. In the last few months, thanks to his work ethic and ability to deliver his customer requests, Mr. Alexander has begun to increase his customer base. From common customers to commercial transportation owners (microbuses and taxis), they all have come to his business. He still needs some necessary and essential tools for his auto shop such as a hydraulic floor jack and a block and tackle system that are large enough to allow him to work on microbuses and small trucks. Mr. Alexander has no loans with other organizations and has loyally committed himself to our community bank for a long time. Even though he has never had a loan, he has a well-known auto repair shop at the final bus stop of the Valparaiso 48 bus line. This is why his request for a loan was accepted.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General tools for his auto repair shop and he will buy a lift.

loans.name: Lucinda Maria

texts.es: Lucinda María  H. vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos de 28 a 33 años, en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde interactúan los negocios formales e informales y escenarios deportivos como el Estadio Metropolitano donde se juega el mejor futbol de Colombia. Lucinda   se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas como perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos a los que agrega las mas deliiosas salsas que ella misma aprendió a preparar  en el año 1993, mientras tenia una miscelánea. En su actual negocio  trabaja desde las 5:00 AM a 5:00 PM y los días viernes, sábados, domingos y días festivos;  ella dice que la forma higiénica, delicada y la sazón con la que   prepara sus alimentos, agregándole un trato amable a sus clientes,  son la base de sostenimiento de sus clientes, por eso   no la cambian por otra; en su microempresa trabajan ella, su cónyuge y tres empleados , sus compras las realiza una vez por semana exactamente el día jueves, para que estén muy fresco sus productos. Lucinda ha recibido14 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 17 años, los cuales le han servido para mejorar sus ventas, adecuar su vivienda y aumentar su calidad de vida  y la de su hogar y eso hace que ella y su familia sean muy felices y permanezcan unidos. En la actualidad solicita su credikiva para comprar embutidos, cárnicos y refrescos para la preparación de sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucinda María H. lives with her husband and 3 children (between 28 and 33 years old) in the community of 20 de Julio in the city of Barranquilla--a place where formal and informal businesses interact with sports events at the Estadio Metropolitano (metropolitan stadium), site of the best soccer in Colombia. Lucinda makes and sells fast foods such as hot dogs, hamburgers, sausage and fries, and shish kabobs, to which she adds the most delicious sauces that she herself learned to make in 1993, when she had a general store. At her current business she works from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays. She says that the sanitary, delicate, and flavorful way in which she prepares her food and the friendly service she provides to her customers are what sustain her business--that's why her customers don't buy from anyone but her. Her small company consists of Lucinda, her husband, and three employees. She buys her ingredients every Thursday so that her products are very fresh. She's received 14 loans with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo over the course of the last 17 years, which have helped her improve her sales, renovate her home, and improve her family's quality of life so that they're happy and are able to remain together. She's currently requesting a Kiva loan to buy sausage, meat, and soft drinks for the preparation of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meats and soft drinks to make her products

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo G. tiene ya mas de cinco años con su negocio de reparación y
, mantenimiento y venta de llantas para autos. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar herramienta y material que le esta haciendo falta y por el momento no quiere descapitalizar su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
Don Guillermo ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual a pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo G. has had his Tire (reparation, maintenance, and sales) business for over five years. He is taking out a loan to buy tools and materials he needs and at the moment he doesn't want to dip into his businesses' capital. He plans to pay back the loan partly with his business earnings since this is his and his family's source of income. Mr. Guillermo has taken out a loan with FVP and paid it back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by tools and materials.

loans.name: Family (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Family está formado por 8 socias quienes con el esfuerzo diario de su trabajo han logrado sacar  adelante a sus familias. Nuestras socias viven en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad  más importante del Ecuador,  su riqueza arquitectónica y cultural es muy grande, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente muy cálida y amable.

La Señora. Ángela Lucia B. vive por el sector de la universidad Politécnica, este es su segundo ciclo con los créditos de la fundación y ha sido su hermana quien  la invito a formar parte de la  banca comunal. Los créditos la han servido mucho en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta  de productos Avon, actividad que la desempeña hace un año, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, vende sus productos  a sus amigos y familiares, también se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos desde que tenia 15 años, en este trabajo tampoco tiene un horario fijo ya que sus jefes lo único que le piden es que realice su trabajo con responsabilidad.
Doña Ángela tiene 34 años, es  casada y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 13 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus tres hijos estudias en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión latonero (arreglo de las latas de los vehículos), no tienen casa propia y vive en casa de su mamá pero  independientemente. Su  nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en más cosméticos y su sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.

La Señora María Eugenia M. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 49 años, está separada de su esposo hace 2 años y tiene una hija de 24 años de edad que esta  estudiado en la universidad la carrera de veterinaria, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María se dedica al arreglo de casas, actividad que la viene realizando desde muy joven y le ha ayudado a sacar a su familia adelante, también hace 2 años se dedica a la cría de cuyes los que vende en su casa. Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes. Su meta es ayudarle a su hija que termine la carrera universitaria y su sueño es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Family Communal Bank is made up of 8 members who have managed to get ahead with their families through the daily effort that they put into their work. The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important city in Ecuador, and has great architectural and cultural treasures, a varied cuisine, and very warm and friendly residents. Ángela Lucia B. lives near the polytechnic university. This is her second loan from the foundation; it was her sister who invited her to join the communal bank. The loans are very helpful for her business. Ángela makes a living selling Avon products, and has been involved in this activity for one year. She doesn’t have a fixed work schedule, but sells her products to her friends and family. She also makes a living doing domestic chores, an activity that she has performed for 15 years. This job doesn’t have a fixed schedule either, since all that her employers ask is for her to do her work responsibly. Ángela is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 18, 16, 13, and 11. Her oldest daughter works and helps her financially, while the three younger children study at a school in the city. Her husband works at a body shop (he repairs the car bodies). The family doesn’t have its own house and lives in the home of Ángela’s mother, though they are not dependent on her. Ángela’s new loan will be invested in more cosmetics. Her dream is to have a house of her own. María Eugenia M. lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. She is 49 years old, and has been separated from her husband for 2 years. She has a 24-year-old daughter who is studying to be a veterinarian at the university. They don’t own their own home, but live in a rented house. María makes a living cleaning houses. She started working in this activity when she was very young and it has helped to get her family ahead. For the past 2 years she has also made a living raising guinea pigs, which she sells at her home. She is on her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to invest in purchasing more guinea pigs. María wants to help her daughter complete her university studies, and her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Avon cosmetics/ Purchasing guinea pigs.

loans.name: Nancy Griselda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Nancy Gricelda F. le esta haciendo falta la barda al frente de a su casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejor.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le preocupa la seguridad de ella y su hijo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una como empleada de una compaña de copiadoras.
texts.en:
Nancy Gricelda F. needs to build a wall in front of her house, but she doesn’t have the funds necessary for purchasing the material and for paying someone to make the improvement. That is why she is requesting a loan, since she is worried about her son's and her own safety. Nancy plans to repay the loan with the income she receives from her job as a maid at a photocopier company.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the wall in front of her house and putting in a concrete floor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roció Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Roció Georgina F. tiene ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que requiere el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio. 
Doña Roció ya ha tenido mas de seis créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente
texts.en:
Roció Georgina F. has made a living selling groceries for more than eight years. This business is her family’s source of income. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase merchandise, since right now she doesn’t have the money that she needs to invest in her business. Roció plans to repay the loan with the profits from her business. She has had more than six loans with Kiva partner FVP and has repaid them punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for her grocery business

loans.name: Elavil

texts.en:
Elavil L. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Elavil owns and operates a canteen. The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods, such as hot cake and ice candy, to customers in the local community. Elavil has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elavil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elavil is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for making snack foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elavil from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making snack foods

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria F. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Ma. Victoria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Victoria owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit in the local community. Ma. In 2010, Ma. Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Ana Karina M. que es la fundadora y presidenta del banco. Tiene 32 años de edad y está casada hace 15 años,  tienen tres preciosos niños que son su razón de vivir. Estudió Ciencias de la Educación en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí y espera licenciarse en el mes de Diciembre.

Según nos cuenta divide su tiempo tanto para su trabajo como para su hogar, ya que sus hijos están pequeños y necesitan muchos cuidados.

En la actualidad se dedica al comercio y además es profesora contratada, dice que vende muchos productos como zapatillas, ropa de mujer y además productos de Yanbal, (una revista de productos de belleza, perfumes y otros accesorios) Su forma de vender es por pedidos y también ofrece sus productos puerta a puerta, tiene muchas clientes fijas como por ejemplo  sus compañeras de trabajo.
Nos dice  que al principio tuvo momentos difíciles por que compro mucha mercadería y se quedo desfinanciada es así como se reunió con otras señoras y formaron el banco el cual la ayudado mucho tanto a ella como también a las otras socias.

Este nuevo préstamo lo va invertir en comprar zapatillas ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Nuestra socia también tiene otros créditos que ofrece la fundación Espoir, dice que le gusta esta  Institución por la facilidad que tiene para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son licenciarse, ejercer su profesión, que no le falte trabajo y especialmente mejorar su calidad de vida mas que todo por sus hijos.
texts.en:
The community of Bellavista is located in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which was known for several years as the city of tamarinds. The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank conduct their meetings here.

The staff of Fundación ESPOIR had the chance to speak with Sra. Ana Karina M., the founder and president of this Communal Bank. She is 32 years old and has been married for 15 years. Ana and her husband have three precious daughters who are her reason for living. She is studying for a degree in Education at the Technical University of Manabí and expects to graduate in December. Ana divides her time between her work and taking care of her home, which includes looking after her children, who are still young and require a great deal of attention.

At the moment, she spends time operating a retail business in addition to her teaching job. She sells several products including shoes, women’s clothing, and merchandise made by Yanbal (a company that offers beauty products, perfumes, and other accessories through catalogs). Ana sells by taking orders and offering her products door to door. She has many established customers, which include her co-workers.

Ana says she had difficulty at first because she had little money left over after buying large quantities of merchandise. Forming a Communal Bank with the other ladies in her group has been a great help to her as well as the rest of the members.

This new loan will be used to buy shoes since she has many orders for this type of merchandise. Ana has had other loans through Fundación ESPOIR. She enjoys working with the Institution because of the ease in securing credit.

Ana’s goals are to graduate with her degree, continue with her profession, gain experience through her job, and improve the quality of life for all of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Gwaan, Brgy. Balaring, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: dressmaking, fish vending and RTW businesses. Her husband Eduardo D., who is 59 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children aged between 13 and 33. 

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosemarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 9000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing 19000 PHP, for a screen for the house and to buy more clothes to sell so she can continue to save for the future and have her own dress shop someday. 

Rosemarie D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell
