He purchased a new car and used it as a taxi in 2009. He is a hard-working and diligent person.  He hopes to one day establish his own car repair center. Tsogtgerel is requesting a 2,800,000 Mongolian tugrug loan to purchase raw materials used in his wooden products business.

loans.use: To purchase a raw materials

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik S. was born in 1973. He lives with his mother in Vanashen village, in the Ararat area. He has secondary school education and now works at a gas-filling station in Ararat city.

At the same time, Arayik and his mother engage in animal husbandry. On their farm they have calves, sheep, pigs and chickens. Thanks to the income from farming Arayik supports his family and develops his farm. He seeks a $3,000 loan to buy eight or ten calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy eight or ten calves and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony M. is a 40-year-old gentleman who is married to Caroline Wacera. He repairs broken electronics in his shop which is within the Dandora area. His business is in the urban area and his clients are middle-income earners who live within his area of business operation.

Antony learnt about KADET from his friend; he joined a group and is now accessing his first loan. He will use the loan to add more electronics spares to his shop.

Antony hopes to venture into the transport and real estate industries in the future.

loans.use: To add more electronics spares to his stock

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard K. is 50 years old and lives in the city of Vanadzor with her husband and her daughter.

Alvard is a teacher and she worked at kindergarten for a long time. Now, she and her family engage in their own business: flower trading. They have been running this business for five years already and they like it very much.

Alvard asks for a 600,000 AMD loan which will allow her to organize souvenir trading in the same shop. She wants to sell small gifts that can be sold with the flowers.

Part of Alvard's income from the business is spent for the family’s needs and another part she invests in her business. She hopes that souvenir trading will enable her to increase the number of her shop’s clients and thereby she will make a bigger profit in future.

loans.use: To add souvenir trading to her shop

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice T. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and some dried fish to sell.

Joice is 58 years old and is widowed with eight children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal and some dried fish to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice S. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and fruits such as oranges, passion fruits, etc. She is requesting a loan to stock dried and fresh fish to sell.

Joice is 31 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: To stock dried and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is a 31-year-old married lady and a mother of three children between the ages of 7 and 13. She is a professional tailor, and she operates her business from the busy and greatly populated areas of Githurai and Eastleigh, which are on the outskirts of Nairobi city. She normally takes home a profit of about 20,000 KES, and additional income comes from her husband’s business.

Grace was introduced to KADET by another client, and she has now applied for her first loan, which she will use to expand her tailoring business by buying more fabric and items needed in her tailoring business.

Her dream is to educate her children through the highest level possible and also expand her business to other areas.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding more stock, like fabrics

loans.name: Zainap

texts.en: Zainap J. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to stock more food for the restaurant. Zainap is 31 years old and is married, with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children, and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant by purchasing more chairs and tables to accommodate more people.

loans.use: To stock more food in the restaurant

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice G. is a lady who is married to James G., and together they have two children, ages 20 and 18. She is in the tailoring business, and she has been in this business for one year now. She says that her business is able to give her a profit of about 10,000 KES per month, and she is happy with it. She operates her business within an area known as Sukari, and most of her clients are students at the university near her business.

Eunice joined KADET after being introduced by her friend, and she is currently accessing her first loan, which she will use to buy more stock and thus offer more variety to her clients. 

She hopes to expand her business and, in the future, open a tailoring school which will boost her income.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials (fabric)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Mary is 54 years old and is widowed. She has seven children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a proper store for charcoal.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady S.  est une femme mariée de 55 ans qui habite  à Cambérene. Elle gère un magasin ou elle exerce la vente d’habits depuis plus de 3 ans déjà. Auparavant c’est son mari qui lui envoyait des habits qu’elle vendait sur le marché. Et c’est par la suite qu’elle a acquit ce magasin. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Cambérene  depuis mai 2005.Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son stock pour répondre a la demande de la clientèle en cette période  de préparation des fêtes. Ce financement lui permettra de développer  son activité, de maximiser ses bénéfices et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady S. is a 55 year-old married woman who lives in Cambérene. She manages a shop where she has been selling clothing for more than 3 years. Previously, her husband sent her the clothing that she sold in the market. Subsequently, she got this store. She has been a member of the Cambérene credit union since May 2005. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs with the goal of increasing her stock to respond to customer demand during preparations for the holidays. This financing will enable her to expand her business, maximize her profit and better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is married and mother to two children. She is a tailor and has been in the tailoring business for three years. She earns a steady income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. She serves clients from within the Githurai area.

Judith became a KADET client after being introduced by a friend. She has applied for her fist loan which she hopes to use to expand her tailoring business and introduce a training school for people interested in learning more about tailoring.

In the future, she hopes to see the training school expand and to be able to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To expand her business and offer training for tailors

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a 48 married man with three children, all in the upper level of schooling. He sells picture frames to clients who are mostly studio owners in the Kirinyaga area.

He joined KADET after being introduced by another client. He has now applied for his first loan which he will use to expand his business and make more picture frames. He would like to see his business expand to other towns with other studios.

loans.use: To expand his picture frame business

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune N. est un jeune tailleur célibataire qui habite dans la localité de Cambérene. C’était depuis son enfance qu’il a commencé à apprendre le métier de tailleur. Cela fait maintenant 2 ans lorsqu’il a ouvert son propre atelier. Son activité consiste à travailler sur commande et aussi à exposer des habits confectionnés destinés à la vente. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Cambérene depuis mars 2009. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il  sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de fournitures  qui seront destinés a renforcer ses capacités a exposer des habits en vue de la préparation des fêtes  de korité  et de tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux prendre en charge ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune N. is a young unmarried tailor who lives in Cambérene commune. He began learning the tailoring trade when he was a child and opened his own workshop 2 years ago. His business consists of custom-made clothing and ready-to-wear clothing displayed for sale. He has been a member of the Cambérene credit association since March of 2009 and has already repaid two previous loans. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 frs intended for the purchase of fabric and supplies that will be used to increase the volume of his clothing displays in preparation for the Korité and Tabaski holidays. This financing will enable him to increase his profit and better provide for his needs.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is a 29 year old woman who sells bedcovers to people around the Githurai area. She has been operating in this business for five years, taking home a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is married and mother to two children, aged nine and three years.

Jane joined KADET after she was introduced by another client. This will be her first loan cycle with KADET. She hopes to use the loan to increase her stock of bedcovers and thus have more variety for her clients.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale level and to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To expand her stock of bedcovers for sale

loans.name: Agripino

texts.es:
El Señor Agripino P. V. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Tacuara,  tiene 61 años de edad, esta casado con la  señora Margarita Silvero Fernandez de 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
 
Se dedica en la producción y venta de queso, ganadería y agricultura, tiene finca con producción bien diversificados, ganados vacunos, Excelente cliente con la Fundacion y con otras entidades Financieras.
   
El Cliente esta deseando comprar mas vacas lecheras, para mejor producción y venta de queso.
texts.en:
Agripino P. V. is from the Tacuara neighborhood in the city of San Estanislao. He is 61 years old, and he is married to 52 year old Margarita Silvero Fernandez. He has three grown children. He devotes himself to producing and selling cheese, livestock, and farming. He has a farm with well diversified production and cows. He is an excellent client with the Fundación and other financial entities. He wants to buy more dairy cows in order to improve his cheese production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows for milk production

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. is a shopkeeper who sells retail items, as well as green groceries, within the Githurai area. The tenants of the area are her clients. She is married and has one son, who is one and a half years old.

Hannah joined KADET and will now be accessing her first loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She plans to use the money to increase her inventory of green grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and others items that are running low in her retail shop.

In the future, she would like to expand and run a hotel business on the side.

loans.use: Increase her stock of green grocery items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old divorced woman living alone. In 2005, she started working as a housekeeper to earn income. She works hard to be able to satisfy her needs.  Her work is very hard and it needs physical strength.  Her story illustrates day-to-day challenges in trying to meet the heavy demands of her life's conditions.  She works upon request of the clients wanting her to clean their homes. 

Today, she is asking to borrow $800 to purchase a cleaning machine because she is planning to start cleaning companies.  She needs to have a bigger machine for this purpose. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to take on more projects.

loans.use: purchase a cleaning machine

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Benítez López tiene 46 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Encarnación vive en su propia casa del barrio San Pedro Curupayty desde hace ya varios años.

El señor Jorge trabaja como chofer en la Dirección de Obras Publicas y Servicios dependiente de la Municipalidad de Encarnación desde hace varios años. 
El tiene dos hijos y es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por mantener a su familia y dar una buena educación a los suyos. 

El está solicitando este crédito para el pago de aranceles y derecho de exámenes de uno de sus hijos que actualmente están cursando la Universidad y está entrando en época de exámenes. 

El señor agradece la posibilidad de obtener este crédito ya que mediante el podrá apoyar en la educación universitaria del hijo quien aspira a ser un buen profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Jorge Benítez López is 46 years old, and he is from the city of Encaración. He has lived in his own house in the San Pedro Curupayty neighborhood for several years. Jorge is a driver for the “Dirección de Obras Publicas y Servicios” (Public Works and Services Administration). He has been employed by the Encarnación municipality for several years. He has two children. He is a very hard-working person who has always strived to support his family and to give his loved ones a good education. He is requesting this loan to pay the fees and exam charges for one of his children. This child is currently attending the University and entering the time for exams. He is grateful for the possibility of this loan. This is the way he will be able to support the university education of his child, who aspires to be a good professional in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his child's educational expenses

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is a very aggressive 57-year-old lady. Her husband is deceased and she was left with the sole responsibility of raising her four children on her own. She sells eggs in her shop, and also cakes that she makes. She takes home a profit of about $135 per month. She has been in this business for three years now.

Veronica will be receiving her first loan of 15,000 KES from KADET after she joins one of the existing groups. She plans to use the money to buy more ingredients for her business.

In the future, she wants to expand her business by adding dairy items to sell, and she hopes to educate her children and grandchildren to the highest level.

loans.use: To expand her cake selling business by buying more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He specializes in floor polishing work. He started to operate his own business in 2002 with fifteen years of previous experience in this occupation. The challenge he is facing is in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  in order to buy a new polish machine for a project of renovating a small building. He feels positive about his future work and looks forward to taking on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: buy a new polish machine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Mengo Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she rents, where she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.
  
She operates a retail shop selling sugar, salt and soap.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days every week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from the Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise to sell, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap, as well as cooking oil.     

The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and the transportation of merchandise.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is a 42-year-old gentleman who is married and has three children. He has a printing shop on Kirinyaga road in Nairobi city center, and he normally does printing of items on bags, t-shirts, caps, pens and any other thing he is asked to print on. 

His clients vary because of the nature of the business.  He was very busy during the last few weeks because he was printing for the political people during the constitutional period in Kenya. He says that he is able to take home an income of about $500 every month which is a big plus for him.

John has been a KADET client for a while now and he is currently requesting his third loan which he will use to add more stock of the things he uses to do the printing work and also to expand his business.

He want his business to expand to other areas outside Nairobi and also to educate his children.

loans.use: To expand his printing business

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Dancan W. is a 37-year-old gentleman who is married to a lady called Shelmith, and together they have one son who is two years old. He is in the transport business where he ferries people and goods from one place to another, using his van. He is able to make a profit of about $212 per month and he has been in this business for six years.

He joined KADET after introduction by another client and he has applied for his first loan which he will use to expand his business by venturing into other areas of the central business district. 

He would want to purchase another car in the near future.

loans.use: Venturing into other areas of operation

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: La Señorita  María, es hija de una cliente antigua, ella al igual que la madre se dedica a la venta de leche natural, tienen en su domicilio cuatro vacas lecheras, una de ellas esta preñada, al margen de esta actividad ella se dedica a un trabajo en la preparación de yogurt en una microempresa de la zona de Achumani, ella es una joven que ya termino sus estudios de colegio y le gustaría seguir con una carrera Universitaria,  le gusta la actividad que realiza, los padres le apoyan con el cuidado de los animales, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de forraje, alimento para las vacas, es una muy buena clienta  por esa razón se solicita un trato preferencial con el financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
María is the daughter of a long time client. María, like her mother, sells natural milk. They have four dairy cows at their house, and one of the cows is pregnant. As a side activity she makes yogurt at a small company in the Achumani area. This young woman has finished her high school education, and she would like to continue on and get a university degree. She likes the work she does, and her parents help her take care of the animals. She will use the money from the loan to buy fodder, feed for the cows. She is a very good client, and that is the reason she is requesting a preferential interest rate with the Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 50 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 50 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Sarita es cultivar zanahorias, papa y arveja, labor que la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta Bolivia, según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene, por ello procura cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas de insectos y cuidarlas con fertilizantes. Con el tiempo espera que sus productividad mejore, para que las ventas sean más rápidas y sus ingresos económicos aumenten. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará un operario para que trabaje en la siembra.
texts.en:
Sarita is 50 years old and she has always been someone who has worked very hard in her life. She lives in her own home together with her husband Hugo, 50 years old, and their 4 children. They are the reason for all their efforts. Sarita's work is to harvest carrots, potatoes and sweet peas. She works alongside her husband who has also worked very hard to provide their kids with a good education. She has seen it profitable to go to Bolivia with her products as they become available. That is where she gets the best prices. She makes sure to provide only the best care of her plantations, warding against insects and fertilize as needed. In time she hopes to increase her productivity so that her sales will be better and her earnings increase. This is her tenth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is committed to making her payments on time, not wanting to cause any problems to her community group colleagues, where she is very well liked. With the two thousand five hundred soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizers for her fields and she will hire the help she needs in the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating her vegetable stall for the last eight years, selling at retail prices to local customers, especially neighbors and passersby. Saumu faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major aim is to become a shopkeeper in the future.

She decided to work with Yehu because of its easy policies and procedures. With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bananas, tomatoes and oranges to sell. She sells fried fish as another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, tomatoes and oranges.

loans.name: Elizabeth Anyango

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old businesswoman who is married and has four children, aged 6, 5, 3 and 1. She has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past three years with a monthly profit of approximately $62. 

This is her third loan with KADET. Previous loans were successfully paid and Elizabeth intends to use this third loan funds to buy another motorcycle. She wants to use the accumulated profit to improve her family's standard of living and to open a general store. She hopes to expand the motorcycle business to include vehicle transport in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Pedro vive en el barrio Porvenir del Municipio del el Torno de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 19 años que llego desde el departamento de Chuquisaca capital de Bolivia  en busca de tiempos mejores para su familia, su esposa con la cual tienen dos hijos, en edad escolar, por lo que  se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos los cuales son pequeños; su actividad principal es el transporte de materiales de construcción se dedica a esta actividad hace dos años, el destino del crédito solicitado es para construcción de su domicilio, necesita comprar material de construcción como cemento, pintura, tejas, etc. esta agradecido con la institución ya que le da la oportunidad de seguir creciendo económicamente y así tener un futuro mejor para su familia
texts.en:
Señor Pedro lives in the Porvenir neighbourhood of the El Torno municipality of Santa Cruz. He arrived there nineteen years ago, from Chuquisaca department where Bolivia’s capital is located, seeking a better life for his family. His wife looks after their two school-aged children. Pedro has earned his living transporting construction materials for the last two years. He plans to use the loan to build a house so he needs to buy construction materials such as cement, paint, tiles etc. Pedro is grateful to the institution since it gives him the chance to develop economically and therefore provide a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a widowed woman with three children, who all attend school.  She rents a house with no electricity or water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been running a retail shop for five years and previously was a shopkeeper for a businessman. The local community makes up the major number of customers for her business. Her greatest challenge is seasonality as she experiences low sales of most of the foodstuffs when the community harvests heavily from their farms.

With the 40,000 KES loan, Lucy wants to buy bales of wheat flour, cooking oil and major cereals such as beans and peas. She hopes someday to expand her shop to a bigger one.

loans.use: Buy bales of wheat flour, cooking oil and cereals

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys Jiménez D. P., se dedica al comercio D. ropa cosméticos y calzado, es una mujer viuda y tiene 2 hijos en las edades D. 27 y 32 años que vive cerca D. los centros comerciales del sur D. Barranquilla, donD. se encuentra el Estadio Metropolitano cuna del balónpie D. Colombia y especialmente D. la costa Caribe, donD. juega el equipo mas querido por la afición costeña: “El Junior D. Barranquilla”.

Gladys Inició su negocio en el año 2003, con pocos clientes  y en la actualidad ellos son sus amigo, vecinos y tiene mas entre referidos por ellos mismos; Gladys es una mujer trabajadora que ajusta su horario a las necesidades D. sus clientes, por eso la competencia aunque es fuerte, no pueden con ella que se mantiene firme, pues se sostiene con calidad en el servicio, ofreciendo una respuesta oportuna y así mismo como selecciona muy bien sus clientes, ellos tienen  facilidades D. pagos, ajustándole  las cuotas a sus posibilidades ya sean mensualmente, semanalmente, o por cada diez dias, etc.

El credikiva es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que tiene 4 años D. participar en sus programas; con los préstamos anteriores ha logrado aumentar su clientela porque financian su cartera y venD. mucho mas, produciendo así mismo, utilidades que la ayudan a sostener su hogar. Con esta financiación comprará  mercancía al por mayor y D. contado  según los gustos y pedidos D. sus clientes como: ropa, calzado, cosméticos, porque su sueño es tener un gran almacén y a eso se dirige su mayor esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Gladys Jiménez D. P. sells clothing and footwear for a living. She is a widow and has 2 children ages 27 and 32. She lives near the commercial district in the southern part of Barranquilla. El Estadio Metropolitano (The Metropolitan Stadium) is located here. This is the birthplace of soccer in Colombia, especially the Caribbean coast, and where the most beloved team on the coast plays: "El Junior D. Barranquilla". Gladys started her business in 2003 with few customers and now they are her friends and neighbors and those referred by them. Gladys is a hard-working woman that adjusts her schedule according to the needs of her customers. Even though the competition is strong, it doesn't affect her because she maintains her business with quality customer service by offering timely responses. She also does a good job selecting her customers, and offers them easy payment terms, adjusting the payment possibilities to monthly, weekly, every 10 days, etc. This Kiva loan is her third loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has been participating in their programs for 4 years. With these loans she has been able to increase her clientele. Because of this she sells more which is useful in helping her to maintain her household. With this loan she will buy wholesale and cash merchandise like clothing, footwear and cosmetics according to the preferences and requests of her customers. Her dream is to have a large store and she is striving her hardest to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma, de 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija Danitza de dos años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La bodega de Zulma es la primera en abrirse en su barrio, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar los productos que necesitan. Disfruta mucho de la compañía de sus clientes quienes acuden a su establecimiento, por tal le gusta mucho permanecer en su negocio. Espera en adelante, crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Zulma is 36 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her two-year old daughter Danitza. Her greatest wish is to improve their way of life. Zulma's grocery store was the first to open in her district. From 6 in the morning her doors are open and ready to welcome any early morning buyers. Customers know of the wide variety of products she stocks in her store so they don't hesitate to visit and they always know that they can find what they are looking for. She very much enjoys the company that her clients provide her in her store, reason for which she wants to keep up her business. She wants to see her business grow and be able to provide her clients with even better service. This is her eleventh loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she hopes to always make her payments on time, not wanting to cause her community bank colleagues any problems. She is well respected by them given the support she provides the group. The two thousand five hundred soles she requests will be used to purchase more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to restock her store.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, lugar caracterizado por sus caminos de tierra y montañas,  ella tiene un puesto en la calle de venta de “bolones” (plátanos aplastado con queso o cerdo en forma de balón de béisbol). 

Desde que su esposo la abandono ella inicio con el negocio de los “bolones” para poder mantener a su hija, poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo clientela. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 05:00pm hasta las 20h00pm. La elaboración de los bolones la hace con una paila de aceite hirviendo introduce los plátanos y los saca para apastarlos y así revolverlo con el queso o cerdo.  

Para tener mas clientela ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una carreta. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y que su hija termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is forty-three years old and lives in a suburban area, Fortin de Guayaquil. This is an area of dirt paths and mountans. She has a street-stall where she sells "bolones" (mashed plantains covered with cheese or pork shaped like a a baseball). She started her "bolones" business to support her daughter after her husband left her and bit-by-bit, with effort, has gained clustomers. Now she works from five in the afternoon to ten at night. She makes the "balones" with a large metal pot of boiling oil that she puts the plantains in. She then takes them out, mashes them, and then cover them with cheese and pork. To get more customers, she wants to buy a cart with the loan. In the future, she would like to expand her business and she wants her daughter to finish school successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: G.s. Funez Mendoza Group

texts.es: Ángela Martina y Alejandrina Gloria  conforman al grupo solidario Fúnez M. tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que se sienten muy satisfechas de mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de los financiamientos. Ambas tienen una pulpería, en el caso de alejandrina  tiene más experiencia en el negocio y así aconseja a su amiga Ángela para saber administrar su negocio y además se ayudan en comprar nuevos productos para ofrecerlos en sus pulperías, pues juntas han mejorado su actividad a base de puro sacrificio. Este financiamiento es destinado para comprar golosinas, lácteos, detergentes, golosinas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ángela Martina and Alejandrina Gloria make up the communal bank "F. M.." They have been working with the Fundación for a long time, and they feel very pleased to have been able to improve their quality of life through these loans. Both of them have grocery stores. In the case of Alejandrina, she has more experience with the business and so she gives advice to her friend Angela on how to run the business. The loans help them to buy new products to offer in their stores, and together they have increased their businesses as a result of pure sacrifice. This loan will be used to buy snacks, dairy products, detergents, sweets, and staple grains.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products for their grocery stores

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a married woman with five children who all attend school. She owns a house with no electricity but it does have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been operating her tailoring business for the last five years, selling at retail prices to her neighbors and passersby. She sells secondhand clothes as her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Jemima decided to work with Yehu so as to get financial assistance to boost her business. With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase fabric, materials and Khangas (traditional African cotton cloth). Her major goal of working with Yehu is to operate as a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, materials and Khangas.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en: Njira is single woman with three children who attend school. She has operated a vegetable stall for 10 years. Previously, Njira worked in a food kiosk. With the kshs. 30,000 loan, she wishes to buy building and construction materials for her vegetable stall. She sells her vegetables to the community around her home and experiences the challenge of transportation and seasonality. She hopes to build a house and be a landlady in the future. Njira owns her home which has neither electricity nor water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy building and construction materials for her stall

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: Kabuo K. est  trésorière du groupe  Nyota, âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, son mari est chauffeur d’un particulier. Tous ses enfants étudient. Elle est vendeuse de saucettes. Elle a commence avec  son fond propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 5 ans qu’elle exerce cet activité. Avec ce crédit, elle compte achète un ballon de saucettes. Elle ambitionne accroitre son épargne pour accéder a un grand crédit de volume un peu élevé. En outre, elle projette acheter une parcelle pour y construire. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. La cliente Kabuo K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique. Cette photo contient des figures de leur coéquipiers du marché membre de Hekima qui sont confortable avec la photo d’ensemble.
texts.en:
Kabuo K. is the treasurer of the group Nyota. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a private chauffeur. All of her children are in school. She is a seller of saucettes. She started off with her own funding received from her husband and has been in this business for five years. With this loan, she intends to buy some saucettes. She displays her merchandise at the central market of Virunga. Her ambition is to increase her savings in order to have access to a little bigger loan. In addition, she plans to buy a plot of land on which to build. Kabuo K. is thankful for Hekima and its actions on behalf of poor citizens excluded from traditional banks. The photo shows their teammates from the market, a member of Hekima, who are comfortable with group photos.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Saucettes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El Señor Adrián Vive en la localidad de el torno distante a 39* km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 15 años que llego al departamento de santa cruz en busca de trabajo, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, en los valles de Bolivia, tiene su domicilio  en el barrio Bolivia, de la localidad, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, de la carpintería, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, el crédito solicitado es para terminar de comprar un lote de terreno, donde funciona su carpintería, trabaja hace 8 años en este rubro, con el cual a mantenido a su familia, y a comprado su propia vivienda, el se siente feliz por ser parte de la familia de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Adrian lives in the El Torno area, a distance of 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. It was 15 years ago when he arrived in the Santa Cruz department looking for work. He is a native of the Cochabamba department, in the valleys of Bolivia. He has his home in the Bolivia neighborhood in his area. His wife helps him with his carpentry business. They have 3 school-aged children. The loan he requests is to complete the purchase of a lot of land where he has his carpentry business. He has been in this line of work for 8 years, and with this work he has supported his family and bought his own house. He is pleased to be a part of the family of our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a lot of land

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is happily married to a businessman. She has four children, one in secondary school, two in primary school and one infant. She has been selling clothes in a shop for the past 10 years. Lucy also gets income from mobile phone charging from her house which has an electricity connection. With the kshs. 40000 loan, Lucy wants to buy bales of clothes. She experiences the challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell clothes wholesale in future. She owns her home which has both electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: Buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Sandra Ruth

texts.es:
Sandra P. tiene 39 años y vive en la ciudad de Bogotá la capital de Colombia, allí tiene su negocio de vender telas, confeccionar cortinas y lencería, actividad con la que ha logrado sostener su hogar  y especialmente a su único hijo de 16 años, a quien sueña con verlo convertir en un profesional exitoso.
Sandra inició su negocio cuando se independizó de su madre hace 2 años, porque desde muy joven trabajó con ella el oficio de confecciones y venta de telas , ahora logró tener un local donde exhibir su mercancía  y vender los productos de lencería  que ella elabora y con los cuales ha tenido mucha cogida entre sus clientes, porque aprovecha  que además en los alrededores de este negocio,  no existen otros que desarrollen la misma actividad así que está muy bien ubicada, en la zona comercial del sur de Bogotá  en el barrio Bosa. En la actualidad reúne todas las condiciones para hacer un credikiva, pues necesita surtirse para la segunda temporada del año, época en la que mas concurren los clientes a su negocio, porque viene las fiestas prenavideña como la del   amor y la amistad,  las ya conocidas navideñas y por esta razón su negocio  debe estar provisto de telas e insumos para la confección de cortinas, elaboración de manteles y  otros productos con motivos navideños que tiene encargados y que también necesita exhibirlos para venderlos. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y continuar ampliando su negocio mediante un surtido muy moderno y actualizado como le piden sus clientes, porque ella siempre ofrece lo que está de moda.
.
texts.en:
Sandra P., age 39, lives in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. That is where she has her business of selling fabrics and making curtains and linens. With this activity she has managed to support her household, especially her only child, age 16. She dreams of seeing him become a successful professional. Sandra started her business when she became independent from her mother two years ago. Ever since she was very young she has worked at the job of making and selling fabrics. She has now managed to have a place where she displays her merchandise and sells the linen products that she makes. Her products have been very well received by her customers. She benefits from the fact that there is no one else in the surrounding area that does the same activity that she does. She is very well located in the commercial area in the southern part of Bogotá in the Bosa neighborhood. She currently meets all of the conditions to have a Kiva loan. She needs to stock up for the second season of the year. During this time more customers gather at her business. The before Christmas festivities like St. Valentine’s Day, as well as the Christmas festivities, are approaching. That is why her business needs to be supplied with fabric and supplies to make curtains, tablecloths, and other products with Christmas motifs that she is responsible for. She also needs to display them in order to sell them. Her dream is to have her own house. She also dreams of continuing to expand her business with a very modern and updated stock that her customers request. She always offers what is in style.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and supplies to make curtains, tablecloths, and other products with Christmas motifs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a married to a businessman with five children all of whom attend school.She has been operating her retail clothing-sales business for the last ten years. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes and purchase tools for her hardware business. Her other source of income is from the rental of wheel carts and wheel barrows. She hopes to become a big supplier in future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to upgrade and improve her living standard. Anna lives in a rental house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and tools for her hardware business.

loans.name: Bettsy

texts.es: Bettsy, de 24 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Franklin de 30 años y su querido hijo, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Bettsy ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de La Merced, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo  comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, hará limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Bettsy is 24 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband, Franklin, 30 years old, and their beloved son. She wishes to provide them with a better quality of life. She a great deal of effort Bettsy has managed to work the fields and make them very productive. She cultivates coffee and bananas, products that she later sells in wholesale at the La Merced market. What she likes most about her work is caring for her fields. She has been working at this business for the past 4 years. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport the products all the way to La Merced market. The sacks are very heavy and it makes her very tired. In time she hopes to purchase more land to expand her plantations. This is the third loan she requests from MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been very punctual with her payments in the past and she hopes to keep up her record. She is a very involved member of her community bank, always aware of the business agreements of the group. With the two thousand nuevos soles she requests she will clear her field and hire the help that she needs to care of the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire the help that she needs to work the plantations.

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es: Ramiro Antonio de 28 años, tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Comenzó hace 2 años con su negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo, pues ha puesto mucho empeño en este medio de vida el sale a vender sus productos de manera ambulante, ya que así obtiene más clientes nuevos. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche  todos los días. Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar una gran variedad de productos y así mejorar cada día su actividad. En el futuro quiere trasladar el negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ramiro Antonio is 28 years old and his business is the sale of general merchandise. He started it 2 years ago, and with the passing of time it's grown. He has invested a lot of effort and determination into this way of earning a living. He sells his products as a mobile vendor; that's how he gets new customers. He works from 6 in the morning to 7 at night every day. To be able to continue with his business, he'd like to buy a wide variety of productos to improve his daily activity. In the future he'd like to operate the business out of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, D. 35 años, es una madre D. familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Silverio D. 67 años y sus 5 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Catalina ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café y plátano los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. La Merced, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Disfruta mucho trabajar en el campo, la tranquilidad que tiene, auqnue lo difícil es labrar la tierra, pero depenD. D. ello para obtener uno buenos productos. Con el tiempo espera mejorar sus tierras para plantar más café. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Catalina is 35 years old; she is a very loving and hard working Mom. She lives in her own home together with her husband, Silverio, 67 years old, and their 5 youngest children, to whom she hopes to proviD. a better quality of life. Working arduously Catalina has managed to have successful harvests. Every morning she wakes very early to water and proviD. the care needed to her coffee and banana plantations. She sells her products in the city of La Merced where she earns the best price for them. She enjoys working in the fields and the tranquility that they possess. Although the difficult part is having to labor in the fields she knows that it is the only way to have excellent products. In time she hopes to purchase more land to plant more coffee. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She knows that this loan will help her considerably in the progress and development of her business. She is ready to make all her payments on time. In her community bank group she is a very responsible member and she is very well liked. The three thousand nuevos soles she requests will be invested in her plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola con un movimiento comercial considerable. Pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en el distrito donde vive y gracias a los ingresos que le genera sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia con su economía diaria. Esta actividad tiene mucha demanda por la zona ya que es relativamente barata y ràpida.

El continuo uso brindado durante el tiempo que viene trabajando con su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de mantenimiento constante para poder garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Es por ello que el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Carlos es una persona honesta y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para poder cuidar de sus padres y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old, is single and lives with his parents on the outskirts of Chepen, an agricultural area with considerable commercial traffic. It's in the province of the same name and in the Libertad region, over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He offers transportation services to passengers and cargo with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a compartment for the purpose of transportation). He offers this service in the district where he lives and, thanks to the income it generates, he covers his personal costs and helps support his family. This business is in high demand in the area and is relatively economical and quick. Contant use during the time he has been working with his vehicle has meant that the vehicle has begun having several problems and needs constant maintenance to keep it working. This is why he is requesting from Edpyme Alternative a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Carlos is an honest person and very hardworking. His dearest wish is to continue working hard to be able to take care of his parents and give them a better quality of life. He worked previously with Nuestra Institucion and showed punctuality and responsibility for achieving his quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs for a mototaxi

loans.name: Arcia Tanislaa

texts.es: Tanislaa tiene 58 años, su actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general y también destace de cerdos. Sus inicios se dan hace 16 años, con mucho esmero y sacrificio ha logrado mejorar su negocio,  tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo esta es su razón por salir adelante para brindarles a ellos la oportunidad de estudiar, pues es una mujer muy inteligente pues a pesar de la competencia no se deja abatir.  Con este financiamiento lograra comprar cerdos pequeños y también alimentos para ellos para tener buena demanda de parte de sus clientes. Ella desea realizar mejorar a su vivienda y comprar otra propiedad.
texts.en:
Tanislaa is 58 years old. She sells general merchandise and also raises pigs. She began 16 years ago, and with much effort and sacrifice has managed to improve her business. She has 2 young children. That's why she wants to get ahead; to provide them with the opportunity to study. She is a very intelligent woman and despite all the competition, she never lets it get her down. With this financing, she will buy piglets and pig food in order to have a good supply for her clients. She would like to make improvements to her home and buy other property.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blanca Dalia

texts.es: la Sra. Blanca, se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida  , viene trabajando hace 8 años en el rubro de venta de comida su domicilio   queda ubicado por  el Barrio Entel en la calle Genesis,nacio en Santa Cruz, su trabajo de la venta de comida lo realiza por las noches en su mismo domicilio, el trabajo que desempeña lo aprendio desde muy joven, sus primeros pasos lo realizo  en la provincia de Robore  en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Con el credito que se le esta otorgando   lo establecera en la compra de una heladera e incremento del capital de trabajo. En un futuro quiere que su trabajo  crezca mucho mas ,  ya que tiene pensado ampliar su negocio y hacer mantenimientos a su hogar, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Blanca sells food. She has been working in the field of selling food for eight years. Her house is in the Entel neighborhood on Genesis Street. She was born in Santa Cruz. She works selling food every night at her house. She learned the work when she was very young. She took her first steps in the Robore province in the city of Santa Cruz. She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and to increase her working capital. In the future she wants her business to grow a lot. She plans on expanding her business and doing some maintenance on her home. She is very grateful to the Institución for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator and increase working capital

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es:
Fátima de 26 años, tiene un salón de belleza y vive en una zona periurbana en Duran de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por estar rodeada del rio Guayas.  

Fátima comenzó a trabajar como estilista particular visitando a su vecinos y amigos. Después de algún tiempo invirtió sus ahorros en sillas y instrumento para un salón de belleza. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am, haciendo cortés de cabello, tinturados,  manicura.    

Para continuar con su salón de belleza ella quiere comprar con el préstamo sillas, en el futuro quiere tener un local mas grande y su casa propia y asegurar el futuro de su hijo de tres años.
texts.en:
Fatima is 26 years old and she has a beauty salon. She lives in the suburban region of Duran de Guayaquil. It is known for being surrounded by the Guayas river. Fatima started working as a stylist by visiting her neighbors and friends. After some time she invested her savings in the purchase of chairs and equipment for a beauty shop. She now works from 8 a.m., providing men's haircuts, dyes, and manicures. To maintain her beauty shop she would like to invest this loan in the purchase of new chairs. In the future she would like to have a bigger space for her business and to have her own home. She would also like to provide for her 3-year old son's future.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty shop chairs.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 63 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Norma de 25 años y su nieta Melani de 4 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días Manuela trabaja en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plátano y café, ya que estos productos son muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que puedan perjudicar su siembra. Para el futuro espera poder comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción actual. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Manuela is 63 years old. She is a very sincere and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her beloved daughter, Norma, who is 25 years old and her granddaughter Melani, who is 4 year sold. They are her reason for all her efforts. Every day Manuela works in her plantations. With a great deal of effort she has managed to make her fields very productive and she now grows all kinds of produce, making sure that all her products are of excellent quality. Her main products are bananas and coffee, these are the products that are in greatest demand in the La Merced markets. What she likes best about her work is making sure her plantations are free of pests that may harm the harvest. In the future she hopes to have more land to increase her harvest. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She sees this loan as a great help in the development of her business. Within her community bank group she is a very responsible woman, a source of great pride for her. The two thousand nuevos soles that she requests will be invested in the improvement of her cultivation, and to purchase more fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 20 años es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Michael de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Marcelina se dedica, es el cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, pues sabe que así obtendrá las ganancias suficientes de la venta de su cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus frutos por que recibe la recompensa de tanto esfuerzo que dio sobre sus plantaciones. En adelante, desea extender sus cultivos, de esa manera incrementará su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 20 years old. She is a very happy and unpretentious young woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Michael, 30 years old, and their two beloved children, to whom she strives to provide a better quality of life. Marcelina's work is cultivating bananas and coffee. Every day since very early in the morning she works in her fields, knowing this is the way to obtain the best earnings for her harvest. What she likes best about her work is harvest the fruits of her labor, receiving her rewards for all the efforts she invested in her fields. In the future she hopes to have more land, to increase her yield. This is her third loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She indicates that this loan will help her a great deal in the progress of her business. She is very well liked in her community bank group, being very close to them. The one thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests will be used to purchase fertilizers to improve the productivity of the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Lida tiene 24 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora (así se describe ella), que ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de la crisis económica, madre soltera, con 2 hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad, su domicilio está ubicado en el Distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima. Trabaja  con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desde hace 1 año y 4 meses, asume el cargo de secretaria de la alcancía comunal “LA NUEVA ESPERANZA” la cual está conformada por  7 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades como: venta de frituras, venta de productos de belleza, venta de golosinas, venta de ropa y otros. 
Lida se dedica  a  la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y además trabaja como azafata en un tragamonedas desde hace 2 años, se inicio en este negocio porque una amiga la invito a participar, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprarse una moto, un televisor, una olla arrocera y un ropero.
El gran anhelo de Lida es tener un restaurante propio, el reciente préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería, para tener una mayor posesión en el mercado, para así mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. (Niños en la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
Lida is 24 years old, she is a hardworking woman (as she describes herself) that has been able to get ahead in spite of the economic crisis, she is a single mom of two children ages nine and three, her address is in the District of Ate, department of Lima. She's worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperity for a year and four months, she is treasurer of the community group “La Nueva Esperanza” (the new hope) conformed by seven members that work on different activities such as: snack sales, beauty product sales, candy sales, clothing sales and other. Lida sells cosmetics through catalog sales and she has also worked for two years looking after a slot machine, she started this business because a friend invited her to participate and with daily efforts she has been able to save to buy a motorbike, a tv, a rice cooker and a dresser. Lida's wish is to have her own restaurant, the new loan will be invested in to buy merchandise, to have a better position in the market and improve her quality of life because she is mom and dad for her children. (kids in picture are children of the members)

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cirilo de 50 años y sus 4 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de plátano y café es la actividad que realiza diariamente Olga. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de La Merced, lugar donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 29 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Olga is 45 years old; she is a very loving and responsible Mom. She lives in her own home together with her husband, Cirilo, 50 years old, and their 4 young children, to whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. Olga works every day in her banana and coffee plantations. With a great deal of work she has managed to transform her fields into very productive ones. She has generated harvests of very high quality and they are in high demand in the city of La Merced, location where she gets the best prices for her products. Her favorite part of her work is working the fields. She has had 29 years in the business. The most difficult part of the work is having to transport the products given that the sacks are very heavy and they tire her very much. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to be able to expand the plantations. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she hopes to always be on time with her payments, especially not to cause any problems with her community group, where she is very happy. With the three thousand two hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizer for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos. Se dedica a venta de hielo desde hace más de 2 años, el objetivo en el que inicio este financiamiento fue para mejorar sus ingresos, pues es una zona muy transitada ya que esta cerca de un puerto pesquero e donde solicitan mucho este producto. El es una persona que brinda todo su esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, de modo que pueda sacar a su familia adelante, pues se encuentra muy alegre ya que es su primer crédito, así comprara un freezer, bolsas y otros productos. Sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose is a family man. He is 32 years old and he lives together with his wife and their two children. He has been selling ice for the past 2 years. He has requested this loan to improve his earnings. His locale is a very well travelled area because it is located near a fishing port where they require good quantities of his product. He is a person that expends all of his efforts into his business, so that he might provide for his family. He is very happy to be eligible for a first loan. He will purchase a freezer, bags, and other products. He dreams of expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Carmelitas De Cholula Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Chicas Liberales”, el nombre se escogió por ser un grupo de mujeres con deseos de superación, y crecimiento  personal y porque es una forma de obtener fuerzas día con día y así poder sobresalir continuamente, la mayoría de este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el  Estado de Hidalgo,  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.

Maribel Nava R. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, estudió hasta el tercer año secundaria, es secretaria y tiene 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 hombre). Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo. La Señora Maribel tiene 1año con la venta de calzado y solicita el préstamo para la compra nuevos catálogos, así poder elevar sus ventas, ahorrar para  adquirir en el futuro un local comercial para tener un mejor desarrollo y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia viviendo tranquilamente sin verse en la necesidad de trasladarse fuera a trabajar.

Sus clientes nos  comentan que la Señora Maribel Nava R. es una excelente vendedora ya que realiza visitas a las casas de sus  vecinas,  y con sus compañeras de trabajo, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, muy amable, de excelente carácter y le gusta mucho a lo que se dedica. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo la Señora Maribel se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le dan pues con las ganancias de la venta de calzado ella cree podrá llevar a sus hijos de vacaciones un fin de semana a Acapulco. Y cumplir así el sueño de sus hijos.
María Guadalupe Raya J. es tesorera de este grupo. Tiene 26años, tiene la preparatoria terminada. Vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos (10, 6 y 3 años respectivamente).  Ella se dedica a la  venta de bolsas tejidas con detalles de pedrería y fichas de lata de diferentes modelos que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en más materia prima como comprar hilos y fichas de colores al igual de piedras de mayor calidad y así poder vender más en poco tiempo. Actualmente sale a vender a otros municipios pues en un principio solo su venta fue destinado a vecinas y familiares, poco a poco fue abriendo mercado en el municipio de Tizayuca. Sus clientes  comentan  que la señora  es una persona muy amable, ofrece muy buen servicio y variedad de bolsas, ofrece facilidades de pagos (semanales o de contado) de acuerdo a las posibilidades de sus clientas. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente respaldada y con la oportunidad de salir adelante con su familia además de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa ya  que es  de  escasos  recursos  económicos  y  que  eso le  da  mucha  confianza  parta  seguir  adelante contando con el apoyo de sus padres poder realizar mejoras en sus productos.


Los integrantes del grupo son:
Maribel Nava R.	Venta de zapatos por catalogo
María Guadalupe Raya J.   Venta de bolsas
Gisela Úrsula Mendoza J.  Tienda de Abarrotes
María Asunción Vargas C.  Venta de blancos
Josefina Tinoco Z.	  Venta de zapato
Laura Gonzalez O.	  Taller de Costura
Marta Selene Saldaña R.	  Venta de blancos
Liliana Sánchez P.	  Venta de zapato
Martha Javier S.	  Venta de ropa por catalogo
Bertha Javier S.	  Venta de cosmético
texts.en:
The name of this group is "Liberal Women". The name was chosen for their combined wish is to improve their life, and for personal development. It is a way for them to feel strong day after day and to always find success. The majority of the group lives in the state of Hidalgo. The group is made up of 10 members. Maribel Nava R. is the president of the group. She is 26 years old, she is a single mother, and she completed grade 9. She is a secretary and she has 2 children (a boy and a girl). She sells shoes through a catalogue. Maribel has been running her business for 1 year and she requests a loan to purchase new catalogues so that she might improve her sales and save money. In the future she hopes to have a store where she will find better success, so that she might always provide for the needs of her fmaily. She wants to live without worries and without ever having to secure other paid work. The members have commented that Maribel Nava R. is an excellent salesperson, visiting her neighbors and her colleagues. She is a very hard working person, very kind, and of a excellent personal demeanor. She really enjoys her work. When she requested her loan Maribel felt very fortunate to have been given the opportunity. With the increased earnings from her shoe sales she will be able to take her kids on a holiday for one week in Acapulco. This will be making her kids' dream a reality. Maria Guadalupe Raya J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 26 years old and completed junior high school. She lives together with her partner and she has 3 children (aged 10, 6 and 3 years old respectively). For the past 8 years she has been selling hand knitted handbangs, with stone and aluminium bead work in different designs. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of materials such as threads, colored beads and high quality colored stone beads. She will be able to sell more and in less time. She goes to different municipalities, but at first she only ever sold to her friends and family. But slowly she started visiting the markets in the municipality of Tizayuca. Her clients indicate that she is a very kind person, always offering good service and a good variety of hand bags. She offers flexible payment options (weekly payments or in cash) depending on the client's needs. She feels grateful for the support offered to her through this loan and for the opportunity to get ahead, especially for her family. She helps her husband with the household expenses because his source of income is insufficient. She was initially given support by her parents who helped her improve the quality of products that she sold.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business (to purchase new catalogues)

loans.name: Renacimiento De Ceres Group

texts.es:
Santosa asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “RENACIMIENTO DE CERES” la cual está conformada por  7 socios, tiene 50 años de edad, es una mujer entusiasta y divertida, que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, casada, con 3 hijos adultos, su domicilio está ubicado en el Distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima.

Trabaja  con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desde hace 10 años. 

Santosa se dedica  a  la venta de especerías y verduras en un puesto en el mercado, desde hace 20 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de prendas de vestir y como el negocio no iba muy bien tuvo la necesidad de cambiar de giro de negocio, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado construir su casa de material noble, el estudio de sus hijos en la universidad y la compra de un terreno para un nuevo mercado, su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería.

Santosa en el futuro anhela hacer una pequeña empresa de zapatos y ropa. (Niña en la foto hija de la socia).
texts.en:
Santosa is the president of the Renacimiento de Ceres (Rebirth of Beings) Village Bank, which is made up of 7 members. She is 50 years old, and is an enthusiastic and fun woman who works day to day to get her family ahead. She is married, has three adult children and lives in Distrito de Ate, in Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO – prosperity for 10 years. Santosa sells spices and vegetables in a market stand, she has done this for 20 years, before that she used to sell clothes but the business wasn't very good and she had to change the activity, with her daily effort she has been able to: build a house with strong materials, afford university studies for her children and buy a lot for a new market, she will use her most recent loan to buy merchandise. Santosa hopes to be able to start a small shoes and clothing business in the future. (The girl in the picture is Santosa's daughter).

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Azar

texts.ru:
Azar A. 42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey,doch kotoroy 18 let ona v etom qodu postupila v universitet i takje ona lubit zanimatsya tancami, sin 15 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole  i zanimayetsya sportom.
Azar i eqo semya jivut v qorode Baku. 

Azar uje 7 let zanimayetsya biznessom taxi. Etomu biznessu eqo nauchil dedushka kotoriy bil toje taxistom. Seychas Azar nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  zapchasti dlya svoyeqo taxi.
texts.en:
Azar A. is forty-two years old, married and lives in the city of Baku. He has a son and a daughter. His daughter is eighteen, likes to dance and has just started going to college this year. His son, who is fifteen, is still attending school and enjoys playing sports. Azar has been a taxi driver for seven years, a trade which he learned from his grandfather. Azar is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy some spare parts for his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for taxi

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los cultivos de Rufina, son de los mejores cuidados de su poblado, sus plátanos y café son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de abonar muy bien sus chacras. En el mercado de La Merced, es el lugar donde tiene más demanda de sus productos, además que son adquiridos a un precio más cómodo.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados al recolectar gran parte de lo sembrado, por ello procura cuidarlo con abono y protegerlos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar su producción, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras para que estén bien fertilizadas.
texts.en:
Rufina is 32 years old. She is an unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her 3 beloved children, to whom she wishes to provide a better future. Rufina's cultivations are the best cared-for fields in the village. Her bananas and coffee are of excellent quality especially because she has always been able to provide enough fertilizer to her fields. In the La Merced markets is where her products are in highest demand and where they are sold at the best prices. What she likes best about her work is fertilizing the fields and protecting them against insect pests. In time she hopes to improve her harvests and to improve her earnings. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been very punctual with her payments, especially because she feels a great responsibility towards the institution. In her community group she is a very dedicated member always looking for the development of the group at large. With the two thousand nuevos soles she requests he will purchase more fertilizers for her fields, so that they always remain well supplied.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona tiene 49 años, su actividad es una pulpería que inicio hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio.
