Sus inicios se dan por su esposo cuando se caso con él pues necesitaba un medio de ingreso para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ella es muy famosa pues brinda una excelente atención a sus clientes y ha demostrad ser una mujer muy capaz y luchadora. Este financiamiento será destinado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella siempre está soñando con incrementar su inventario y transformar su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Petrona, age 49, has a grocery store. She started this business over five years ago. It started because of her husband. When she married him she needed a way to get income in order to improve the family’s living conditions. She is very well known because of the excellent attention she gives her customers. She has shown herself to be a very capable and tenacious woman. This loan is to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, juice, detergent, and basic grains. She is always dreaming of increasing her inventory and transforming her store into a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Telmo Cristian

texts.es:
Telmo tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su padre, en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte), el brinda este servicio dentro de su distrito y se vale de los ingresos que percibe para solventar sus gastos personales y colaborar con la economía de su familia. Este medio de transporte tiene bastante acogida entre los pobladores del distrito debido a su bajo costo y rapidez.

Debido al constante uso brindado, la unidad móvil de Telmo está empezando a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Como no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Telmo es un joven trabajador y emprendedor, el desea seguir trabajando para poder obtener una nueva mototaxi y así seguir creciendo como empresario. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran un joven responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Telmo is 25 years old, single and lives in his father’s house in the Chepén district, an agricultural area of considerable commercial activity belonging to the province of the same name. Chepén is located in the region of La Libertad, and is one hour’s drive from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides a freight and passenger transportation service, using a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a cab attachment permitting transport activities). He offers this service within his district and uses his earnings to cover his own expenses while contributing towards his family’s finances. This means of transport is quite popular among district residents because of its low cost and swiftness. Due to its sustained use, Telmo’s mobile unit is beginning to suffer some damage which requires urgent repairs to ensure proper operation. As he lacks the funds to do this he has had to request for the first time a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Telmo is a young worker and entrepreneur. He wants to continue working so that he can acquire a new mototaxi and consequently keep on developing as an entrepreneur. People who know him have great esteem for him and regard him as a responsible and reliable young man.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Delia ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos de plátano y café, uno de los más productivos de su poblado, todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, sale a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de La Merced. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old. She is a very unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her 5 young children, to whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. Working arduously Denlia has managed to make her banana and coffee plantations of the most productive in the village. Every morning, no matter the weather, she goes into the fields to work knowing that this is what her earnings will depend on. The part she most enjoys about her work is laboring in the fields. She has 14 years in the business. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport the products all the way to the city of La Merced. In time she hopes to purchase more land, to increase her harvest yield. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she hopes to always be on time with her payments. In her community group she is a very well respected member given the level of responsibility she demonstrates. With the two thousand nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizers to make her fields more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Iram

texts.es: Iram, de 26 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El trabajo al que Iram se dedica, es el cultivo de café y plátano, los cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender en la ciudad de La Merced, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que la ruta es muy accidentada y difícil de llegar. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras, por que desea incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su grupo comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Iram is 26 years old. He is a very happy and hard working young man. He lives together with his parents and his greatest wish is to be successful in life. Iram's work is harvesting coffee and bananas. After the harvest he takes his products to sell in the city of La Merced, location where he receives the gets the best prices. He has been working at this business for the past 6 years. The most difficult part of his job is having to carry his products through a very treacherous path, making it very difficult to travel. In time he hopes to purchase more land so that he may increase the amount of harvest he acquires. This is his fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). With his past loans he has always been very punctual and he hopes to keep up his record. Within his community group is a very well liked member, his happiness is contagious to the other members. With the two thousand five hundred nuevos soles that he requests he will purchase more fertilizer to improve his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: La Señora Anabel tiene 34 años, ella se dedica a la venta de leche natural y cuajada, por iniciativa propia es que ha decidido establecer este negocio en su vivienda, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, es una persona muy cariñosa con sus clientes, pues se sienten muy bien al venir a comprar y hablar con ella, le gusta la actividad que realiza pues siempre está pensando en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este financiamiento es para la compra de más leche ya que tiene una muy buena demanda y así podrá suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Anabel is 34 years old. She sells natural milk and curd on her own initiative, that is, she decided to establish this business in her home. She has three minor children under her care. She is a very warm person with customers, so that they feel good about coming to buy from her and talk with her. She likes what she does and is always thinking of how to improve her family’s quality of living. This funding will be used to purchase more milk as it is in high demand, and thus she will be able to supply her customers.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lucerito De Jose Galvez Group

texts.es: ALCOM: LUCERITO D. JOSE GALVEZ La señora I. Valencia con 57 años D. edad, viuda con 02 hijos independientes, participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, en la Alcancía Comunal “Lucerito D. José Gálvez” hace cuatro meses, al igual que sus seis compañeras son personas que buscan el progreso a través D. sus negocios. I. se dedica a la venta D. anticuchos y picarones en la plazuela D. Chosica; hace seis años ella empezó con este negocio, debido al lamentable fallecimiento D. su esposo, quien era el único que cubría los gastos D. su casa, desD. entonces la madre D. I. le pidió que se asociara con ella para trabajar juntas en el mismo negocio. Es así como ella empezó a trabajar y vender estos alimentos, La mamá falleció hace un mes atrás, ahora I. se esfuerza por seguir el ejemplo y valentía D. su madre, quien gracias al apoyo D. ella pudo mejorar su economía; Durante ese periodo D. trabajo y esfuerzo ella ha logrado adquirir muchas cosas, como por ejemplo obtiene un ingreso mensual por el alquiler D. un puesto D. Negocios en el Megacentro D. Lima, actualmente los ingresos que ella posee lo invierte en los gastos D. su casa y su negocio, en el futuro ella aspira conseguir un local comercial y aperturar una Fuente D. Soda; el reciente préstamo que EDAPROSPO le ofreció lo utilizará para comprar una carreta nueva que le es D. gran necesidad para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. I. Valencia is 57, she is a widow, has two independent children and has worked for four months with Edaprospo – prosperity, in the community bank “Lucerito D. Jose Galvez”, like her six co-members she is a person that looks for progress through her business. I. sells beef skewers and pumpkin fritters in the Chosica square; she started this business six years ago, due to the unfortunate death of her husband, who was the one that covered the house expenses, since then I.'s mother asked her to start working together as partners in the same business. This is how she started to work and sell this food. Her mom died a month ago and now I. is working hard to follow the example and courage of her monther, thanks to whom she was able to improve her financial situation. During this period of work and effort she has been able to purchase many things, for example she has monthly income from renting a stand in the Lima Mega center, currently she uses her income in house expenses and to invest it in her business, in the future she hopes to acquire a commercial space and buy open a café; the new loan from EDAPROSPO will be used in buying a new cart that she really needs to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new cart for business

loans.name: Elsa Mariana

texts.es:
Elsa de 50 años, es vendedora de artículos para el hogar y electrodomésticos,tambien vende comida por pedido, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral. 

Ella vende artículos para el hogar desde hace años por la necesidad y la falta de oportunidades. Pero como necesitaba otros ingresos puso un pequeño local para vender comida poco a poco a incrementando su capital aunque ahora no tiene horario fijo para vender la comida porque la hacen por pedido, también los artículos de hogar para asegurar su vejez. 

Ella quiere dirigir el préstamo solo a los artículos para el hogar como planchas, relojes, tostadoras y así tener mas ingresos para eadecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener salud para seguir trabanjando y agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Elsa is 50 years old. She sells household goods and appliances, and also sells food to order. She lives in a suburban area called Perimetral. She has been selling household goods for years through necessity and lack of other opportunities. As she needed another source of income she set up a small shop to sell food and gradually was able to increase her capital. However she has no fixed schedule to sell the food because she prepares it to order, which also applies to the household goods she sells to safeguard her old age. She wants to dedicate the loan to purchasing household items like irons, clocks, toasters, and in this way generate more sources of income so she can make home improvements. In the future she wants to stay healthy to continue to work and enlarge her home.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: irons, toasters, clocks

loans.name: Flavia Marina

texts.es:
Flavia es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” desde hace dos años atrás, que pertenece al distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El collao  y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad, y tiene estudios superior incompleto.
Su actividad económica  es el engorde de corderos que comercializa cada tres meses en la feria de Ilave.
Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  invirtió en la compra de corderos.
Ella solicitará  otro crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  para cubrir su cuota de préstamo, debido a que en estos meses del año no hay mucha demanda, por tanto quiere  evitar las moras y no fallar a su Banco Comunal.    
Por otra parte su visión es cambiar de negocio a uno más rentable para poder ayudar en el estudio de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas educativas relacionadas al manejo de  negocio.
En la foto se muestra con su hija.
texts.en:
For two years, Flavia has been a member of the communal bank "Chijuyo Copapujo," which is located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, and Pumo department. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children 16 and 10 years old, respectively. Her higher education is incomplete. She raises lambs and sells them every three months at the fair in Ilave. She invested her first loan of S/.500.00 nuevos soles ($200) from Movimiento Manuela Ramos in lambs. She now requests another loan of S/.500.00 nuevos soles ($200) to make loan payments. During these months of the year, there is not much demand, and she wishes to avoid default and failure at her communal bank. In any case, she wishes to make her business more profitable to help her children with their schooling. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the educational talks concerning business management. She is shown in the photo with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make loan payments in a seasonal period of low demand for her lambs.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Martín de 37 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Con mucho esfuerzo Jesusa ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva plátano y café, los cuales luego lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de La Merced, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 36 years old. She is a Mom and a very unpretentious and hard working person. She lives in her own home together with her husband Martin, 37 years old, and their 3 beloved children, to whom she hopes to provide a better education. With a great deal of work Jesusa has managed to work her fields and make them very productive. She cultivates bananas and coffee and she later sells the harvest in the city of La Merced. There she sells in wholesale. Her harvests have provided them with the necessary income to support the family and so she enjoys investing all her energy in her business. What she most enjoys about her work is caring for the plantations. She has worked in business for the past 8 years. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport the harvest all the way to the city of La Merced. The sacks she carries are very heavy and tire her very much. In time she hopes to purchase more land to increase her production. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been very punctual with her previous loans and she hopes to keep up her record. Within her community group she is a very involved member, always aware of the groups business and agreements. With the three thousand nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo es casada hace mucho tiempo y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, nos cuenta que la situación está muy difícil pues anteriormente tenía que salir dejar a sus hijos y salir a vender, es así que con el apoyo de su esposo le ayudo para que vendiera productos de las diferentes casa comerciales como Avon, zermat,   por medio de catálogos sus clientes realizan los diferentes pedidos, hace mas de 17 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Ella sale a vender sus productos puerta a puerta. Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cremas, perfumes, lápiz labial, brillos, tratamientos entre otras cosas. Sus metas son agrandar su negocio y brindar una amplia variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Consuelo has been married for a long time. She has five grown children. She tells us that her situation is very difficult. Previously, she had to go out to sell and leave her children. Her husband helped her so that she could sell different products from different commercial houses like Avon and Zermat. Her customers make their different orders by catalog. She has spent over 17 years with this way of life. She leaves to sell her products door to door. She will use this new loan to buy creams, perfumes, lipstick, lip gloss, and treatments, among other things. Her goals are to expand her business and to offer a wide variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bakhshi

texts.ru:
Bakhshi S. 29 let. On ne jenat i jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so so svoyey semyoy. Bakshi uje 3 qoda zanimayetsya etim biznesom prodaji odejdi. 

Etomu biznessu Bakshi  nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. On toje ranshe prodoval odejdu a tak je veshi domashneqo upotrebleniya, potom otec Bakshi zabolel i bolshe ne smoq rabotat i on reshil prodoljit eqo bizness. Seychas  Bakhshi nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy tovar novuyu odejdu dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Bakhshi S. is twenty-nine years old, single and lives with his family in Baku. Following his father's example, Bakhshi is a salesman of household goods and apparel. He is applying for a loan to purchase new goods and clothes to increase sales and grow his business.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, D. 66 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado para sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia, junto a su querida hija menor Katy D. 21 años, quien es el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que Lucia se dedica, es el cultivo D. plátanos y café. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que las ganancias que obtenga D. la venta D. su cosecha, dependerá mucho D. la calidad D. sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos. En adelante desea sembrar todas sus tierras, para obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insumos que le ayudará a evitar la plaga D. insectos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 66 years old. She is a woman who is always working to find success in life. She lives in her own home together with her youngest daughter Katy, 21 years old. She is the reason for all of her efforts. Lucia's business is cultivating bananas and coffee. Every day since the very early morning hours she works in her fields. She knows that her earnings depend on this hard work, her earnings depending on the quality of the harvest. The part she likes most about her work is harvesting the plantations. She feels rewarded for the months' worth of work. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to obtain better earnings. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She indicates that this loan will help her significantly in the progress of her business. In the community group she is a very well liked member, being very close to her colleagues. With the one thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase products that will help her avoid damage due to insect pests.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to ward off insect pests.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 59 años, es una padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Zaragoza de 60 años y su querida hija menor, Norma de 25 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Manuel en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos de plátano y café, se conviertan en uno de los más productivos de su poblado, él trabaja sin descanso ya que sabe que de su esfuerzo depende la alimentación de su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de La Merced, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetado por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Manuel is 59 years old. He is a very happy and hard working family man. He lives in his own house together with his wife Zaragoza, 60 years old, and their beloved youngest daughter Norma, 25 years old. They are the reason for all of his efforts. The arduous days or work that Manuel invests in his fields have developed into the most productive banana and coffee plantations in the village. He works tirelessly knowing that on this work depends the livelihood of his family. What he enjoys most about the work is harvesting the fields. He has 40 years working in the business. The most difficult part is having to transport his products all the way to the city of La Merced, where he sells his products. In time he hopes to purchase more land to increase his yield. This is his fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes to be on time for all of his payments so that he will not harm the other members of his community bank. He is a very well respected member of the group for the level of responsibility that he always demonstrates. With the three thousand nuevos soles he requests he will purchase fertilizers to improve his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de colaborar con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar hizo que empezara a buscar el modo de agenciarse de algunos ingresos, fue asi como empezó un negocio de venta de pan, ella adquiere pan de una panadería de la zona y lo vente todas las mañanas y las tardes a sus vecinos. El negocio le ha hecho conocida y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados que siempre recurren a su vivienda a comprar el producto que ofrecen.

María Esther desea adquirir mas pan para aumentar su nivel de ventas y por ende, sus ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Esther es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poner su propia panaderia y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
María Esther is a mother who is 55 years of age. She lives with her husband and children in the District of Chepén, an agricultural area that experiences considerable commercial movement. This district is situated in the Province of Chepén, which is part of La Libertad region, and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

The need to support her family income motivated her to begin looking for ways to generate some income. As a result, she began a business selling bread acquired from a local bakery. She sells every morning and afternoon to her neighbors. Her business has become well-known and she currently has a group of loyal customers who always come by her home to buy the products she offers.

María Esther wants to acquire more bread to increase her sales and eventually her earnings. To accomplish this goal, she decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

María Esther is a responsible and hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to have her own bakery and provide her family with a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread

loans.name: Reyna Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Araceli G. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa, juguetes y zapatos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que al negocio le está haciendo falta variedad de mercancía y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingresos para ella y sus dos pequeños hijos que tiene y están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Reyna Araceli G. has more than two years' experience in selling clothing, toys and shoes. She requests a loan to supplement her business with merchandise. She does not have the capital funds to make that investment on her own. She plans on making her payments from the earnings of her business. It is the only source of income for her and for her two young children who are in her care.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchanise to restock her business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Banco comunal “Dulce Amanecer” desD. hace nueve años atrás, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 62 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta, y tiene dos hijos independientes.
Se dedica a la venta D. artesanía D. todo tipo ya sea bordados en bayeta y telares, tejidos a mano, croché, macramé entre otros, ella tiene un puesto D. artesanías en la ciudad D. Puno. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos artesanales.
Su visión es crecer y tener un puesto fijo en un mercado artesanal. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son las Charlas educativas y compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Agustina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) for nine years. This Communal Bank is located in the district, province, and department of Puno. Agustina is 62 years old, married, and has two adult children who are independent. She was not able to finish elementary school.

Agustina makes her living selling handicrafts of all types. These incluD. embroidered cloth and fabrics, hand woven items, crochet, macramé, and other products. She has a craft stand in the city of Puno. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 PEN to buy more handcrafted products. Her vision is to grow and have an established stand at the artisan market. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the educational seminars and sharing with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handcrafted products

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela L. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Al negocio le está haciendo variedad de mercancía ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir, es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar la mercancía.
Planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio, ya que sus dos hijos que tiene le ayudaran con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Estela L. has been selling used clothes for over five years. Her business lacks a variety of merchandise. However, at this time she does not have the money to invest in her business. That is why she is requesting a loan to be able to buy the merchandise. She plans on paying for the loan with the income from her business. Her two children will help with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Djanali

texts.ru:
Djanali G. 51 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , doch kotoroy 20 let ona uchitsya v universitete i rabotayet uchitlenicey v detskom sadu, sin 18 let v etom qodu postupil v universitet. Djanali i eqo semya jivut v  Fuzuli regione. 

Uje 8 let kak Djanali zanimayetsya prodajey tovarov dlya upotrebleniya v remonte .Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy tovar ( krani,shnuri,trubi i t.d).
texts.en:
Djanali G., 51, is married and has 2 children. His daughter is 20. She is a college student and a day care teacher. Mr. G.'s son is 18. He entered college this year. The G. family lives in Fuzili region. For 8 years, Djanali G. has been selling plumbing supplies and other household items. This loan Mr. G. will use to purchase new inventory for his store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Luisana Isabel

texts.es:
Luisana de 24 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber-game en su casa,  vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Por la falta de oportunidades el papa le compro una computadora y ella comenzó a utilizarla para hacer trabajos y alquilarla con un play station que ella tenia comenzó a generarle ingresos para seguir con este negocio. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. La hora de Internet la alquila a $0.50c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras para tener ya un Cyber establecido. En el futuro quiere tener mas surtido su Cyber para asegurar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luisana is 24 years old and has a small cybercafé-gaming arcade in her home. She lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the region was discovered.

Due to a lack of opportunities, her father bought her a computer and she began using it to generate work. She also rented out a PlayStation console that she owned and started generating income to continue her business. Luisana now works every day from 8am until 10pm. She rents out Internet booths for $0.50/hour.

With this loan she plans to buy computers so that she can have an established cybercafé. In the future, she wants to keep her cybercafé well-equipped so that she can secure her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material for a party supply business

loans.name: Antonieta Jovita

texts.es:
La Señora Antonieta es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Huanca II”  ubicado en el distrito de Cabanillas, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 70 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y  no tiene hijos, la socia no cuenta con estudios.

Antonieta esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace II ciclos,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado a Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de Comidas.

En la actualidad la señora  solicita un nuevo crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar más insumos para la venta de comida  y así poder vender mayor cantidad.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital y poder ampliar su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las ganancias del ahorro.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonieta is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca II”, which is located in the District of Cabanillas, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 70 years old, married, and does not have any children. Antonieta did not attend school.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles. She says that the first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN and helped increase the capital for her food business.

At the moment Antonieta is requesting a new loan in the amount of 600 PEN so that she can buy more ingredients for preparing food, which will help her sell in greater quantities. Her dream for the future is to increase her capital so that she can expand her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the earnings from her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.es:
La Señora ROSE MARY F. B. es soltera pero vive con el señor FELIX ORELLANA  desde hace 5 años,  tiene 5 hijos de 24,22,20,3 y 7 años. Viven en la zona del Plan 3000 Barrio 15 de Mayo al sudeste  del Plan 3000.
 
Ella se hace cargo de el de tres y siete años, los demas hijos son independientes, la señora trabaja en una empresa de electrificación F y F como persona de limpieza y como bodeguera, además la señora trabaja en su casa tejiendo ropa de verano y ropa de invierno y cuenta con las maquinas para dicha tarea, pero con lo que no cuenta es con el material para poder realizar estos trabajos por que el sueldo que gana es poco y solo le alcanza para poder subsistir en gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios. 

Es por este motivo que ella solicita que se le ayude a poder generar mas ingresos mediante el material que le falta y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida que lleva.
texts.en:
Rose Mary F. B. is single, but she has lived with Felix Orellana for five years. She has five children, ages 24, 22, 20, 3, and 7. They live in the Plan 3000 area in the 15 de Mayo neighborhood, which is southeast of Plan 3000. Her three-year-old and seven-year-old children are the only ones under her care. The rest of the children are independent. She works as a cleaning lady and in the warehouse for the F and F electric company. She also works in her house knitting summer and winter clothes; she has machines for this work. But, what she does not have is the material to be able to do this work. The salary that she earns is small, and it only covers food expenses and utilities. That is the reason she is requesting help to be able to generate more income with the materials that she needs. That way she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Corocoreña Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Las Corocoreñas”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 1, consta de ocho integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la Mesa Directiva que está conformada por la señora María Benita como Presidenta, la señora Elizabeth como Tesorera y la señora Rosario como Secretaria de Actas.

La  señora presidenta, tiene como negocio la venta de hojas de coca, conocida medicina natural para el "sorojchi" o mal del altura y para aliviar el dolor de estómago, la señora María Benita cuenta con este negocio desde hace veinte años.  Actualmente tiene un puesto fijo de venta al frente del mercado Corazón de Cobre.  
Este primer crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercadería.

Las integrantes de la A.C. “Las Corocoreñas” tienen diferentes negocios de servicio y comercio: venta de hojas de coca, tienda de barrio, venta de pasancalla, fideos y tostados, venta de cosméticos y víveres, venta de leche PIL, venta de víveres a cuotas y tienda de joyería.
texts.en:
The community association 'Las Corocoreñas' is beginning its first loan cycle. The group is composed of eight members and headed by a board of directors. Señora María Benita is president, Señora Elizabeth treasurer, and Señora Rosario secretary. María Benita sells coca leaves, well-known as natural remedy for ‘soroche’ or altitude sickness, and for stomach ache. She has had this business for twenty years and currently has a stall opposite the Corazón de Cobre market. This first loan will be used to buy merchandise. The members of the group have a variety of service and commercial businesses: coco leaf selling; neighbourhood store; stall selling pasankalla (type of quinoa), pasta, and tostados; cosmetic and supplies sales; milk products sales; and jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.en:
Valerus is the coordinator of her group, Dios es mi Pastor 3 (God is my Pastor). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are buying land and building her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

Valerus is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 10 years. She started with a loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying items such as rice, oil, seasoning, meats and vegetables. She cooks and sells food to construction workers and others. She will use the profits to help with housing payments and her children's schooling. It is like an investment. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because, with the loan, she can buy more merchandise and improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities include a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es: Ceferina, de 46 años, vive en su humilde casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Víctor de 65 años, que es taxista, y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos que aún estudian en el colegio. Siempre se esforzó mucho por salir adelante, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es por eso que desde hace 18 años, se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de picarones (dulce peruano echo a base de una masa de camote y harina frita con miel), dice que el negocio es tranquilo, aunque un poco agotador. Su rutina de trabajo empieza en la tarde, después de terminar con las labores del hogar, prepara  la masa de picarones, pues debe estar consistente para cuando sean fritas en la noche. Ya cuando llega el momento de la venta, alista su coche, donde lleva todos los implementos de su negocio, hasta una esquina de una calle cercana a su casa. La venta de picarones se puede extender hasta la medianoche, pues debe vender todo lo preparado, y obtiene regulares ganancias, que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una dama emprendedora, desea en el futuro, ampliar su negocio y mejorar su puesto de venta, ya que quiere brindar lo mejor a sus clientes. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere continuar trabajando con esta entidad que le permite progresar, además esta satisfecha de trabajar junto a su grupo, pues esta integrado por personas responsables que se conocen y se apoyan cuando se presenta alguna dificultad. Ceferina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de sillas, mesas y algunos utensilios para equipar mejor su negocio, pues desea ofrecer mejor imagen y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ceferina, 46, lives in a small house that she owns with her husband, Victor, 65, a cab driver, and their 2 high school-aged children. She has always worked hard to help her family get ahead. She started 18 years ago as a street vendor, selling picarones (a fried Peruvian pastry made from potato, wheat and honey), in order to improve their quality of life. She says that the business is mostly worry-free, but it can be exhausting at times. She starts work in the afternoon, after she finishes her work around the house, by making dough for the picarones because the dough has to be solid before it's fried in the evening. When she's ready to sell the picarones, she loads the equipment that she needs in her car and carries everything to a street corner near her house. She often works until midnight because she wants to sell all the picarones that she has made for the day. The earnings from the business allow her to help her husband with household expenses. Ceferina is an enterprising woman so she naturally wants to expand her business and improve it so that she can draw in more customers and serve them better. This is her fourth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time because she wants to continue her connection with the bank. She is happy with her community group, too, because she knows the other members and considers them to be responsible and supportive. Ceferina will use this loan to buy chairs, tables and other supplies to better equip her business, an investment that she thinks will improve the image of her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs and other supplies to equip food business.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La Señora Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos,  la señora estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora Asunta esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado, que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le permitió  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. compra y  venta D. animales menores.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar  mas animales para luego engordarlas y poder venderlas en las ferias.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y obtner mayores ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Señora Asunta is a member of the ‘Mataro Chico’ community bank which is located in Santiago D. Pupuja district, Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She completed primary school. Asunta has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four months. She used her first loan of S/.500 to buy more young animals to fatten and then sell. Now she is asking for another loan of S/.500 to buy more animals to fatten and then sell in markets. Her dream is to improve her business and increase her income. Asunta really likes the meetings and training sessions organised by the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young animals to fatten

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, es una muy buena clientes siempre ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. Hace más de 31 años por lo que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, este negocio lo aprendió de sus Mama y con muchos ahorros logro establecer este negocio y así saco adelante a sus 6 hijos con mucho esfuerzo. Este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de quintal de maíz, leña, cal, bolsas para servir las tortillas entre otros productos. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda pues se está deteriorando debido al humo, pues tiene la esperanza que con las ganancias pueda realizarlo.
texts.en:
María Antonia has been collaborating with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She is a good client who has always repaid her loans on time. She has been a tortilla merchant for over 31 years. She learned the business from her mother and managed to establish her own business through much effort. The business made it possible for her to raise her children. This financing is capital to buy a quintal (measure of weight equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn, firewood, lime powder and bags to pack the tortillas among other products. She dreams with making some home improvements because it’s deteriorating due to the smoke and she hopes profits will make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tortilla making ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Tiene 46 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 20 años es estudiante universitario y el menor cuenta con 11 años, también estudiante. 
Su cónyuge es empleado (seguridad privada) de una casa particular.
 Dionicia nos cuenta que empezó en este tipo de trabajo desde muy pequeña ya que su padre se dedicaba también al mismo oficio al igual que su madre, por tal motivo el conocimiento que tenía en ese ramo era muy amplio.
 Con el préstamo que adquirido de la Fundación Paraguaya compró telas para la confección de uniformes para maestros de una conocida institución, pues ella había presentado el modelo de camisas y pantalones que tuvo mucha aceptación ya que además del costo  bajo que otras empresas, ella era la persona que producía de la mejor manera dichas mercancías. 
Tuvo mucho éxito en dicho emprendimiento pues en la zona son pocas las personas que se dedican enteramente a esta  actividad y como ya dijimos sus precios son muy económicos. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado ya que con eso pudo comprar más materia prima para su empresa y a la vez aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 46, is married and has two children. The oldest is a 20-year-old college student and the youngest is 11 and also a student. Her spouse is employed as a security guard in a private home. Dionicia tells us that she started this work while still very young because her father and mother were in the same line of work therefore her skills in the area are extensive. The loan she got from Fundación Paraguaya was used to buy fabric to make uniforms for the teachers in a well-known institution for she had presented samples of shirts and pants that were accepted and also her price was lower than other firms. She was the person who best produced said merchandise. She was quite successful at this enterprise because few people in her area are solely dedicated to this activity and, as we stated already, her prices are quite affordable. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan granted because it allowed her to buy more raw materials for her firm and consequently increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Señoras Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Señoras del Sur”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 11, en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, consta de nueve integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora María Justina como Presidenta, la señora Catalina como Tesorera y la señora Fabiola como Secretaria de Actas.

La  señora presidenta, tiene como negocio la venta de electrodomésticos y celulares, desde hace seis años.  Inició este negocio acompañada de su esposo, quien actualmente le ayuda  en las ventas, en su puesto en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio.  

Su primer crédito fue utilizado para la compra de celulares y artefactos. Su solicitud actual es de Bs. 5000.- para la compra de más mercadería.  Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella ya está más de cuatro años en su asociación.
Las integrantes de la A.C. “Señoras del Sur” tienen diferentes negocios, entre ellos de servicio: venta de comida;  comercio venta de electrodomésticos y celulares.
texts.en:
The “Señoras del Sur” (Ladies of the South) is a group that is starting its 11th cycle in the Villa Exaltación Focal Center. It has nine members led by María Justina, President, Catalina, Treasurer and Fabiola, Recording Secretary. Madame President has sold home appliances and cellular phones for the last 6 years. She started the business with her husband, who still helps with sales, in her stand in the 16 de Julio Market. Her first loan was used to buy cellular phones and accessories. Her current request is for Bs.5000 to buy more merchandise. With respect to her history with Pro Mujer, she’s been in her association for more than four years now. The members of the “Señoras del Sur” communal bank have different service and commercial businesses among which are: food sales and home appliance and cellular phone sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances and cellular phones.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
En el Carmen de Bolívar, municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Cartagena vive Sandra M., mujer propietaria de la “Sala de belleza y peluquería Sandra”, ubicada a 100 metros del mercado local de esta población; desde allí ofrece servicios de peluquería,   corte de cabellos para damas y también  vende   productos de bellezas.
 Sandra tiene 3 hijos de 5 a 11 años, y está solicitando su credikiva que es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque  comprará tintes para el cabello, shampoo, silicona y productos capilares en general; también invertirá en el arreglo de una carpa y una silla que requieren mantenimiento.  Con su primer crédito con esta organización, logró comprar  productos de belleza para utilizarlos en su trabajo y también para la venta;  pintó el salón de belleza donde funciona, compró un lava cabezas, una plancha un secador y varios cepillos.
Sus metas mas adelante es ampliar el salón, tener otra empleada para los fines de semana, hacer una especialización en cosmetología y masajes y  ofrecer una gran variedad  de productos que día a día hagan crecer su clientela para lograr sostenerse en el mercado con buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra M. lives in El Carmen de Bolívar, a town that is very close to the city of Cartagena. She owns “Sandra’s Beauty Salon and Barber Shop,” located about 100 meters from the town’s local market. She offers all kinds of hair care services, women’s haircuts. She also sells beauty products. Sandra has three children ranging from 5 to 11 years of age. She is asking for this Kiva loan, which is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she wants to buy hair dyes, shampoo, silicone and various hair care products. She will also invest in a tent and a chair that require maintenance. She used her first loan from this organization to buy beauty products to use in her work and also to sell. She painted the beauty salon where she works, bought a hair washing sink, a hair straightening comb, a hair dryer and several brushes. Her future goal is to enlarge her salon and hire an employee for the weekends. She also wants to study a cosmetology and massage course and offer a wide variety of products that will lead to daily customer increase in order to thrive in the marketplace and earn good income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, shampoo, silicone and various hair care products; she will also invest in a tent and a chair that need maintenance.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cinco años atrás, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, grado de instrucción primaria incompleta, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres están bajo su dependencia.
Se dedica a la venta de frazadas y llicllas (mantas) desde hace veinte años, ahora vende de lunes a sábado al por mayor y menor en La Paz - Bolivia. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo  incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles para aumentar su mercadería de llicllas.
Su visión es comprar máquinas de coser para confeccionar llicllas por cantidad en Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos y sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Benita , 42, has been a member of the “Chojchoni” communal bank for the last 5 years. It’s located in Copani, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She’s married and has four children three of whom still depend on her. She did not complete primary school. She has sold blankets and comforters for the last 20 years. She sells both wholesale and retail in La Paz, Bolivia, from Monday through Saturday. The first loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was for 300 new soles that she used to increase her capital. She will request a new, 2000 new sol loan, to increase her supply of blankets. Her vision is to purchase sewing machines to make the blankets in quantity in Bolivia. What she most enjoys about her communal bank are the loans and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Yamil Javier

texts.es:
El Señor Yamil D. tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, es una persona que vive sola, es independiente.

Trabaja con su padre, juntos tienen un taller donde confeccionan articulos de cuero, como ser: cinturones, polainas, guantes industrias, Chalecos, Pecheras para perros. Es una persona muy trabajadora. Con su trabajo ayuda a su hermano a pagar sus estudios. 

Requiere del dinero para poder comprar en la ciudad de Cochabamba cuero curtido para poder realizar la confeccion y entregar a las empresas que le comprar sus artyiculos de cuero.
texts.en:
Sr. Yamil D., 32, is single. He lives alone and likes being independent. Yamil and his father have a workshop where they make all kinds of leather goods: belts, industrial gloves, jackets, etc. Yamil works hard and his earnings help to pay his brother's school fees. Yamil will use the loan to buy supplies of tanned leather at a market in Cochabamba so that he can make the products that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather for leather products business.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es: Hilaria Úrsula tiene 60 años, su actividad económica es la venta de frutas y verduras, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio con mucho esfuerzo ha iniciado pues anteriormente sus padres se dedicaban a la agricultura y siembra de productos. Ella es una persona muy responsable y se encuentra muy contenta con este negocio, ya que es su medio de vida y disfruta mucho de su actividad. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la reparar un vehículo que ella tiene para  trasladar sus frutas y verduras para trasladarlos en el mercado. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hilaria Úrsula, 60, has been a fruit and vegetable merchant for over 11 years. She started this business with much effort since her parents used to grow products and farm. She is a very responsible person who is very happy with her business because it’s her means of support and she enjoys it very much. The financing she is requesting is to repair a vehicle that she uses to transport the fruits and vegetables to market. She dreams with improving her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Sandra Gricelda Julisa

texts.es: Sandra tiene 20 años de edad, ella es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudia su ultimo año de maestra de educacion primaria. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de tacos al pastor, ella despues de estudiar vende todas las tardes en el mercado, de Tecpan, su hermano lo ayuda con la venta. El sueño de Sandra es ser una empresaria exitosa, como sus padres, ya que ellos se dedican al comercio, por esa razon solicita el prestamo a Fape para poder comprar una carreta mas para la venta de cheveres ya que ha prosperado y siente la nesecidad de una herramienta mas. Sandra le da gracias a Dios y a Fape por el apoyo que le han brindado atravez del credito
texts.en:
Sandra, 20, is single and lives with her parents. She is in the last year of Elementary School Teacher Training. Her parents support her efforts. For the last three years she has sold “tacos al pastor” in the evening every day after school in Tecpan’s market; her brother helps with sales. [Tacos al pastor, made the traditional way on a spit (like gyros), typically involves a layering of thin-sliced pork leg with red chile marinade (and, occasionally, sliced onion) topped with a whole, peeled pineapple]. Sandra’s dream is to be a successful businesswoman like her parents who are merchants. For that reason she is asking FAPE for a loan to buy another sales cart to sell hotdogs because she’s done well and feels the need to add another tool. Sandra thanks God and FAPE for the support they’ve given her through the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hotdog cart.

loans.name: Betty Yanet

texts.es:
Betty es socia del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” desde hace más de un año,  pertenece al distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene grado de instrucción superior completo.  Betty tiene un niño de seis meses.
Se dedica a la artesanía, hace bordados en telas, bayetas y en otros materiales, desde hace dos años no cuenta con un puesto seguro solo vende a los mayoristas. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró bayetas (telas) para el bordado.
Ella solicitará  un crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles para comprar  telas y lana.    
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artesanía. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos, ya que no piden muchos requisitos y también le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
Betty, 23, has been a member of “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank for over a year. It’s in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She has a live-in partner and finished higher education. She has a six-month-old son. She is a craftswoman. She has been embroidering on fabric, flannel and other materials for two years. She does not have a secure stand; she sells directly to wholesalers. She used the first loan she got from Manuela Ramos Movement which was for 500 new soles to buy flannel to embroider. She will now ask for an 800 new sol loan to buy more fabric and wool. Her dream is to own a crafts shop. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the loans since they don’t ask for too many requirements; she also enjoys the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and wool.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Renacer 1, 2, & 3 (Rebirth). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is owning a local salon; now she is hiring a place. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work in her beauty salon.

Angela is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years. This beauty salon is her most recent business. She plans to use this loan to buy a hair dryer and a blower for her salon. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her kids, and to save. She is always planning to improve her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she receives benefits by having a loan with Esperanza and with her group. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a blower

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene su negocio que es la venta de comida y servicio de transporte. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes llegan a disfrutar los deliciosos platillos que ofrece que son arroz, carne desmenuzada, pollo, frijoles, pastas entre otros. Sus inicios no fueron fáciles pues al inicio tenía mucha competencia pero no ofrecían a amabilidad y buena calidad a sus clientes. Este financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, frutas, verduras, utensilios de cocina y bolsas.
texts.en:
María Elena sells prepared meals and offers transportation services. She’s been in this business for two years. She has a wide variety of customers that come to enjoy the delicious meals she prepares: rice, shredded meat, chicken, beans, pastas, etc. Her beginnings were not easy because back then she had a lot of competition. However, they did not treat their customers with kindness and good quality. This loan will be used for the purchase of basic grains, fruits, vegetables, kitchen utensils and bags.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared food.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Banco comunal “Dulce Amanecer” desde hace cinco años atrás, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 17 años que estudian, Celia tiene estudios superior completo.
Se dedica a la venta de artesanía como: chompas, chalinas, maletines, cojines, bordados en bayetas, telares, cerámicas entre otros, tiene un puesto de artesanía donde ofrece todos sus productos. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos artesanales.
Su visión es formar una empresa artesanal. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las Charlas educativas, compartir con las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Celia, 44, has been a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) communal bank for five years. It’s in Puno district, province and department. She is a single mother of two children who are 22 and 17 years of age and students. Celia finished higher education. She sells crafts like: sweaters, scarves, backpacks, cushions, flannel embroidery, weavings, ceramics, etc. She has a crafts stand where she offers her products. She used the first, 300 new sol, loan that she got from Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will request a new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy crafts. Her vision is to form a crafts firm. What she likes best about her communal bank is the training workshops, sharing with fellow members and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 65 años de edad vive en casa con sus familiares no tiene hijos, el se dedica a la producción de labrillo desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, negocio en el cual obtiene grandes ganancias un promedio de 300 soles semanales, el desea invertir este crédito en la compra de tierra que le permita incrementar su producción del ladrillo y tener asegurado la producción para todo un año, Santiago sueña con ampliar su vivienda y para ello se esfuerza cada vez más para lograr su gran sueño, el tiene muchos clientes porque a todos los atiende con gran simpatia, se le propone el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Santiago is 65 and lives in a home with relatives. He has no children. He has been making bricks for about the last 3 years, a business in which he has good earnings with an average of 300 sols a week. He wants to use the loan to buy earth so that he can increase his brick production and have it assured for the whole year. Santiago dreams of enlarging his home and for this he works harder and harder to succeed with his goal. He has many customers because he takes good care of them. His credit request is submitted because he can repay it and he has good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his work

loans.name: Pompeya

texts.es:
Pompeya es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles que le ayudan en el crecimiento D. su negocio.
Pompeya es casada tiene 9 hijos y vive con solo 1 hijo que ya es profesional, Pompeya tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo. Además Pompeya tiene un puesto en el mercado Nazarenas en donD. venD. artículos plásticos, actividad que realiza por las mañanas.
Pompeya solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Pompeya sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener capital propio para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Pompeya has been a member of the Los Laureles communal bank for a year. What she most enjoys are the easy loans that help her business grow. Pompeya is married and has 9 children. She lives with just one of her children who is a professional. Pompeya has a grocery store in her home where she stocks groceries, vegetables and meat. She is open for business daily with help from her husband. In addition, Pompeya has a stand in the Nazarenas market where she sells plastic items during the morning. Pompeya is asking for 1000 soles to buy rice and sugar. Pompeya dreams with improving her business and with having her own capital to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Vilma Maria

texts.es:
Vilma es soltera y vive con sus padres, Vilma vende gas y leña en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, Vilma estudia contabilidad en la universidad.
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones amenas con sus consocias, Vilma solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de leña.
Vilma sueña con tener una empresa de artesanía y tener un estudio contable.
texts.en:
Vilma is single and lives with her parents. Vilma sells gas and firewood from her home, an activity that she carries out every day. She started her business two years ago. Vilma studies accounting at the university. Vilma has been a member of the Los Laureles communal bank for 1 year, and what she likes most are the pleasant meetings with the other members. Vilma is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) in order to purchase firewood. Vilma hopes to one day have a handicraft business as well as an accounting practice.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Nuevo Horizonte” consists of 17 associates from the city of Temuco. These individuals have diverse livelihoods. Some sell things like vegetables, sausages, and salads; others sell new and second-hand clothing items.There is an owner of a local grocery store, a clerk, and a hairstylist. Still others produce and sell things like pastries and apparel.
 
Rosa is the treasurer of the group. In the photo Rosa can be found in the third row and third form left to right wearing a red jacket and her hair is loose. Rosa’s business is of apparel of various items, for example formal clothing and sport outfits, costumes and curtains, and other things. Rosa studied hemming and costumes for three years and she has made it her profession for the past 25 years. Rosa´s workshop is located in her house, where she counts on three machines and works on set orders from clients. Rosa plans to use this loan to generate more items such as the traditional Chilean outfit of a huaso y huasa chileno, being that September is the month when Chile hosts various patriotic parties. Rosa also plans to purchase some fabric to fabricate polar shirts, as she has already collected some orders for this type of material. 

Rosa´s goal is to purchase a sewing machine that does intrinsic borders; she also dreams of one day extending out her workshop. Rosa´s motivation stems from gaining enough earnings to provide for her 12 year old son now and in the future when he decides to continue his studies. 

The aspect that Rosa enjoys about working with Fondo Esperanza is the great help that she has received from her fellow group members and loan officer, also learning about money management skills. 

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the place where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: purchasing fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, de 58 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus 2 hijos adultos que ya trabajan y lo ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Sabe que a su edad la mayoría de hombres estaría pensando en jubilarse y descansar en busca de una vida apacible; pero él sigue laborando en busca del progreso. Los días de trabajo de este luchador  hombre empieza desde muy temprano, casi al amanecer, pues a esa hora llegan los mayoristas de pollos frescos que le dejan la mercadería (pollos, huevos, y algo de carne) en su negocio que él comercializa en su puesto ubicado en un pequeño mercado de la zona donde vive. Dice que el trabajo lo entretiene bastante, además le genera considerables ganancias, y así le permite ahorrar algo de dinero. Ya en la tarde descansa hasta el día siguiente, y aunque dice que sus hijos le ayudan en los gastos del hogar le gusta ganarse algo de dinero trabajando, pues lo ha hecho toda su vida. En adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, y comprar algunos instrumentos que utiliza pues los que tiene están algo deteriorados. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, pues desea continuar trabajando para salir adelante, también dice que esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo, pues todos los integrantes se conocen y son muy responsables. Lorenzo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de pollos y gallinas para abastecer mejor su negocio y continuar ofreciendo a sus clientes productos de calidad a precios accesibles.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 58, lives in a house that he owns with his 2 adult children, both of whom work and help with household expenses. He knows that most men his age are thinking of retiring and taking it easy, but he continues working and trying to get ahead. Days for this hard-working man begin very early, almost at dawn, because that's when his suppliers drop off the products (chickens, eggs and a bit of beef) that he sells at a stand located in a small neighborhood market. He says that the work is often entertaining and the business generates enough money that he has some left for savings. He rests during the afternoon and starts again the next day. Although his children help with household expenses, he says that he likes to earn his own money working, just as he's done his whole life. For the future, Lorenzo wants to expand his business and buy equipment to replace the worn-out equipment that he has now. This is his fourth MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time because he wants to continue working with the bank. He is happy with his community group because he knows the members well and considers them to be responsible. Lorenzo will use the loan to buy chickens and roosters to better supply his business and, in turn, continue supplying his customers with good products at affordable prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar pollos y gallinas para abastecer su puesto de venta.

loans.name: Norusca De Jesus

texts.es:
Norusca tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de Guadalupe, en la provincia de Pacasmayo, esta zona es conocida porque a través de ella empieza la carretera que se dirige hacia Cajamarca. La zona está ubicada en la región La Libertad y se encuentra situada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto ambulante situado en el cruce desde donde empieza la carretera que se dirige hacia la ciudad de Cajamarca. La ubicación estratégica de su puesto de venta hace que siempre tenga clientes que acuden a consumir los alimentos que prepara, la mayor parte de sus clientes son transportistas y viajeros que siempre frecuentan la zona.

Norusca desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos de comida, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su meta ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, durante este tiempo ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si en las actividades que realiza. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Norusca is 38 years old and is a single mother. She lives in the Ciudad de Dios area of the District of Guadalupe in the Pacasmayo Province. This area is well-known because the highway that leads toward Cajamarca passes through it. The area is located in the La Libertad region and is more than an hour from Chiclayo City, the capitol of the Lambayeque region. Norusca makes her living as a street vendor. She sells food at an intersection at the start of the highway that leads toward the city of Cajamarca. The strategic location of her sales stall ensures that she always has customers arriving to eat the food she prepares. The majority of her customers are truckers and travelers who frequent the area. Norusca hopes to expand her business by purchasing more supplies, which will allow her to prepare more plates of food, and thereby increase her sales and earn a greater profit. In order to reach her goal, she has decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN ($550 USD). She is a determined and hard-working woman. She has fought to get her family ahead; she always tries to give her best in everything she does. In the neighborhood where she lives, her neighbors and friends consider her to be a pleasant and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to expand her food stall business.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - Guadalupe - Pacasmayo - La Libert

loans.name: Marianella Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Marianella Ysabel H. E. es soltera, vive con su madre y mantiene un negocio de venta de molidos y condimentos en el mercado Toledo hace dos años. Requiere del préstamo parra invertir en el negocio en un local que ha alquilado.
texts.en:
Ms. Marianella is single and lives with her mother. For the past two years she has had a business selling ground spices and condiments in the Toledo market. She needs this loan in order to invest in her business in a location that she has rented.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos es socio del Banco Comunal Los Laureles hace 1 año.
Carlos es casado y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Carlos se dedica a la fabricación de calzados, su local esta en la casa de sus suegros, tiene 1 operario que le ayuda en la fabricación, sus productos los reparte en los mercados y también tiene una tienda en un local alquilado y su esposa se encarga de la atención.
Carlos solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de cuero y plantillas.
Carlos sueña con que su marca sea reconocida a nivel nacional y tener estabilidad económica en el futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos has been a member of the Los Laureles Community Bank for the past year. Carlos is married and has two children that attend school. Carlos makes shoes.
