His workshop is located in his in-law’s house. He has one helper that helps him with his business. He sells his products in the market and also in a local store that he rents. His wife works in this store. Carlos is asking for a loan of 2,000 soles in order to buy leather and templates. Carlos’s dreams for the future are that his work becomes known on a national level and that he has stable finances.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and templates.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta vive en la casa de sus padres y su mayor sueño es construir su casa propia, Roberta es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que estudia, Roberta viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras, papa, cereales, reparte a diferentes negocios, se queda 4 días en la Selva de donde compra frutas que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles y durante este tiempo aprendió a ser puntual, Roberta solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de papa y verduras. Roberta tiene proyectado comprar un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Roberta lives in a house with her parents. Her dream is to build a house of her own. Roberta is single and has one child who is in school. Roberta travels to the Ayacuchana jungle in order to sell vegetables, potatoes and grains. She also has other businesses. She stays in the jungle for four days in order to buy fruit there that she sells in the supply market in the city. Roberta is a member of the Los Laureles Community Bank and as a member she has learned to be punctual. Roberta is asking for a loan for 1,000 soles in order to buy potatoes and vegetables. Roberta is planning on buying a stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles y lo que mas le gusta son las charlas de cómo administrar su negocio.
Monica es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Monica tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en donde vende comida desde las 4 de la mañanas hasta la noche, su negocio esta ubicado en el paradero de una línea de transporte urbano, además vende golosinas y bebidas.
Monica solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Monica son tener una tienda mayorista y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Laureles”. What she enjoys most are the seminars that cover topics such as how to manage your business.

Monica is in a common law marriage and has two children. She has a small restaurant in her home where she sells food from 4am until nighttime. Her business is located at a bus stop for one of the city transportation lines. In addition, she sells candy and beverages.

Monica needs a loan of 900 PEN to buy sodas and candy. Her dreams include opening a wholesale store and buying a car that her husband can use for work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & candy

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desD. hace diez años, este Banco pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta, tiene seis hijos, D. los cuales tres D. ellos están a su cargo.
Daniela se dedica a la compra venta D. condimentos como: ají, oréganos y otros condimentos que trae del departamento D. Tacna y venD. al por mayor en el distrito D. desaguadero los días viernes. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar ajís y oréganos.
Su visión es aumentar más capital para tener una especería completa. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Daniela has been a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Rosario” for ten years. This Communal Bank is located in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are still in her care. Daniela did not complete elementary school.

Daniela sells condiments such as aji peppers, oregano, and other spices that she brings from the Department of Tacna. She then sells her products in bulk in the District of Desaguadero every Thursday. With the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital.

The loan she is currently requesting is in the amount of 3000 PEN, which will be used to buy aji peppers and oregano. Her vision is to increase her capital even more so that she can have a complete spice shop. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condiments such as aji peppers and oregano

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Laureles y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles.
Lourdes es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Lourdes viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 3 veces a la semana de donde compra cereales, papa, carne, queso, productos que son comercializados en el mercado de abastos y en algunas oportunidades lleva a la ciudad de Lima. Lourdes solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de cebada.
Lourdes sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes y terminar de construir su casa en Lima.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Laureles”. What she enjoys most is the ease of the loans.

Lourdes is single and has two children who are in school. She travels to the different regional fairs three times a week to buy grains, potatoes, meat, and cheese. Lourdes sells these products at the supply market and occasionally she will bring them to the city of Lima. She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy barley.

Lourdes dreams of opening a grocery store and finishing the construction of her house in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley

loans.name: Carlos Rolando

texts.es:
El Sr. R. M. Carlos Rolando tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años a los cuales le pasa una pensión mesual y el tiene un ingreso semanal de s/. 280.
Se dedica a realizar actividades de maestro de obra hace cinco años y solicita el préstamo con la finalidad de ir mejorando profesionalemtne y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos Rolando R. M. has two children, ages 13 and 10, for whom he must pay a monthly pension. He also has a weekly income of 280 PEN.

Carlos has engaged in various activities as a master builder for five years. He is requesting a loan in order to keep improving professionally and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Dany Justina

texts.es:
Dany es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” desde hace dos años atrás, ubicado en el distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene estudios de secundaria completa, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 05 años de edad.
Danny tiene una tienda de medicina natural. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles para aumentar su mercadería de productos naturales.    
Su visión es crecer en su negocio y tener sucursales. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las reuniones y capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Dany has been a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) for two years. This Communal Bank is located in the District and Province of Puno, Department of Puno. Dany is 43 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 19 and 5. She completed her high school education.

Dany has a store where she sells natural medicines. With the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital.

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1500 PEN to increase her inventory of natural products. Her vision is to increase her business and open branches. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and training classes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural products

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María S. G. tiene ya mas de 3 años dedicándose a la venta de de ropa usada y zapatos, este negocio es su fuente de ingresos a parte su marido la trabaja en maquiladora para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión de ropa para la temporada de frio y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa María S. G. has been selling used clothing and shoes for more than 3 years. Her income from her business along with her husband's income from work in an assembly plant covers the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, since right now she doesn't have enough money to invest in clothing for the cold months and she wants to be prepared.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the coordinator of her group Creciendo para el futuro 4 & 5. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own store.  In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being dedicated to her business.

Veronica is excited to be taking her 3th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 3 years after she started selling 4 to 5 pieces of clothes at home every month. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, accesories and bed linen. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, to invest in more products, and she is planning to buy a computer; she also wants to have telephone service and to have a store with all kinds of merchandise. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she need the loan to her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothing and bed linen

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Señora G. de 38 Años es casada con el señor Octaviano Calel Madre de 6 hilos es muy trabajadora, trabaja en la elaboracion de trajesitos para bebe y luego le surgio la idea de elaborar telas para bardar guipiles para eso compro un telar de pedal para tejer telas y venderlos por mayor, toda su familia trabaja y le apoya en su negocio, se siente feliz porque su deceo es promocionar de varias formas su negocio y poder vender a otros lugares ella sueña con tener a sus hijos profecionales y tener une bonita casa, le agradece a Dios Y a fape por brindarle su apoyo con el credito
texts.en:
G. is 38 years old and is married to Octaviano Calel. She is the mother of six and is a very hard working woman. She makes baby clothing and someone has suggested that she weave cloth to make guipiles (a type of blouse); this is why she bought a foot powered loom, so that she can weave cloth and sell it for a profit. Her entire family works for and supports her business and she is happy because her desire is to promote the various forms of her business and be able to sell in other locations. She wants her children to have professional careers and to have a nice house. She is thankful to God for giving her support and help with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloth

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca II” ubicado en el  Distrito Cabanillas, Provincia de San Román y Departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella tiene estudios superior completo, se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos.

La señora Elena esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años,  nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para incrementar  su capital para su negocio de  venta de Cosméticos.

Con este crédito de S/. 900.00 nuevos soles, comprará más productos y podrá ampliar su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de Bijouteria.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas y lo que gana con el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca II” which is located in the District of Cabanillas, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Elena completed her college education and earns her living selling cosmetics.

Sra. Elena has been working with Manuela Ramos for four years. She says the first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to increase the capital for her cosmetics business.

With this loan of 900 PEN, Elena will buy more cosmetics so that she can expand her business. Her dream for the future is to open a store where she sells personal accessories. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the seminars and the earnings from her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba Ríos Pérez desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de dulces en una escuela primaria donde les ofrece un buen precio de acuerdo a la economía de los padres.
La señora decidió dedicarse a este oficio por circunstancias ajenas a ella, pues su esposo empezó a enfermarse lo cual ya no pudo trabajar. Rosalba es un mujer muy trabajadora que a pesar de los momentos tan difíciles siguió adelante, para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, en este momento pide de su apoyo ya que necesita comprar más mercancía para el nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
For 10 years Rosalba has been selling sweets at a primary school where she offers good prices, matching the economic level of the parents. She decided to dedicate herself to this job due to external circumstances: her husband began to fall ill, reaching the point where he could no longer work. Rosalba is a very hard-working woman who despite such difficult moments, forges ahead, offering her children a better quality of life. At this moment, she is asking for your help. She needs to buy merchandise for the new school year.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: RESUPPLYING HER CANDY STORE

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una madre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de comida en un puesto ambulante situado en un mercadillo del distrito en donde  vive, ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos durante las mañanas y parte de la tarde, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Silvia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos, lo que le generara un aumento de ventas y por consiguiente un aumento en sus ganancias, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Silvia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es lograr tener su propio restaurante. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una buena mujer y le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 57 year old mother who lives with her family in the District of Chepén, an agricultural area with considerable business activity. This district is part of Chepén Province and located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lamayeque region.

Silvia has been selling food as a street vendor for several years at the flea market in her district. She offers her customers different dishes in the mornings and part of the afternoons. The revenue she generates from this business helps to support her family financially.

Silvia wants to expand her business by purchasing more ingredients to prepare her dishes, increase her sales, and continue generating more income. She does not have sufficient capital, which is why she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Silvia is a hardworking and determined woman. Her greatest wish is to open her own restaurant. The people who know her consider her to be a good woman who is very respectful.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Elvira Sonia

texts.es:
Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” desde hace ocho años atrás, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene estudios superior incompleto.  Ella tiene dos hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad.
Elvira tiene una tienda de abarrotes y a la vez lleva mercadería a Cusco dos veces a la semana donde  distribuye al por mayor. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará  un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes.    
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio de abarrotes. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Elvira has been a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) for eight years. This Communal Bank is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, single, and has two children (ages 9 and 5). Elvira did not complete her college education.

She has a grocery store and brings back merchandise twice a week from Cusco where products are sold in bulk. With the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital.

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 1000 PEN for buying groceries. Her dream is to grow her grocery business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the loans and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Eulalia Modesta

texts.es:
La Señora Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Huaynaroque”  ubicado en la provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene  05 hijos, todos independiente,   la señora estudió educación primaria completa.

La señora Eulalia esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicita un nuevo  crédito S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles con el cual  podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar,  harina, aceite y otros insumos, para poder incrementar su negocio.  

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital y poder mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la honradez.
texts.en:
Sra. Eulalia is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huaynaroque”, which is located in the Province of San Román in the Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, widowed, and has five children who are all independent. Eulalia completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years. Eulalia says the first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN and it allowed her to increase the capital for her grocery business.

She is currently requesting a new loan of 1000 PEN so that she can buy rice, sugar, flour, oil, and other supplies to increase her business. Her dream for the future is to increase her capital and improve her business. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the promptness and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour, oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Idalia Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Idalia Andrea R., tiene la edad de 37 años, habita acompañada de su pareja de vida, y tiene un hijo pequeño, que estudia el preescolar, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de abarrotes, productos del hogar y personal, desde hace 7 años la cual es la fuente de ingreso importante de la familia.

Ella antes laboraba como domestica y con  su liquidación realizo la compra de productos para el inicio de su negocio, ella desea ampliar su negocio para una mayor comodidad para la ubicación su mercadería y atención a sus clientes, y es para este fin que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo este plan, que beneficie a futuro a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Idalia Andrea R. is 37, lives with her life partner and has a young child in preschool. For the past 7 years they have operated a small grocery store selling home and personal items, which is an important source of income for the family. She used to work as a maid and used her severance pay to buy the items to start the business. She wants to expand the size of the business make stocking the shelves and helping customers easier. To that end she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to expand the business and benefit her small family in the long run.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her locale

loans.name: Ligia Janett

texts.es:
Ligia Janett tiene 45 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Ella inicio por la necesidad de buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia, la necesidad de salir adelante y colaborar con la economía de su familia hizo que años empezara un negocio se encuentra situado en su vivienda, con este negocio brinda a su familia la estabilidad que necesita. Ella desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. El objetico el de financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos entre otros.
Ella es una mujer tranquila, trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Ligia Janett is 45 years old and manages a store. She started her business out of necessity as a way of earning income for her family, moving them forward, and helping with the finances. Her business was established years ago in her home and provides the stability that her family needs. She wants to acquire more products in order to expand her business and increase her sales. This loan will be used to buy candy, natural refreshments, basic grains, and other products.

Ligia is a peaceful, hardworking, and enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, natural refreshments, basic grains, and other products

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Antonio R. G., tiene la edad de 46 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, y sus 3 hijos adolecentes, ellos se dedican a los estudios, el señor labora como albañil, contando con una experiencia de más de 20 años.

Habitan en un barrio muy peligroso, y su hogar es muy humilde, sus tres hijos y su mujer viven expuestos a la delincuencia que mora cerca de ellos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción con el objetivo de levantar un muro en la parte trasera del hogar y brindarle a su familia una mayor seguridad, y la tranquilidad de padre de familia de velar por los suyos.
texts.en:
Cesar Antonio R. Guzman is 46 and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with his life partner and 3 teenage children. The children study and he is a mason with more than 20 years experience. They live in a very dangerous neighborhood in a a humble home, and his three children and wife are subject to the crime nearby. For that reason he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a rear wall and so provide more security for the family and more peace of mind for the father that looks after them.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esmeralda C. E., tiene la edad de37 años, habitante de un humilde barrio, con su pareja de vida y sus 2 hijos, laboran en una zona franca, y ella tiene una venta de cosméticos, fue con el apoyo de su esposo que logro realizar las primeras compras de la mercadería de cosméticos, ellos habitan en un pequeño y humilde hogar, el cual desean mejorar a futuro.

Es para este propósito que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, con el invierno han tenido muchos problemas de inundación que daña los electrodomésticos y las condiciones del hogar, con la inversión podrán edificar un muro al frente que no permita los estragos que ocasiona el invierno, sobretodo la tranquilidad de madre de ofrecerle a sus pequeños un mejor lugar donde morar y habitar de forma digna.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda C. E. is 37 years old and lives in a modest neighborhood with her life partner and their 2 children. They work in the free trade zone and she has a business selling cosmetics. It was with the support of her husband that she was able to make her first purchases of cosmetics merchandise. They live in a small and modest house, which they would like to improve in the future. It is for this reason that they are requesting a loan to buy construction materials. During the winter, they have had a lot of problems with flooding that has damaged their appliances and the conditions of the home. With this investment they will be able to build a wall in front that will prevent the damage that the winter brings, and will provide tranquility for the mother as she will be able to provide her small children with a better dwelling and a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a wall to prevent flooding

loans.name: Talentos En San Martin Group

texts.es: ESTANDO EN UN  AREA MUY MONTAÑOSA Y HERMOSA,  A ORILLAS DE LA CARRETERA VENDE DOÑA CIPRIANA JUANA M. L.,  SIENDO MADRE DE  5 HIJOS  Y LUEGO DE REHACER SU VIDA CON SU NUEVA PAREJA HACE 6 AÑOS  LE AGRADECE A DIOS POR LAS OPORTUNIDADES DE LA VIDA.  AL  LADO DE SU ESPOSO HA LOGRADO CADA DIA AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO DE ROPA AMERICANA   Y SATISFACER AL CLIENTE CON LA PRENDA QUE LE INTERESA.  TAMBIEN  SE UNE AL GRUPO LA SEÑORITA ANA PATRICIA  P. A.  LA CUAL VENDE  ARTICULOS ESCOLARES  Y FANTASIA VARIADA, CADA DIA LOS NIÑOS PIDEN MUCHAS COSAS Y ELLA QUIERE SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON COSAS NUEVAS Y LLAMATIVAS PARA QUE COMPREN.  LA SEÑORA JUANA BERTILIA C. B. DESDE HACE TIEMPO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ARTICULOS DE CATALOGO, TAMBIEN ALGUNAS COSAS DE TIENDA.  SU META ES CADA DIA PODER VENDER  MÁS Y SER UNA AYUDA PARA SU FAMILIA, Y  DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS.  COMO MADRES ELLAS DOS DECEAN LA SUPERACION DE SUS HIJOS Y QUE LLEGEN A SER UNOS PROFESIONALES PARA PODER SER EXITOSOS EN LA VIDA  Y ELLA PODER SALIR ADELANTE Y AYUDAR EN LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Located in a very mountainous and beautiful area, Cipriana Juana M. L. sells her wares on the edge of the highway. She has 5 children and now lives with her partner of six years. She is thankful to God for life’s opportunities. Together with her husband, she has managed to grow her American clothes selling business and provide her clientele with the clothes they require. Ana Patricia P. A. also forms part of the group and sells a range of educational items and toys. Each day the children come and ask for different items, so she would like to stock her stall with new and eye-catching things to sell to them. Juana Bertilia C. B. has been selling items from catalogues and shops for several years. Her goal is to be able to sell more items day-by-day and be able to help her family and give the best life for her children. As mothers, these women want their children to get ahead and to become professionals and successful in life. They also want to progress and help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy American apparel

loans.name: Rosalina Alejandra

texts.es: Rosalina Alejandra es una mujer muy responsable tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido muy provechosos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocios sus inicios fueron muy difíciles actualmente los precios están muy variantes, pero no se deja abatir. Este financiamiento es destinado para comprar sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatilla, shorts.
texts.en:
Rosalina Alejandra is a very responsible woman who has 3 children who are no longer dependent on her. Rosalina sells general merchandise. This is not the first time that she has received financial assistance. She has been involved with this business for 6 years and initially it was difficult. The prices are very variable but have not lowered. The loan will go towards the purchase of sandals, trainers/sneakers, shorts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general merchandise

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Antonia G., tiene la edad de 54 años, habitante de la zona Laureles Norte, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad, que apoyan a su madre en los gastos en que ella incurre mensualmente, ella se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones y labora como empleada domestica, desde hace mas de 3 años.

Ella laboraba en Costa Rica y con sus ahorros logro mejorar las condiciones de su hogar con el propósito de aumentar las rentas de sus cuartos, ahora ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que permitan la edificación del muro izquierdo de su casa con el propósito de dividir su terreno con el de su vecino, a futuro espera ampliar los cuartos hasta donde llegue la construcción del muro que se construirá. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar las rentas de sus cuartos, favoreciendo a la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Antonia G. is a resident of the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is 54 years old and is a single mother to 6 older children that help her with her monthly expenses. She rents rooms for a living as well as working as a domestic employee for the past 3 years. She used to work in Costa Rica and with her savings she was able to make improvements to her home with the intention of increasing the rent for her rooms. She is now requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a wall on the left side of her house to divide the land with her neighbor. In the future, she hopes to expand the rooms out to wall that that will be built. This investment will allow her to ask more rent for her rooms and improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Antonio C. G. tiene la edad de 48 años vive en el barrio Dennis Larios, es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar,  tienen 6 hijos, mayores de edad que laboran y obtienen ingresos económicos, que apoyan a su padres en los gastos del hogar, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 30 años y fue gracias al apoyo de sus padres que comenzaron sus días en esta actividad.

Dentro de sus planes esta la diversificación de sus cultivos, pero primero desea realizar un mantenimiento a sus terrenos, y para este fin solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes, e insecticidas que permitan una mejor producción que favorezca a la economía del hogar, sobre todo porque desean mejorar a futuro su humilde hogar y dejárselo de herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Antonio C. G. is 48 y ears old and he lives in the Dennis Larios district. He is married and his wife is a stay at home Mom. They have 6 adult children and they all work and earn an income. They all help their parents in covering the household expenses. They are agriculturists, their business being more than 30 years old. It was thanks to the parents that they started working in this same line of work. His plans include the diversification of their harvests but first he wants to first provide some needed maintenance to their fields. To this end he requests a loan, to purchase agricultural products, fertilizers and insecticides to allow for a better harvest, translating into a better revenue for the family. Above all he wishes to improve the future of their humble home and inherit it to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his plantations.

loans.name: Leyla Mercedes

texts.es: Leyla Mercedes tiene 60 años, su actividad es una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente. Ella ofrece productos como sal, azúcar, aceite, jabón y refrescos, hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con un carretón en el que proporcionaba la venta de chancho con yuca y lo realizaba en las calles razón por la que su hija le propone instalar una pulpería en su casa y así nace el establecimiento. Ahora el financiamiento es para la compra de una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Leyla Mercedes is 60 years old. She runs a "pulpería" [a small grocery store] located in her house. She has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time, so she has demonstrated that she is an excellent client. At her store, she offers products like salt, sugar, oil, soap, and soft drinks. She has had her business for more than six years. She started with selling pork and yucca from a street cart, and when her daughter suggested that she open a pulpería in her house, her store was born. This loan is to buy a great variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La Señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Huaynaroque”  ubicado en la provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene  03 hijos,   la señora estudió educación primaria completo.

La señora Faustina esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicitará de  un nuevo  crédito S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles con el cual  podrá comprar más arroz, azúcar, harina y otros insumos, para poder incrementar su negocio.  También nos cuenta que se dedica al servicio de alquiler de carpas y escenarios.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital y ampliar su negocio de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y la puntualidad de pago.
texts.en:
Ms. Faustina is a member of the "Señor de Huaynaroque" Communal Bank, which is located in the province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She finished primary school. Ms. Faustina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos ["Manuela Ramos Movement"] for 3 years. She reports that her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase capital for her grocery store. Currently, Ms. Faustina is requesting a new loan of 2,000.00 nuevos soles. With this loan, she will be able to buy more rice, sugar, flour, and other staple items, in order to grow her business. She says that she also provides a service renting tents and stages. Her dream for the future is to increase her capital and to expand her grocery business. The savings and regularity of payments are the things she most likes about her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La Señora Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el centro poblado D. Mataro Chico del distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 04 hijos (02 dependientes y 02 independientes), la señora estudio educación primaria completo.

La señora Felipa esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, incrementó el capital D.  su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes.

Con este crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche, etc.  También nos cuenta que se ayuda con la producción D. su chacra.

Su sueño para el futuro  es aumentar el capital D. su negocio para luego mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones  y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Mataro Chico communal bank, located in the populated center of Mataro Chico in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja, province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 53 years old, a widow, and has 4 children (2 dependent and 2 independent). She completed primary school studies. Felipa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past 4 months. She tells us that with the first loan of 500 PEN that she received, she increased her working capital for her grocery sales. With this loan of 500 PEN, she will purchase food items such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. She also tells us that it is helpful with the production of her farm. Her dream for the future is to increase her working capital to then improve the business. What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and the trainings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food items such as rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Justacio Ramiro

texts.es: Justacio Ramiro es un hombre casado, hace más de 31 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de zapatería, la ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del Mercado Santos Bárcenas por lo que en este lugar es donde hay más afluencia de clientes. Esta no es la primera vez que ha realizado financiamientos pues son muy importantes para la mejora de su actividad. Actualmente este financiamiento es para realizar las compras de hilo encerado, lija, pega, clavos y suela pues estos materiales son necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Justacio Ramiro is a married gentleman who has been providing shoe repair services for more than 31 years. His business is located on the outskirts of the Santos Bárcenas Market, a place that experiences high customer traffic. This is not the first time he has received a loan since the funds have been important in making improvements to his business.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to buy waxed thread, sandpaper, nails, glue, and soles since these materials are needed for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase waxed thread, sandpaper, nails, glue, and soles

loans.name: Erving Manuel

texts.es: El señor Erving Manuel A. C. es un joven de 24 años vive en la comunidad de los Ríos, es soltero sin hijos trabajador desde muy temprana edad, con el apoyo de sus padres pudo adquirir un terreno para laborar en esta actividad, ahora tiene  una experiencia de más de 15 años, uno de sus planes primordiales para el negocio está la diversificación de sus cultivos, pero para llegar a realizar esta inversión desea brindarle un mantenimiento optimo a sus terrenos, y para esto solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que permitan atacar la afectación de plagas y los problemas del suelo, esta inversión favorecerá su economía para la inversión a futuro de nuevos fuentes de trabajo o la reinversión a su negocio, y de esta mnera irse labrando su futuro y estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Mr. Ervin Manuel A. C. is a young man, 24 years of age, living in the community of Los Rios. He is single and has no children. He has worked since a very young age and with the support of his parents he was able to acquire a plot of land to cultivate. He has 15 years' experience in the business. One of his primary goals is to diversify his harvests. But to be able to have invest in such a venture he needs to carry out some needed maintenance to his land. To this end he requests a loan, to purchase fertilizers, fungicides, and agricultural products that will help him combat the pests and to enrich the soil. The investment will translate to better earnings, for the creation of new sources of income or reinvestment in his agricultural business. This way he plans on forging a future for himself and achieve financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his plantations.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La Señora Filomena es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Huanca II”  ubicado en el distrito de Cabanillas, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y tiene 03 hijos, (02 de  ellos son independientes),  la señora no cuenta con estudios.

La señora Filomena esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo recibido de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de Comida.

Con este nuevo crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles comprará más alimentos para la venta de comida  y así poder vender mas cantidad.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener restaurante.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y lo que gana con los ahorros.

Foto: notese en la foto un poco oscura ya que se encuentra dentro de un toldo donde vende sus alimentos en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Sra. Filomena is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca II”, which is located in the District of Cabanillas, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 52 years old, single, and has three children (two of whom are independent). Filomenta did not attend school.

Sra. Filomena has been working with Manuela Ramos for four years. She says the first loan she received was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to increase the capital for her food business.

With this new loan of 300 PEN, Filomena will buy more ingredients for preparing food which will help generate more sales. Her dream for the future is to open a restaurant. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members and the earnings from her savings.

Please Note: The photograph is a bit dark since it was taken inside the tent where she sells food as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Juana Aurora

texts.es: Juana Aurora, no pudo obtener la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios, pero sabe leer y escribir. El negocio al que ella se dedica es una pulpería, tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo han salido adelante, inicio hace más de 5 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha mejorado notablemente con su actividad. En la actualidad  solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, gaseosas y detergente.
texts.en:
Juana Aurora did not have the opportunity to finish her education, but she knows how to read and write. She manages a grocery store that she started more than five years ago. Juana has four children who are dependent on her and she tries very hard to get ahead.

This is not the first time she has utilized financing to make notable improvements to her business. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy candy, bread, natural refreshments, sodas, and detergents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, bread, natural refreshments, sodas, and detergents

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria del Carmen O., es casada y con su esposo y sus 3 hijos habitan en el Barrio el Edén sus hijos se dedican a los estudios secundarios y el mayor en la universidad, ella y su esposo se laboran en la agricultura, desde hace mas de 15 años, fue con el apoyo de sus padres que lograron obtener un terreno, y la posibilidad de comenzar a labrar su futuro gracias a los conocimientos que adquirieron en esta actividad.

Uno de los problemas que más le han ocasionado dificultades ha sido la falta de flujo económico para la compra de materiales que brindan un mejor mantenimiento a sus cosechas, dentro de sus planes a futuro esa la diversificación de los cultivos, y solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, insecticidas que permitan atacar al afectación de plagas, que disminuye la producción y les ocasiona problemas económicos, sobre todo que el hijo mayor ahora que estudia la universidad, los gastos han incrementado y esperan con esta inversión mejorar las ventas para el beneficio económicos de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen O. is married and together with her husband she has 3 children. They live in the district of Eden and their children are all in high school, though the eldest is in university. She and her husband have been agriculturists for the past 15 years. It was with the support of her parents that they managed to buy a plot of land. With their help and their experience in the business they have forged a future for themselves. One of the greatest challenges that she has faced has been the lack of funds to purchase the needed materials that would yield better harvests. Part of her plan is to diversify the plantations. The request a loan to purchase fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides that will help them combat pests that damage the harvest and affect the family finances. Their eldest son is attending university and the tuition fees have been increasing. In order to support him they hope that this investment in their business will help improve the family economy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her plantations.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Es socia del Banco comunal “Dulce Amanecer” desde hace cinco años atrás, ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y tiene tres hijos de: 21, 18 y 13 años respectivamente.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales de alpaca como: chompas, casacas, cojines, bolsos, maletines, adornos para sala, alfombras etc., estos productos los vende en su puesto de artesanía que tiene en una zona comercial en Puno. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró lana de alpaca para tejer.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos artesanales.
Su sueño es exportar artesanía a otros Países, a la vez salir al mercado Nacional. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las Charlas educativas y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of community bank “Dulce Amanecer” for five years. She lives in the province and district of Puno, is aged 46 years, married, and has three children aged 21, 18 and 13 years. Francisca has completed her secondary education. She sells handicrafts made from Alpaca wool such as jumpers/sweaters, jackets, cushions, bags, briefcases, ornaments, carpets, etc. She sells these products from her handicrafts stall located in one of Puno’s shopping districts. Francisca used her first loan of S/.300.00 (Peruvian Soles) received from Movimiento Manuela Ramos to buy Alpaca wool to weave. She is requesting a loan of S/.1000.00 (Peruvian Soles) to buy handicrafts. Her dream is to export handicrafts to other countries. What she likes most about the community bank are its educational talks and sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es: Victor tiene 24 años, el se dedica al transporte desde hace 1 año, trabaja en su mototaxi, la cual le brinda sus ingresos que le permiten sustentar a sus padres y a su casa, su sueño es tener su propia empresa y lograr incrementar sus ingresos para darle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, el solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Victor is 24 years old. He has been providing public transport for the past year. He uses his motorcycle transport and it provides him with an income to help support his parents and cover the household expenses. His dream is to have his own company and increase his earnings. He wishes to provide his parents with a better quality of life and to this end his requests a loan. He will invest in maintenance repairs to his motorcycle transport. He is eligible for a loan following good personal references and his ability to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Doris Gilda

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de kantuta” desde hace cuatro años atrás, ubicado en la Provincia de Yunguyo y Departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con grado de instrucción superior completo, tiene tres  hijos, uno de 20 y dos de 18  años de edad (gemelos).
Gilda tiene su propio restaurant de comida desde hace ocho años. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y ampliar su negocio.
Ahora solicitará  un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles  para comprar  vívereres.   
Su visión es tener un hotel. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Doris has been member for four years of the community bank “Flor de kantuta” (kantuta flower), it's located in the Province of Yunguyo, department of Puno, she is 50, married, finished high school and has three children ages 20 and eighteen (twins). Doris has had her own restaurant for eight years. With the first loan (500 new soles) requested to the Manuela Ramos movement she was able to increase working capital and expand her business. She now requests a loan of 1,000 new soles to buy groceries. She envisions having a hotel. What she likes the most about the community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and groceries to prepare food

loans.name: Aura Dilia

texts.es: La señora Aura Dilia A. R., tiene la edad de 32 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en una funeraria como vendedor , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tienen dos pequeños varoncitos que estudian la primaria y necesitan del apoyo económico de sus padres para que puedan seguir estudiando , la señora  Alemán desde hace cinco años labora como domestica en una casa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de recursos  económicos para poder comprar de  una sola vez materiales de construcción pero con mucho esfuerzos ha ahorarrado para una parte del material y lo que quieren es terminar de construir una pared de la vivienda para poder tener mas espacio y tener mas comodidad, para el goze de los miembrod e su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Dilia A. R. is 32 years old. She lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband, who works in a funeral home as a vendor. She contributes with her husband towards the household expenses especially because they have two young boys in primary school and they want to keep them in school. For the past five years Mrs. A. has worked in the private house cleaning industry. The greatest challenge that she faces is the insufficient financial resources to purchase construction materials. She has saved enough to be able to purchase part of the materials they need to finish building a wall in their home, to have more space and greater comfort and enjoyment of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in her home.

loans.name: Bertha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Bertha Elizabeth G.  vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, la gran variedad de su gastronomía y también por ser la cuna de grandes deportistas.
 
Doña Bertha tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad que  estudia en la escuela de la ciudad, al momento se encuentra muy contenta ya que esta embarazada, tiene 4 meses de gestación, su esposo trabaja en un bar, la casa en la que vive no es de su propiedad por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Bertha es una mujer que realiza múltiples actividades ya que se dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL, lleva l3 años este negocio y nos comenta que le va bien vendiendo estos cosméticos, también se dedica a la venta de ropa en su tiempo libre, además se dedica al arreglo de casas y su horario es de lunes a viernes de 10 a.m. a 11 a.m., en la tarde se dedica a su hijo.
 
Es su sexto crédito que realiza en la fundación y  el nuevo crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yambal, su gran sueño es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Bertha Elizabeth G. lives in the downtown core of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic heritage, the wide range of traditional foods and for being the birthplace of many great athletes. Bertha is 29 years old, she is married and she has an eight-year old son who attends school in the city. She is very happy to report that she is four months pregnant. Her husband works in a bar. The house they live in is not their own. They rent. Bertha is a business woman that carries out many different activities. She sells Yanbal brand products and she has been doing so for the past 13 years. She has found success in selling cosmetics. But she also sells clothing in her spare time, and she works in the private house cleaning industry. Her work schedule is from Monday to Friday from 10am to 11 am, and in the afternoons she takes care of her son. This is the sixth loan she has requested. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of more Yanbal brand products. Her dream is to have her own store from where to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase skin creams, perfumes, fashion jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Don Luís es un hombre trabajador que se ha dedicado a la confección de ropa por muchos años, pues ha hecho su medio de trabajo. Logrando a si apoyar  a su familia.
Junto con su esposa se apoyan ya que ella es modista lo que ha sido de mucho para lograr las ventas.
Es su quinto ciclo en A fodenic que a través de los financiamiento ha incrementado la producción de ropa. El cual comprara telas,  variadas de colores, hilos, bordados, y hará algunos mantenimiento a sus maquinas para seguir dando un servicio de calidad. y poder vender.
texts.en:
Luis is a hard working man that has many years' experience in making clothes. He has forged his own business and this has given him the ability to support his family. He and his wife provide support for each other in the business. She is a fashion designer and this has been a great advantage for sales. This is his fifth loan through Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner). Through these loans he has increased the production of clothes. He will purchase fabric in various patterns and colors, threads and trims but he will also provide some needed maintenance to the sewing machines, to continue to work with excellence and sell accordingly.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various fabrics, threads, and trims.

loans.name: Jerick José

texts.es: El señor Jerick José R. E., tiene la edad de 32 años habita en el barrio Buenos Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como domestica en una casa privada  para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ; ya que ellos tiene dos hijos que necesitan de su apoyo y cariño de ambos . El señor R.  labora como jardinero desde hace once años en una casa privada, la mayor necesidad es que no gana lo suficiente para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción ya que es de escasos recursos económico y quiere mejor parte de su humilde casita que con esfuerzos de esposa han logrado construir, su hogar es de madera y desean reforzar la infraestructura para preparase para la temporada de invierno que amenaza con la estabilidad de la familia, ocasionándole una inseguridad y e incomodidades para todos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jercik Jose R. E. is 32 years old and he lives in the district of Buenos Aires, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Together with his wife, who works in the private house cleaning industry, he provides for the household expenses. They have two children that are still need their love and support. Mr. R. has worked as a private gardener for the past eleven years. His greatest challenge is that he does not have sufficient funds to purchase building materials needed to improve their humble home. Their home is made of wood and he wants to reinforce the support structure of the house to prepare for the winter months that always compromise the comfort, safety, and security of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: Gladys Maria se dedica a brindar el servicio de fotocopiadora, es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Gladys Inició su negocio hace mas de 10 años con pocos clientes y en la actualidad ellos son sus amigo, vecinos y tiene más, Gladys es una mujer trabajadora que ajusta su horario a las necesidades de sus clientes, por eso la competencia aunque es fuerte, no pueden con ella que se mantiene firme, pues se sostiene con calidad en el servicio. Este crédito será para la compra de otra fotocopiadora y poder proporcionarle mantenimiento a la que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Gladys Maria provides photocopy services. She is a married woman and she has three young children in her care. Gladys started her business more than 10 years ago and with only a few clients. Today her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. Gladys is a hard working woman and she adjusts her work schedule to meet the needs of her clients. Even though the competition is strong they can't compete with her. She keeps her business strong with good client service. This loan will be used to purchase another photocopier and to provide some needed maintenance to the one she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, un distrito pesquero que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Empezó vendiendo en un puesto ubicado en el mercadillo de su ciudad y luego decidió reinstalarlo en su domicilio, actualmente se vale de este negocio para brindarle a su esposo una ayuda con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Su negocio goza de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, ya que Luz siempre trata de brindarles productos de primera calidad y un trato amable. Actualmente ella ha pensado en ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luz es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a los suyos gozar de una buena calidad de vida y de un futuro estable. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luz is a Mom, she is 44 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, a fishing district belonging to the province of the same name and located in the region of La Libertad. It is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital region of Lambayeque. She sells grocery store items from a store fashioned from a section in her house. She started out selling her products from a stand in a small market in the city but she later decided to relocate to her house. She invests her herself in this business to be able to help her husband support the family. Her business sees great support from her clients because Luz always provides them with top quality products and good client service. She is planning on expanding her business by increasing the variety of her products. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner). The loan of 1500 nuevos soles will help her reach her goal. Luis is a hardworking woman who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest dream is to see her family enjoy a good quality of life and to see them have a stable future. The people that know her consider her to be an honest and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items to increase the variety in her store.

loans.name: Grecia Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Grecia Cecilia B. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza natural, su centro histórico, la variedad de su gastronomía y también por ser la cuna de grandes deportistas.
 
Nuestra socia es muy joven tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hija de 8 años, su esposo trabaja en un bar que es de su propiedad, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Cecilia se dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL, tiene 8 meses trabajando en este negocio, también se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas de fantasía, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora de lunes a sábados, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad ya que no tiene un local propio.
 
Es su segundo crédito en la fundación y  fue su cuñada quien la incentivó para formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras. Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos, ropa  y joyas.
 
Su sueño es estudiar belleza.
texts.en:
Grecia Cecilia B. lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic center, the variety of its cuisine and also because it is the birthplace of some famous athletes. Cecilia is very young. She is 23 years old, lives in a common law marriage and has a daughter who is 8 years old. Her husband works in a bar on his property. With this work together they have managed to build their own home. Cecilia sells Yanbal brand cosmetics. She has had this business for 8 months, and she also sells clothing and costume jewelry. She does not have fixed work hours, and she works from Mondays through Saturdays. She takes her products around the city, since she does not have her own store. This is her second loan with the FUNDACION ESPOIR; her mother-in-law encouraged her to become part of this group of enterprising women. With the new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics, clothing and jewelry. Her dream is to study beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Brigida Del Carmen

texts.es: Brigida Del Carmen de 38 años, vende ropa y calzado para poder solventar sus gastos, desde muy joven comenzó con ayuda propia porque no tenía aun un ingreso fijo. En ocasiones va a recorrer las calles para encontrar clientes que le compren su mercadería, pero el estilo de venta que ella tiene es venderles a sus amigas y vecinos. Tiene un lugar establecido, pero sabe que vende más ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulante.  Ella quiere continuar con sus ventas por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo pantalones, camisas, sandalias entre otras cosas. Uno de sus sueños es termina de construir su casa y ya establecer un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Brigida Del Carmen is 38 years old. She sells clothing and footwear to be able to meet her financial obligations. She started at a very young age because she didn't have a fixed income. Occasionally she roams the streets to find customers to buy her merchandise, but she prefers to sell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to continue her sales so she is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, sandals and other things. One of her dreams is to finish building her house and to establish a local for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Deisy De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora Deisy De La Nube C. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza natural, su centro histórico, la variedad de su gastronomía y también por ser la cuna de grandes deportistas.
 
Doña Deisy se dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL y joyas de plata, lleva 2 años trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y  4 años en la venta de joyas, los vende a sus familiares y amigos.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito con la banca comunal, fue una amiga la que la incentivó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que buscan el bienestar para sus familias.

La Señora Deisy tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años, su esposo trabaja en una entidad pública, no posee casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

El nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos YANBAL y joyas.

Su sueño es estudiar educación inicial básica en la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Deisy de la Nube C. lives in downtown Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic downtown, its diverse cuisine and also, as the birthplace of great athletes. Doña Deisy sells Yanbal products and silver jewelry for a living. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and selling jewelry for 4 years. She sells to her friends and family. This is her fourth loan with the communal bank. It was a friend who encouraged her to join this group of women that have their family's welfare at heart. Señora Deisy is 32 years old, married and has a 4 year old daughter. Her husband works for a public entity. She doesn't own her own house but rents instead. She is going to invest the loan from Fundación Espoir in Yanbal products and jewelry. Her dream is to study early education at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, Yanbal cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia pertenece al Banco comunal “Las Retamas” desde hace seis años atrás, ubicado en el departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene estudios superior completo.
La señora Herminia tiene tres hijos de: 14, 10 y 8 años.
Herminia se dedica a la docencia y a la vez tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en comprar arroz y azúcar.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos de primera necesidad.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una Mini Market. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal es la unidad, transparencia y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Herminia has belonged to the community bank “Las Retamas” for six years, it's located in the department of Puno, she is 39 years old, married and finished high school. Herminia has three children ages 14, 10 and eight. Herminia is a teacher and also has a general store. With the first loan (300 new soles) from Manuela Ramos she bought rice and sugar. She requested a loan of 600 new soles to buy basic need products. Her dream for the future is to have a mini market. What she likes the most about her community bank is the unity, transparency and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic need products.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La Señora Honorata es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el distrito de Santiago de Pupuja,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y no tiene  hijos,   la señora estudió hasta 3ro de  educación secundaria.

La señora Honorata esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como ovino y otros.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar  más animales para luego venderlas en cantidad.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar los animales y  mejorar su casa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, tener un seguro de vida y las capacitaciones que dan.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the community bank “Mataro Chico” located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, province of Azangaro, department of Puno, she is 43, married with no children, she studied until 3rd year of secondary school. Honorata has been working with Manuela Ramos for four months, with her first loan of 500 new soles she was able to increase working capital of her buying and selling business of livestock, such as sheep and other. Currently, she requests a loan for 800 new soles, money that will allow her to buy more livestock to sell in the future. Her dream is to have better livestock and improve her home. What she likes the most about her community bank are the meetings, having life insurance and the training she gets.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ovine livestock

loans.name: Isabel Alicia

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cuatro años atrás, ubicado en el distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, cuenta con secundaria completa.
Se dedica a la venta de llicllas (mantas), que lleva a La Paz - Bolivia, del mismo modo trae animales menores como: Chanchos y ovejas para vender en la feria de Yunguyo, en esta actividad viene trabajando desde hace diez años. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó en su capital de trabajo.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar  su mercadería de llicllas.
Su visión es llevar ropa al por mayor a Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a member of the communal bank "Chojchoni" for four years. She lives in the Copani district in the Yunguyo province in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, single, and finished high school. She works selling "llicllas" (traditional blankets) that she brings to La Paz, Bolivia. She also brings animals to sell, including pigs and sheep to sell in the market in Yunguyo. She has been doing this work for ten years. With her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 nuevos soles, she increased her working capital. She is asking for a new loan of 1000 nuevos soles to increase her blanket merchandise. Her dream is to bring wholesale clothing to Lima. The things she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of blankets

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cinco años, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene grado de instrucción primaria completa.  Vive con sus cuatro hijos, de: 10, 08, 06 y 04 años de edad.
Se dedica a la venta de frazadas, cubrecamas y llicllas (mantas) desde hace seis años, los días sábados y domingos en La Paz Bolivia. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles para aumentar su mercadería, comprará colchas, frazadas, llicllas y otros al por mayor.
Su visión es ser mayorista con la misma mercadería en La Paz Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Isabel, 27, has been a member of the “Chojchoni” communal bank located in Copani district, Yunguyo province, Puno department, for the last 5 years. She is married and completed primary school. She lives with her four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 4 years of age. She has sold blankets and bedspreads for the last 6 years on Saturdays and Sundays in La Paz, Bolivia. With her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to increase her capital. She will request a 1000 new sol loan to increase her merchandise; she will buy bedspreads and blankets at wholesale. Her vision is to become a wholesaler of the same merchandise in La Paz, Bolivia. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blankets, bedspreads and others at wholesale.

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Humberto José de 38 años de edad está casado el matrimonio cuenta con 2 hijos ambos están a su cargo. El señor se dedica a la venta de granos básicos  desde hace 20 años, pues tiene muchos clientes que llegan a su local a comprar los diferentes productos. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite entre otros debido a que cuenta con muchos pedidos y de esta forma poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que cuenta.
texts.en:
Mr. Humberto José is 38 years old, and is married. He has two children, both of whom he takes care of. He has been working in the sale of basic grains for 20 years, and he has many clients who come to his area to buy the different products. He is applying for this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, and oil, among other things, due to his increasing demand; this way he will be able to fill all of his current orders.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace un año atrás, ubicado en el distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo,  departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, no tiene estudios (analfabeta), tiene ocho hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad (12 y 10 años respectivamente).
Se dedica a la compra venta de animales menores como: ovejas y chanchos que lleva a la feria de Zepita. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar animales menores como: chanchos y ovejas.
Su visión es crecer en su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a member of the "Chojchoni" communal bank since last year. The communal bank is located in the district of Copani, Yunguyo province, department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and did not receive any education (she is illiterate). She has eight children, of whom two are minors (12 and 10 years of age, respectively). She buys and sells young animals like sheep and pigs, which she brings to the market in Zepita. Her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos ["Manuela Ramos Movement"] was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy sheep. She is requesting a new loan of 1,500.00 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy young animals like pigs and sheep. Her aim is to grow her business. The savings is what she most likes about her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young animals (piglets and lambs)

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
El señor C. V. Julio César tiene una hija de 10 años el cual le envía una pensión. 
Vive en el local donde funciona su negocio. Se dedica a la venta de plásticos como: tapers, baldes, cocinas entre otros artículos para el hogar.Hace dos años se dedica a dicho rubro.
Se propone el crédito para que así pueda comprar mas mercadería e incremente su capital. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Su aspiracion es tener un local propio y asi poder surtir mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. C. V. Julio César has a ten-year-old daughter, whom he supports financially. He lives in his place of work, where he sells plastic items such as Tupperware containers, buckets, stoves, and other household items. He has been doing this work for two years. He is applying for this loan so that he can buy more merchandise and increase his capital. He has good personal and professional references. His goal is to have his own shop; this way his business would be able to expand more.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jaqueline Vanessa

texts.es:
Jacqueline es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kantuta” desde hace nueve meses atrás, está ubicado en la Provincia  Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con grado de instrucción secundaria completo, tiene un niño de año y medio.
Se dedica a la elaboración de canastas desde hace dos años atrás y las distribuye al por mayor en la feria de Juliaca, los días lunes. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  pudo  aumentar su capital.
Solicitará  un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar materiales de elaboración de canastas.   
Su visión es ampliar  su negocio en otros departamentos del país. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal es la forma de trabajo de su promotora.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 20, has been a member of the “Flor de Kantuta” communal bank for the last 9 months. It is located in Yunguyo province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and finished secondary school. She has an 18-month-old son. She has made baskets for the last two years that she sells at wholesale in the Juliaca market on Mondays. She used her first, 500 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will ask for a new, 1000 new sol loan, to buy basket weaving raw materials. Her vision is to expand her business into other departments in the country. What she enjoys most about her communal bank is her advisor’s way of working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basket weaving supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
