La Señora Rosa Luz O. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, en la comunidad  corazón de Jesús lugar en donde se puede admirar unos paisajes sin igual, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 11 años, su hija de 24 años es madre soltera, trabaja para solventar sus gastos, su hijo de 22 años vive y trabaja en el extranjero, su hija de 19 años es casada y vive de manera independiente, sus hijos de 17 y 15 años estudian en el colegio, su hijo de 11 años estudia en la escuela, su esposo es  de profesión albañil, con el sacrificio del trabajo diario ahora la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar y a la cría de cuys, ganado, chanchos, los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva hortalizas las cuales las vende en su casa y también le sirven para su consumo.
 
Es su segundo ciclo en la fundación, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.
 
Su sueño es acabar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Luz O. lives outside of the city of Cuenca, in the Corazón de Jesús community, a place of beautiful landscapes without equal. The people of this region work in agriculture and the raising of livestock. Rosa is 42 years old; she is married and has six children, aged 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, and 11. Her 24-hear-old daughter is a single mother who works to cover her own expenses. Her 22-year-old son lives and works abroad. Her 19-year-old daughter is married and lives independently. Her 17- and 15-year-old children are in secondary school, and her youngest son is still in primary school. Her husband is a builder, and with daily work and sacrifice, the house in which they live is now their property. Rosa does domestic work in her home, and she also raises guinea pigs, cattle, and pigs, which she sells in her community. She also works in agriculture, cultivating vegetables which she sells in her home and also uses to feed her family. It is her second cycle with FUNDACION ESPOR, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens. Her dream is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina ha vendido ropa, cosméticos, joyería y perfumes desde hace 7 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Luz Marina comenzó su negocio cuando su pareja la dejó y ella tuvo que encontrar una manera de mantenerse, pues no ha sido fácil pero con la ayuda necesaria y con la buena administración que aplica a su actividad son la clave para su éxito. Este financiamiento es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, lápiz labial entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina has been selling clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, and perfume for seven years. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan. Luz Marina began her business when her partner left her, and she had to find a way to support herself. It has not been easy, but having the necessary help and her good business management skills are the keys to her success. This loan is for the purchase of perfume, creams, cosmetic treatments, and lip pencils, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
La señora Jerónima es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico” ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y no tiene   hijos, la señora tiene educación primaria completo.

La señora Jerónima esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la Venta de Abarrotes.

Con este nuevo  crédito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros para luego venderlas en cantidad.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una casa y ser mayorista.  

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la reunión y la capacitación que reciben porque siempre aprenden algo.
texts.en:
Jerónima, 48, is a member of the “Mataro Chico” communal bank located in Santiago de Pupuja district, Azángaro province, Puno department. She is single and has no children. She completed elementary school. She has been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 4 months. She tells us that her first loan, which was for 500 new soles, was to increase her business capital. She is a grocer. With this new, 800 new sol, loan she will buy rice, sugar, pasta and others for subsequent bulk sales. Her dream for the future is to own a house and to be a wholesaler. What she likes best about her communal bank are the meetings and the training sessions they receive because they always learn something.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta and others at wholesale.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa María es una madre D. familia D. 53 años D. edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. San Pedro D. Lloc, un distrito D. L. provincia D. Pacasmayo que se encuentra ubicado en L. región L. Libertad, aproximadamente a dos horas D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a L. venta D. ceviche (plato tipico del perú hecho  a base D. pescado, mariscos frescos cocinados en zumo D. limón) y papa rellena (plato típico del país consistente en una masa D. papa cocida y frita que se rellena D. carne y diversas especias). ElL. ofrece estos dos productos en venta en un puesto ambulante que está situado dentro del mercado D. su localidad. Este negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Elsa desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos D. comida con los cuales espera ampliar su nivel D. ventas y por consiguiente ampliar sus ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

ElL. es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que L. conocen L. consideran una persona amable y tranquiL..
texts.en:
Elsa María is a 53-year-old mother; she lives together with her family in the San Pedro D. Lloc district, a district of the province of Pacasmayo which is in the region of L. Libertad, approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque. She works selling ceviche, a typical Peruvian dish maD. from fresh fish and shellfish cooked in lime juice, and papa rellena, another typical national dish consisting in a mass of potato that is boiled, fried, and filled with meat and spices. She sells these two products from a cart in the local market. Her business allows her to help her husband with family expenses. Elsa María would like to expand her business with the purchase of more ingredients that would allow her to prepare more dishes, with which she hopes to increase the level of her sales and her income. To reach this goal, she has decided to apply for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very responsible woman and extremely dedicated to her family; her greatest desire is to give them a better quality of life. The people who know Elsa consider her to be a very friendly and peaceful person.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs to grow food stall business

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Beatriz D. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad  corazón de Jesús, lugar en donde se puede admirar unos paisajes sin igual, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Doña Rosa se dedica al arreglo de casas, trabaja en esta actividad desde la corta edad de 15 años, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 7 a.m. a 13 p.m., lo de más de su tiempo lo dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL, lleva 1 año trabajando en este negocio.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación, sintiéndose muy contenta con sus amigas ya que conforman un lindo grupo de mujeres que luchan para entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad y un bebe de 9 meses, su primer hijo se encuentra en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos ya que su sueño es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Beatriz D. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the Corazón de Jesús community, a place where one can admire unequaled views. The population is dedicated to farming and the raising of animals. Doña Rosa makes a living cleaning houses. She has been working at this since she was 15 years old. Her working hours are from Monday to Friday from 7am to 1pm. The rest of the time she sells YAMBAL products, this she has been doing for a year. This is her second loan with the Foundation. She feels very happy with her friends, they form a nice group of women working to bring a better future for their children. Mrs. Rosa is 30 years old, married and has one son of 8 years and a 9 month old baby. Her older son is in the neighborhood school. Her husband is a builder. They live in their own home. With this new loan from the Espoir Foundation she will purchase more cosmetics for resale. It is her dream to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yambal creams, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Etelvina Z. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad corazón de Jesús, lugar en donde se puede admirar unos paisajes sin igual, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Nuestra socia se tiene de 31 años, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 10, 4, 3 años de edad, sus 3 primeros hijos están en la escuela, con su duro trabajo ha logrado sola construir su propia casa.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos, chanchos, estos los vende en su casa y también hace entregas a domicilio, tiene 13 años trabajando en este negocio,  también se dedica al tejido en su tiempo libre, realiza gorras, bufandas, etc.
 
Es su segundo crédito en la fundación y está  muy contenta ya que en las reuniones se encuentran con sus amigas en donde conversan  de varios temas.
 
El nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Etelvina Z. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the Corazón de Jesús community. It is a place where you can admire the incomparable scenery. The people there devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals. She is 31, single, and has four children. The children are 11, 10, 4, and 3 years old. Her first three children attend school. Through her hard work she has managed, on her own, to build her own house. She raises animals like chickens and pigs. She sells them at her house, and she also makes home deliveries. She has been working in this business for 13 years. She also knits, and in her free time she makes hats and scarves, etc. This is her second loan with the Fundación. She is very happy because she and her friends talk about various topics at the meetings. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy pigs, chickens, and feed. She dreams of buying a vehicle for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry S. is a married woman who lives in Tandayag, Amlan, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a dry goods business. Her husband, Ceclio S., 28 years old, works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have a 9-year-old child. Cherry joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cherry has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.

Cherry is borrowing 19,500 PHP for her 9th loan, which she intends to use to pay for more inventory of dry goods to resell so that she can continue to save up for her child's future education. Cherry S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Alejandro Martín

texts.es:
El Sr. V. G. Alejandro Martin es separado, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 5 años en edad escolar. VIve en casa de su hermana.
Se dedica a la venta de articulos para el hogar hace tiempo y solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y es persona que se esfuerza para lograr sus objetivos. 
Desea formar un negocio de venta de locería.
texts.en:
Mr. V. G. Alejandro Martin is separated and has two school age children of 14 and 5 years of age. He lives in his sister's house. He makes a living selling home products and has been doing this for some time. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business. He has good personal references and is a person that works hard to achieve his goals. He wants to start a pottery business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda P. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Socheat Chab, live along the National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. Besides her children, Mrs. Chinda P.  also has her mother who is a lotus farmer living with her. 

In the past, Chinda used to sell fruit and her husband used to be a mason. Now the couple are security guards. The house where they live is broken down in some parts, so it’s difficult for family members to stay there. Hence Chinda is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to repair her house; any remainder of the loan will be used to provide capital for her mother’s farming business.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and provide capital for her mother’s farming business

They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Mr. Lin H. and his wife are garment factory workers. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 for his mother to expand her grocery store, and he will use a part of the loan to concrete his house foundation.

loans.use: To help his mother expand her grocery store and to concrete his house foundation.

texts.en:
Agnes C. is a married woman who lives in Cantil-e, Barangay Habitat, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, raising hogs and a dry goods business. Her husband, Jesus, who is 55 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 24 and 29 years old.

Agnes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Agnes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use purchase more stock for the general store and dry goods businesses so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and to purchase additional pigs to raise. 

Agnes C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 53 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. L. is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 2 nhóm 12 (Nhóm 12).

L. is married and has four adult children. To making a living, she raises cattle for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the second taken out by the borrower from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrower in the group:

Kiều Thị M. is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

L. Nguyễn Thị (20206030019) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu 2 nhóm 12 (Nhóm 12).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Kiều Thị M. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Slamas

texts.en:
Mrs. Slamas H., is a widow with one son who assists his mother in the fish business. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Slamas H. has been selling fish for more than nineteen years. She buys them from fisherman along the Mekong River for resale to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Slamas has had Kiva loan several times already. As she wants to expand her business and generate more income, she is requesting another loan of 1,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To expand her fish business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mr. Yen Y. is 46 and his wife, Mrs. Ry Um, is 35. They live in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Pen. They have been married since 1990 and have four children — three sons and one daughter. Yen and his wife are vegetable farmers. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain their farm, so Yen is asking for his first loan of $150 to increase his capital.

loans.use: For farming supplies.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong V. N. is 29 years old. He has two small children. As a farmer, he has grown rice and vegetables and has raised pigs for years. The agricultural products are used to meet his family's food demand. A part of the food is sold to earn income. Since he became our client, his weekly repayments are prompt. Currently, he wants to request a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai I, (in the photo), age 46, has been married to Mr. Po I, age 53, since 1979. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of them are garment factory workers and another one is a monk. The family is living in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhai has been selling groceries at her home for six years. She buys grocery items from Prek Phnao market. Her husband assists her in the business. She does not have her own transportation, so traveling costs her a lot of money. 

Therefore, Sokhai is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is from the village of Lucban. She is 46 years old. Vilma is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products from Avon, Boardwalk and MSE in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mr. Sitha C. and his wife, Mrs. Sambok Se, were married in 1992 and have four children - two sons and two daughters. All of them attend school. They live in a small village on National Road number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sitha has been selling cows for more than ten years. He buys cows from the nearby village and district and sells them to a middleman who comes to buy at his house. His wife stays at home and does housework. 

Sitha asked for a Kiva loan one time already. He now is asking for his second loan of $200 to continue his business buying cows for resale.

Please note: Sitha’s wife is shown in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc H. P. is 19 years old and has 2 children. She has been running a grocery shop in her village for 2 years. Her business creates very stable income. Having been a client of SEDA for 2 years, she paid her weekly repayments well. Currently, she wants to access a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy  more products for her shop to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum Y. (pictured here), 30 years old, and her husband, Mr. Samun Loun, 31, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters. She also has her elderly mother living with her.

Sarum and her husband rent space in their house to garment factory workers. She also sells groceries at her home. She is asking for a loan, her first, of $1,000 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor P. is 52 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. He is from the village of Rizal within the municipality of Quirino, Isabela Province on the islands of Luzon. To make a living, Victor plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been in business for over 35 years and earns approximately 28000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Victor joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Victor is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Victor from ASKI. He plans to use all additional revenue to improve his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Mr. Sros M. (pictured above), is 29 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sarorn Leng, is 24 years old. They live in a suburb about 15 kilometers outside Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. He also has his elderly mother living with him.

Sros grows vegetables on his farmland in the village. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $800 to purchase cows to raise and use for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise and use for growing vegetables

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en:
Uyen N. T. P. is 22 years old with two children. She is living with her family in Xuan Non commune. She has been running a small grocery shop that provides a stable income for her family.

Uyen joined SEDA’s credit program two years ago. She has a good repayment record. Currently she is asking for a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more kinds of products to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of products to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita S. is 64 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Andarayan South within Solana municipality, Cagayan province on the islands of Luzon. Estelita operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products such as toothpaste, soap, candies and canned goods to the local community. Estelita has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month.

In 2005, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from ASKI. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her line of products. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Estelita from ASKI. She plans to use all additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her line of products

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat M., 34, and her husband Mr. Samrith Deth, 38, have been married since 1996 and have three children — one son and two daughters, all in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Tat M. has been a silk weaver for eight years and her husband has been a taxi driver for fourteen years. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 52 years old with two children, one of whom graduated from the local school. Ms Ly has managed a restaurant serving breakfast and lunch to workers for five years. Her restaurant is always crowed with customers and she can earn 120,000 VND profit per day. A client of SeDa for four years, she has used loans effectively. She now wants a loan of 8,502,000 to buy a big refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a big refrigerator.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky L. is from the village of Lucban. She is 44 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Vicky owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Vicky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-oeun C. is 27 years old and her husband, Mr. Sarom Rorn, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2004 and have two young children, a son and a daughter. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Sam-oeun has been a silk weaver for twelve years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them in a Phnom Penh market. Sam-oeun is asking for a loan of $400 US to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: felicitas tiene 70 alños, ella vive en casa con sus dos hijos los cuales son mayores ella trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de especerias el que le permite tener sus ingresos para el sustento de su casa, Felicitas sueña con implementar su negocio y tener mas puestos de venta, para poder tener mayores ingresos, se le propone el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 70 years old and lives at home with her two adult sons. She has a small business selling assorted wares that allows her to have income to support her household. She dreams with stocking her business with more items and having additional sales stands so that income can be higher. The loan is proposed to her because her personal references and ability to pay are good.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Seamseng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seamseng C. is a widow with four children - three sons and one daughter. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, one is a horse cart driver and one attends school. Her husband died nearly a year ago. 

Seamseng has been a silk weaver since 2002. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $800. She will use $500 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and $300 to purchase cows to raise. Seamseng will be able to earn extra income from selling cows when they grow big enough.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving and cows to raise

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai  T. N. is 39 years old. She lives in the town of Dong anh with her family. Two of her children attend secondary school. Gai  T. N. has raised hundreds of  chickens for eggs since she was out of work in 2004.  Her business is quite good and she can get a stable income from it. The first loan that she received in 2006 helped her a lot in running the business and encouraged her to stay with our program. She would like a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy 200  baby chickens and feed  for them.

loans.use: to buy 200  baby chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien  T. N. is 53 years old. She  has two children who attend university and high school and it is difficult for her to have enough money to pay for their education fees. Therefore, she makes protection gloves to earn her daily income. She has been a SEDA client since 2006 and has repaid her loan(s) very well. She would now like a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy raw material.

loans.use: to buy raw material

loans.name: Magalli Pilar

texts.es: Magalli tiene 43 años, vive en casa con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al negocio de ferreteria desde hace varios años, ella desea invertir el credito en la compra de mercaderia para incrementar su negocio, porque es el sustento de sus familia, se le brinda el credito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Magalli is 43 years old. She lives in her own home together with her three children. She has sold hardware store items for many years and she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise to expand her business. This is the only source of income for her family. She may receive a loan following good personal references and her ability to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ngô

texts.en:
T.  Ngô Thị (20206030028) is a 33 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. T.  owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. T.  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, T.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T.  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to invest in expanding the business. T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by T. from SEDA. T.  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T.  Ngô Thị (20206030028) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T.  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T.  kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, T.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T.  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T.  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kiều

texts.en:
S. Kiều V. (20206030023) is a 43 year-old man living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  He is married and has 3 school-aged children. S. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. S. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by S. from SEDA. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand his business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


S. Kiều V. (20206030023) là 43 tuổi Nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, S. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  S. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, S. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, S. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của anh ấy/ anh ấy.  S. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua phương tiện vận chuyển để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  S. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Kiều

texts.en:
D. Kiều V. (20206030024) is a 45-year-old man living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. He is married and has 2 school-aged children. D. owns and operates a business making and selling a variety of food products in the local community. D. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. D. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Dung from SEDA. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand his business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D. Kiều V. (20206030024) là 45 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, D. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử D. mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử D. để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  D. dự định sẽ sử D. nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en: Baatarsuren T. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvurhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of his sons, ages 20 and 22, are university students. His wife, Dulam, is currently unemployed. Baatarsuren graduated from the Mongolian Institute of Art and Design as a pastelist in 1985. Today he uses his talents to operate a successful wooden crafts manufacturing business. He designs and produces a variety of wooden furniture in addition to painting and decorating his products. Baatarsuren started his business in 1996 and has since also started working for a private furniture company to supplement his earnings. Baatarsuren takes great pride in his work and has become an experienced craftsman. His business is well-known throughout the local area for his high-quality products. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase new materials and paints for his wooden crafts business.

loans.use: To purchase new materials and paints

loans.name: Trần

texts.en: K. Trần Thị is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three grown-up children. To making a living, K. owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. K. has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5.000.000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture products. K. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her second loan from SEDA. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. No. 20206030027. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. K. Trần Thị (20206030027) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, K. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. K. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. K. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. K. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture bamboo products

loans.name: Jamsranjav

texts.en: Jamsranjav N., 38 years old, lives with his wife and five children in Uvs province of Mongolia. His oldest four children, ages 10 to 17, attend a local secondary school while the youngest, age 2 years old, stays at home with Jamsranjav's wife. Jamsranjav operates a horse-cart business in his town. He carries supply loads and people from the local market to various destinations. For each trip, he earns between 3,000-5,000 tugriks (MNT). His business earnings are currently not sufficient to take care of his family; therefore, his wife is planning to operate a boot-making business. In order to start the new business, the couple needs to have start-up capital. They estimate they will earn 12,000 MNT per day as business profit. They are very modest and hardworking people. His wife says, "I am planning to make many boots and sell them. With our business earnings, we want to open savings accounts in a bank for our children." Jamsranjav is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials for 10 boots in order to begin the new business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for boots

loans.name: Đào

texts.en: T. Đào Thị is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has four grown-up children. loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Norma runs a general store, earning her income by selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory, to serve as working capital and to repair her store. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, serve as working capital and repair her store

loans.name: Phú Mẫn 2 - Nhóm 15 (Nhóm 15) Group

texts.en:
T. Đặng Thị is a 50 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 2 - Nhóm 15 (Nhóm 15).

T. is married and has two adult-aged children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, namely raising cattle for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 26 years and earns approximately 2,600,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her first loan from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. Nguyễn Thị N. is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her recycling services business.
2. Nghiêm Thị TH. is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
4. Nguyễn Thị T. is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria A. is from the village of Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Candelaria owns and operates a business venture in piggery. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Candelaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets and pig feed. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann G. is 38-years old married and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: a general store, a tricycle transport service and a hog fattening business. She lives in Purok Gumamela, Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

By working hard in her general store, tricycle transport service and hog fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP. Mary Ann would like to borrow 14,000 PHP so that she  can  purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan was for 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

Mary Ann aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02) Group

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị (20206020015) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).

L. is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Hoàng Thị C. (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.



L. Trần Thị  (20206020015) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Hoàng Thị C. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene V. is from the village of San Juan. She is 23 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a weaving business, selling sedge mats and mattresses to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make more woven products. Irene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah L. is a married woman who lives in Purok Serena, Barangay Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a food vending business and a piggery business. Her husband, Rodel, who is 40 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 11 and 18 years old. 

Leah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leah has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $140, raising the family's standard of living.

loans.name: Mr. Vun Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank has eleven people who live in Kaoh Kosal village in Takeo province. Mr. V. Chhun is the village bank president selected by the other members. He was born in 1965 and is a village chief. He is also a fisherman, while his wife, Mrs. Srey Keo, is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice which she sells to support the family. He is the father of two children: one is a farmer while the other attends school. 

Mr. V. Chhun's problem is that his wife’s field has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, Mr. V. Chhun is seeking a loan to buy pesticide.

loans.use: To buy pesticide

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang H. N. is 51 years old and has three children who are attending at high school and secondary school.

Giang is a builder but the salary is not stable. Therefore, he manages a range of houses for rent to earn more income to cover family expenditures and school fees.

Giang is a good client of SEDA. Currently, he wants to obtain a loan of 6,322,000 VND to pay school fees because the new school year is coming.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Mrs. Alfonsa M. is from Barangay Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years of age, is married, and is blessed with two children of whom one is now a college student and the other is still an infant.

Alfonsa is presently engaged in selling RTW (Ready-To-Wear clothes) from GTY, as well as selling AVON Products and running a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been engaged in selling GTY and AVON products for five years already and earns approximately Php 1,300 a month. Her husband also gives her regular support from his income as a mango sprayer.

Just this year, Alfonsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As a newly-recognized member of PMPC under its Regular Loan Program, she requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as her first loan, to be used as additional capital for her business selling RTW and AVON products.

Alfonsa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions, especially in meeting her basic needs, saving for the future, loan repayments, her children’s education, insurances, and possible business expansions.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business selling RTW and AVON products  and for her little sari-sari store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and is married with two children.

He owns a furniture gallery that he took over from his immediate family and this is what has made him well-known in his local area. He has a good reputation and good manners.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner CHF-ACSI that he wants to invest in renovating his business place. He is planning to expand his business in the future.

loans.name: Lydia Cabrera's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lydia C., 62 years of age, is married and is a resident of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Lydia C.’s Group. Lydia is blessed with four children of whom three are already married while the other one is an adult but still single. To earn her living, Lydia decided to engage in doormats and used clothes (locally known as “okay-okay”). She is also doing some agricultural activities with kangkong as her product (also known as water spinach or morning glory). She also receives support from her husband, Florentino, who is a laborer. For 21 years already, selling doormats and okay-okay, Lydia has been able to maintain these business activities. Now, the couple is earning an average net income of not less than Php 3,000 a month which is so helpful to their family. In 2007, upon hearing the good news about Paglaum MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in northern Mindanao (awarded for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award in 2006) Lydia joined the cooperative. As an active member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program of Paglaum MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, Lydia has successfully repaid a loan of Php 3,000. Lydia is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000 as her 7th loan, to be used as additional capital for her doormats and okay-okay business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, for loan repayments to PMPC, savings, insurances, her grandchildren’s education and for possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her doormats and okay-okay business

loans.name: Mindalena

texts.en:
Mindalena A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. VI, Brgy. Tugawe, Dauin, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  blacksmithing and farming businesses. Her husband Wilfredo A., who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are between 3 and 23 years old. 

Mindalena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mindalena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 30000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 24000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 30000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase steel for knife blades and wood for her business.  By expanding her business, she will be able to continue to save up for the future education of her children and house repairs. Mindalena A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Kyogaya Womens Group - Jinja

texts.en: Anna I.’s business occupation for the last 10 years has been animal husbandry, principally rearing cows, goats and poultry.  She operates in Namulesa, Jinja.  She envisages a situation where her weekly profits of 180,000 shillings will be increased if she gets this loan.  She plans on buying more goats, cows and poultry to resell. She also intends to pay for the construction costs of a poultry house she is planning on building.  Anna, 50, a happily-married mother of four school-going children, says constant livestock and poultry diseases have often played havoc with her businesses. Anna was working as an accounts income tax clerk before she took root in this business.  Over the course of time in the future, she is planning on purchasing a Friesian cow that she hopes will produce enough milk for her to sell and get much more profit.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah G. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child. Norah has a business of selling snacks, which she has had for 2 years. Norah has a second business farming in her village.

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase oil and flour and pay the farmers. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Norah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Norah hopes to own a hotel. Norah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing her business and helping her to pay the farmers on time. 

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more oil and flour

texts.en:
Josefina E. is from the city of Minaog, Dipolog City. She is 51 years old. Josefina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling peanuts in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Josefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP10,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lorena is requesting a new loan of PHP10,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Josefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice A. is a single mother of four children, who lives and works within the Githurai area in Nairobi. She normally sells vegetables to middle and low income clients, which includes kale, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been in this business for eight years now and she takes home a profit of Kshs 1,100 per month.

Eunice joined Kadet after introduction by another client and this will be her first loan, which she will use to add more stock of vegetables for resale.

She hopes to expand her business further in future.

loans.use: To add more stock for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, sous préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce, de condiments alimentaires, du bois de chauffe et des gâteaux (friandises).
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les huit précédents. 
RAMATA F. du groupe Djiguiya compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des paquets de condiments alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises le plus généralement à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group, all married, are on the average 46 years old, with 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, the sub-prefecture of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. These women know each other as relatives and friends; their line of business is selling food condiments, heating wood and cookies (sweet treats). They are now on their ninth solidarity loan, having duly repaid eight previous loans. Ramata F., one of the group members, plans to use her loan to purchase packs of food condiments. She generally stocks up in Bamako and sells from home, at the Fana market and the local markets, retail, for cash and on credit, to a client base composed of both women and men. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 60,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards everyday family expenses, with the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food condiments

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 2 brothers. He is an experienced construction worker who began working in construction at a young age. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase lumber for his newest project. He expects the coming year to be successful and expects to further increase his business productivity. He also plans on taking on bigger projects. His business income is important, as it is used to support his family in collaboration with his 2 brothers to meet their high expenses.

loans.use: Purchase lumber
